That _ [she]95-lydia _ could be in any danger from the deception never entered [my]141-mrs. gardiner head . That such a consequence as _ this _ should ensue , [you]4613-you may easily believe was far enough from [my]141-mrs. gardiner thoughts . "[141-mrs. gardiner]

" When [they]4614-they all removed to [Brighton]40-brighton , therefore , [you]4613-you had no reason , [I]141-mrs. gardiner suppose , to believe [them]4614-they fond of [each other]3157-each other . "[141-mrs. gardiner]

" Not the slightest . [I]141-mrs. gardiner can remember no symptom of affection on either side ; and had any thing of the kind been perceptible , [you]4613-you must be aware that [ours]4616-ours is not [a family]4617-a family , on which it could be thrown away . When first [he]100-mr. darcy entered [the corps]4592-the corps , [she]95-lydia was ready enough to admire [him]100-mr. darcy ; but so [we]4616-ours all were . [Every girl in , or near [Meryton]9-meryton]4619-every girl in , or near meryton , was out of [her]95-lydia senses about [him]100-mr. darcy for the first two months ; but [he]100-mr. darcy never distinguished _ [her]95-lydia _ by any particular attention , and , consequently , after a moderate period of extravagant and wild admiration , [her]95-lydia fancy for [him]100-mr. darcy gave way , and [others of [the regiment]656-the regiment]4620-others of the regiment , who treated [her]95-lydia with more distinction , again became [her]95-lydia favourites . "[141-mrs. gardiner]

* * * * *

It may be easily believed , that however little of novelty could be added to [their]2276-their fears , hopes , and conjectures , on this interesting subject , by its repeated discussion , [no other]2277-no other could detain [them]2276-their from it long , during the whole of the journey . From [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's thoughts it was never absent . Fixed there by the keenest of all anguish , self reproach , [she]93-elizabeth could find no interval of ease or forgetfulness .

[They]2276-their travelled as expeditiously as possible ; and sleeping one night on [the road]1317-the road , reached [Longbourn]7-longbourn by dinner - time the next day . It was a comfort to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth to consider that [Jane]94-jane could not have been wearied by long expectations .

[The little Gardiners , attracted by the sight of a chaise]2279-the little gardiners , attracted by the sight of a chaise , were standing on the steps of [the house]3026-the house , as [they]2276-their entered [the paddock]2281-the paddock ; and when [the carriage]3221-the carriage drove up to the door , the joyful surprise that lighted up [their]2276-their faces , and displayed itself over [their]2276-their whole bodies , in a variety of capers and frisks , was the first pleasing earnest of [their]2276-their welcome .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth jumped out ; and , after giving each of [them]2276-their an hasty kiss , hurried into [the vestibule]1023-the vestibule , where [Jane]94-jane , who came running down stairs from [[[her]94-jane mother]261-her mother 's apartment]2285-her mother 's apartment , immediately met [her]94-jane .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , as [she]93-elizabeth affectionately embraced [her]94-jane , whilst tears filled the eyes of [both]796-both , lost not a moment in asking whether any thing had been heard of [the fugitives]2287-the fugitives .

" Not yet , "[94-jane] replied [Jane]94-jane . " But now that [[my]94-jane dear uncle]3946-my dear uncle is come , [I]94-jane hope every thing will be well . "[94-jane]

" Is [[my]2287-the fugitives father]3259-my father in [town]285-town ? "[2287-the fugitives]

" Yes , [he]3259-my father went on Tuesday as [I]94-jane wrote [you]93-elizabeth word . "[94-jane]

" And have [you]93-elizabeth heard from [him]3259-my father often ? "[2287-the fugitives]

" [We]4625-we have heard only once . [He]3259-my father wrote [me]94-jane a few lines on Wednesday , to say that [he]3259-my father had arrived in safety , and to give [me]94-jane [his]3259-my father directions , which [I]94-jane particularly begged [him]3259-my father to do . [He]3259-my father merely added , that [he]3259-my father should not write again , till [he]3259-my father had something of importance to mention . "[94-jane]

" And [[my]2287-the fugitives mother]3230-my mother -- How is [she]3230-my mother ? How are [you]93-elizabeth all ? "[2287-the fugitives]

" [[My]94-jane mother]3230-my mother is tolerably well , [I]94-jane trust ; though [her]3230-my mother spirits are greatly shaken . [She]3230-my mother is up [stairs]529-stairs , and will have great satisfaction in seeing [you]93-elizabeth all . [She]3230-my mother does not yet leave [[her]3230-my mother dressing - room]4629-her dressing - room . [Mary]98-mary and [Kitty]97-lady catherine , thank [Heaven]221-heaven ! are quite well . "[94-jane]

" But [you]94-jane -- How are [you]94-jane ? "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " [You]94-jane look pale . How much [you]94-jane must have gone through ! "[93-elizabeth]

[[Her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister , however , assured [her]93-elizabeth , of [her]93-elizabeth being perfectly well ; and [their]2289-their conversation , which had been passing while [Mr.]2290-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner were engaged with [[their]2289-their children]2291-their children , was now put an end to , by the approach of [the whole party]531-the whole party . [Jane]94-jane ran to [[her]94-jane uncle]583-her uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt , and welcomed and thanked [them]2289-their both , with alternate smiles and tears .

When [they]2289-their were all in [the drawing - room]530-the drawing - room , the questions which [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had already asked , were of course repeated by [the others]517-the others , and [they]2289-their soon found that [Jane]94-jane had no intelligence to give . The sanguine hope of good , however , which the benevolence of [her]94-jane heart suggested , had not yet deserted [her]94-jane ; [she]94-jane still expected that it would all end well , and that every morning would bring some letter , either from [Lydia]95-lydia or [[her]95-lydia father]264-her father , to explain [their]2289-their proceedings , and perhaps announce the marriage .

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , to whose apartment [they]2289-their all repaired , after a few minutes conversation together , received [them]2289-their exactly as might be expected ; with tears and lamentations of regret , invectives against the villanous conduct of [Wickham]156-wickham , and complaints of [her]95-lydia own sufferings and ill usage ; blaming every body but [the person to whose ill judging indulgence]2298-the person to whose ill judging indulgence the errors of [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter must be principally owing .

" If [I]96-mrs. bennet had been able , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [she]96-mrs. bennet , " to carry [my]96-mrs. bennet point of going to [Brighton]40-brighton , with all [[my]96-mrs. bennet family]3708-my family , _ this _ would not have happened ; but poor dear [Lydia]95-lydia had [nobody]3098-nobody to take care of [her]95-lydia . Why did [the Forsters]4632-the forsters ever let [her]95-lydia go out of [their]4632-the forsters sight ? [I]96-mrs. bennet am sure there was some great neglect or other on [their]4632-the forsters side , for [she]95-lydia is not the kind of girl to do such a thing , if [she]95-lydia had been well looked after . [I]96-mrs. bennet always thought [they]4632-the forsters were very unfit to have the charge of [her]95-lydia ; but [I]96-mrs. bennet was over - ruled , as [I]96-mrs. bennet always am . [Poor dear child]4633-poor dear child ! And now here 's [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet gone away , and [I]96-mrs. bennet know [he]86-mr. bennet will fight [Wickham]156-wickham , wherever [he]86-mr. bennet meets [him]86-mr. bennet , and then [he]86-mr. bennet will be killed , and what is to become of [us]2300-they all ? [The Collinses]191-the collinses will turn [us]2300-they out , before [he]86-mr. bennet is cold in [his]86-mr. bennet grave ; and if [you]86-mr. bennet are not kind to [us]2300-they , [brother]4634-brother , [I]96-mrs. bennet do not know what [we]2300-they shall do . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[They]2300-they all exclaimed against such terrific ideas ; and [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner , after general assurances of [his]180-mr. gardiner affection for [her]2301-her and [all [her]2301-her family]1692-all her family , told [her]2301-her that [he]180-mr. gardiner meant to be in [London]5-london the very next day , and would assist [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet in every endeavour for recovering [Lydia]95-lydia .

" Do not give way to useless alarm , "[180-mr. gardiner] added [he]180-mr. gardiner , " though it is right to be prepared for the worst , there is no occasion to look on it as certain . It is not quite a week since [they]2300-they left [Brighton]40-brighton . In a few days more , [we]2300-they may gain some news of [them]2300-they , and till [we]2300-they know that [they]2300-they are not married , and have no design of marrying , do not let [us]2300-they give the matter over as lost . As soon as [I]180-mr. gardiner get to [town]285-town , [I]180-mr. gardiner shall go to [[my]180-mr. gardiner brother]3216-my brother , and make [him]3216-my brother come [home]3223-home with [me]180-mr. gardiner to [Gracechurch Street]33-gracechurch street , and then [we]2300-they may consult together as to what is to be done . "[180-mr. gardiner]

" Oh ! [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear brother]4638-my dear brother , "[96-mrs. bennet] replied [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , " that is exactly what [I]96-mrs. bennet could most wish for . And now do , when [you]4638-my dear brother get to [town]285-town , find [them]2300-they out , wherever [they]2300-they may be ; and if [they]2300-they are not married already , _ make _ [them]2300-they marry . And as for wedding clothes , do not let [them]2300-they wait for that , but tell [Lydia]95-lydia [she]95-lydia shall have as much money as [she]95-lydia chuses , to buy [them]2300-they , after [they]2300-they are married . And , above all things , keep [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet from fighting . Tell [him]86-mr. bennet what a dreadful state [I]96-mrs. bennet am in,--that [I]96-mrs. bennet am frightened out of [my]96-mrs. bennet wits ; and have such tremblings , such flutterings , all over [me]96-mrs. bennet , such spasms in [my]96-mrs. bennet side , and pains in [my]96-mrs. bennet head , and such beatings at heart , that [I]96-mrs. bennet can get no rest by night nor by day . And tell [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear [Lydia]95-lydia , not to give any directions about [her]95-lydia clothes , till [she]95-lydia has seen [me]96-mrs. bennet , for [she]95-lydia does not know which are the best warehouses . Oh , [brother]4634-brother , how kind [you]4634-brother are ! [I]96-mrs. bennet know [you]4634-brother will contrive it all . "[96-mrs. bennet]

But [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner , though [he]180-mr. gardiner assured [her]2303-her again of [his]180-mr. gardiner earnest endeavours in the cause , could not avoid recommending moderation to [her]2303-her , as well in [her]2303-her hopes as [her]2303-her fears ; and , after talking with [her]2303-her in this manner till dinner was on table , [they]2304-they left [her]2303-her to vent all [her]2303-her feelings on [the housekeeper]839-the housekeeper , who attended , in the absence of [[her]839-the housekeeper daughters]257-her daughters .

Though [[her]2303-her brother]3126-her brother and [sister]3866-sister were persuaded that there was no real occasion for such a seclusion from [the family]432-the family , [they]2304-they did not attempt to oppose it , for [they]2304-they knew that [she]2303-her had not prudence enough to hold [her]2303-her tongue before [the servants]715-the servants , while [they]2304-they waited at table , and judged it better that [_ one _ only of [the household]2312-the household]2311-_ one _ only of the household , and [the one whom [they]2304-they could most trust]2313-the one whom they could most trust , should comprehend all [her]2303-her fears and solicitude on the subject .

In [the dining - room]709-the dining - room [they]2304-they were soon joined by [Mary]98-mary and [Kitty]97-lady catherine , who had been too busily engaged in [[their]2304-they separate apartments]2315-their separate apartments , to make [their]2304-they appearance before . [One]3064-one came from [her]3064-one books , and the other from [her]3064-one toilette . The faces of both , however , were tolerably calm ; and no change was visible in either , except that the loss of [[her]3064-one favourite sister]2317-her favourite sister , or the anger which [she]3064-one had [herself]3064-one incurred in the business , had given something more of fretfulness than usual , to the accents of [Kitty]97-lady catherine . As for [Mary]98-mary , [she]98-mary was mistress enough of [herself]98-mary to whisper to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth with a countenance of grave reflection , soon after [they]2304-they were seated at table ,

" This is a most unfortunate affair ; and will probably be much talked of . But [we]2304-they must stem the tide of malice , and pour into the wounded bosoms of [each other]3157-each other , the balm of sisterly consolation . "[98-mary]

Then , perceiving in [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth no inclination of replying , [she]98-mary added , " Unhappy as the event must be for [Lydia]95-lydia , [we]2304-they may draw from it this useful lesson ; that loss of virtue in [a female]4643-a female is irretrievable -- that one false step involves [her]95-lydia in endless ruin -- that [her]95-lydia reputation is no less brittle than it is beautiful,--and that [she]95-lydia can not be too much guarded in [her]95-lydia behaviour towards the undeserving of the other sex . "[98-mary]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth lifted up [her]93-elizabeth eyes in amazement , but was too much oppressed to make any reply . [Mary]98-mary , however , continued to console [herself]98-mary with such kind of moral extractions from the evil before [them]2304-they .

In the afternoon , the two elder [Miss Bennets]111-the bennets were able to be for half an hour by [themselves]2304-they ; and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth instantly availed [herself]93-elizabeth of the opportunity of making many enquiries , which [Jane]94-jane was equally eager to satisfy . After joining in general lamentations over the dreadful sequel of this event , which [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth considered as all but certain , and [Miss Bennet]95-lydia could not assert to be wholly impossible ; [the former]347-the former continued the subject , by saying , " But tell [me]347-the former all and every thing about it , which [I]347-the former have not already heard . Give [me]347-the former farther particulars . What did [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster say ? Had [they]2304-they no apprehension of any thing before the elopement took place ? [They]2304-they must have seen [them]2304-they together for ever . "[347-the former]

" [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster did own that [he]123-colonel forster had often suspected some partiality , especially on [Lydia]95-lydia 's side , but nothing to give [him]123-colonel forster any alarm . [I]347-the former am so grieved for [him]123-colonel forster . [His]123-colonel forster behaviour was attentive and kind to the utmost . [He]123-colonel forster _ was _ coming to [us]4644-us , in order to assure [us]4644-us of [his]123-colonel forster concern , before [he]123-colonel forster had any idea of [their]2304-they not being gone to [Scotland]58-scotland : when that apprehension first got abroad , it hastened [his]123-colonel forster journey . "[347-the former]

" And was [Denny]155-denny convinced that [Wickham]156-wickham would not marry ? Did [he]123-colonel forster know of [their]2304-they intending to go off ? Had [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster seen [Denny]155-denny [himself]123-colonel forster ? "[347-the former]

" Yes ; but when questioned by _ [him]123-colonel forster _ [Denny]155-denny denied knowing any thing of [their]2304-they plan , and would not give [his]123-colonel forster real opinion about it . [He]123-colonel forster did not repeat [his]123-colonel forster persuasion of [their]2304-they not marrying -- and from _ that _ , [I]347-the former am inclined to hope , [he]123-colonel forster might have been misunderstood before . "[347-the former]

" And till [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster came [himself]123-colonel forster , not one of [you]4645-you entertained a doubt , [I]347-the former suppose , of [their]2304-they being really married ? "[347-the former]

" How was it possible that such an idea should enter [our]2304-they brains ! [I]347-the former felt a little uneasy -- a little fearful of [[my]347-the former sister]3284-my sister 's happiness with [him]123-colonel forster in marriage , because [I]347-the former knew that [his]123-colonel forster conduct had not been always quite right . [[My]347-the former father]3259-my father and [mother]3249-mother knew nothing of that , [they]2304-they only felt how imprudent a match it must be . [Kitty]97-lady catherine then owned , with a very natural triumph on knowing more than [the rest of [us]2304-they]4649-the rest of us , that in [Lydia]95-lydia 's last letter , [she]97-lady catherine had prepared [her]97-lady catherine for such a step . [She]97-lady catherine had known , it seems , of [their]2304-they being in love with [each other]3157-each other , many weeks . "[347-the former]

" But not before [they]2304-they went to [Brighton]40-brighton ? "[347-the former]

" No , [I]347-the former believe not . "[347-the former]

" And did [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster appear to think ill of [Wickham]156-wickham [himself]123-colonel forster ? Does [he]123-colonel forster know [his]123-colonel forster real character ? "[347-the former]

" [I]347-the former must confess that [he]123-colonel forster did not speak so well of [Wickham]156-wickham as [he]123-colonel forster formerly did . [He]123-colonel forster believed [him]123-colonel forster to be imprudent and extravagant . And since this sad affair has taken place , it is said , that [he]123-colonel forster left [Meryton]9-meryton greatly in debt ; but [I]347-the former hope this may be false . "[347-the former]

" Oh , [Jane]94-jane , had [we]4651-we been less secret , had [we]4651-we told what [we]4651-we knew of [him]123-colonel forster , this could not have happened ! "[347-the former]

" Perhaps it would have been better ; "[348-her sister] replied [[her]2319-her sister]348-her sister . " But to expose the former faults of [any person]4652-any person , without knowing what [their]4652-any person present feelings were , seemed unjustifiable . [We]4651-we acted with the best intentions . "[348-her sister]

" Could [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster repeat the particulars of [Lydia]95-lydia 's note to [[his]123-colonel forster wife]251-his wife ? "[347-the former]

" [He]123-colonel forster brought it with [him]123-colonel forster for [us]4651-we to see . "[348-her sister]

[Jane]94-jane then took it from [her]94-jane pocket - book , and gave it to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . These were the contents :

" [[MY]348-her sister DEAR]3018-my dear [HARRIET]205-harriet , "[348-her sister]

" [You]205-harriet will laugh when [you]205-harriet know where [I]348-her sister am gone , and [I]348-her sister can not help laughing [myself]348-her sister at [your]205-harriet surprise to - morrow morning , as soon as [I]348-her sister am missed . [I]348-her sister am going to [Gretna Green]59-gretna green , and if [you]205-harriet can not guess with who , [I]348-her sister shall think [you]205-harriet [a simpleton]3153-a simpleton , for there is but [one man in [the world]323-the world [I]348-her sister love]4656-one man in the world i love , and [he]4656-one man in the world i love is [an angel]4658-an angel . [I]348-her sister should never be happy without [him]4656-one man in the world i love , so think it no harm to be off . [You]205-harriet need not send [them]4659-them word at [Longbourn]7-longbourn of [my]348-her sister going , if [you]205-harriet do not like it , for it will make the surprise the greater , when [I]348-her sister write to [them]4659-them , and sign [my]348-her sister name [Lydia Wickham]223-lydia wickham . What a good joke it will be ! [I]348-her sister can hardly write for laughing . Pray make [my]348-her sister excuses to [Pratt]209-pratt , for not keeping [my]348-her sister engagement , and dancing with [him]209-pratt to - night . Tell [him]209-pratt [I]348-her sister hope [he]209-pratt will excuse [me]348-her sister when [he]209-pratt knows all , and tell [him]209-pratt [I]348-her sister will dance with [him]209-pratt at the next ball [we]4660-we meet , with great pleasure . [I]348-her sister shall send for [my]348-her sister clothes when [I]348-her sister get to [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; but [I]348-her sister wish [you]4661-you would tell [Sally]224-sally to mend a great slit in [my]348-her sister worked muslin gown , before they are packed up . Good bye . Give [my]348-her sister love to [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster , [I]348-her sister hope [you]4661-you will drink to [our]4660-we good journey . "[348-her sister]

" [[Your]93-elizabeth affectionate friend]4662-your affectionate friend , "[348-her sister]

" [LYDIA BENNET]95-lydia . "[348-her sister]

" Oh ! thoughtless , thoughtless [Lydia]95-lydia ! "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth when [she]93-elizabeth had finished it . " What a letter is this , to be written at such a moment . But at least it [shews]4663-shews , that _ [she]95-lydia _ was serious in the object of [her]95-lydia journey . Whatever [he]123-colonel forster might afterwards persuade [her]95-lydia to , it was not on [her]95-lydia side a _ scheme _ of infamy . [[My]93-elizabeth poor father]4664-my poor father ! how [he]4664-my poor father must have felt it ! "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]348-her sister never saw [any one]3122-any one so shocked . [He]4664-my poor father could not speak a word for full ten minutes . [[My]348-her sister mother]3230-my mother was taken ill immediately , and [the whole house]1359-the whole house in such confusion ! "[348-her sister]

" Oh ! [Jane]94-jane , "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " was there [a servant belonging to it , who did not know the whole story before the end of the day]4668-a servant belonging to it , who did not know the whole story before the end of the day ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]348-her sister do not know.--I hope there was.--But to be guarded at such a time , is very difficult . [[My]348-her sister mother]3230-my mother was in hysterics , and though [I]348-her sister endeavoured to give [her]3230-my mother every assistance in [my]348-her sister power , [I]348-her sister am afraid [I]348-her sister did not do so much as [I]348-her sister might have done ! But the horror of what might possibly happen , almost took from [me]348-her sister [my]348-her sister faculties . "[348-her sister]

" [Your]94-jane attendance upon [her]3230-my mother , has been too much for [you]94-jane . [You]94-jane do not look well . Oh ! that [I]93-elizabeth had been with [you]94-jane , [you]94-jane have had every care and anxiety upon [yourself]94-jane alone . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Mary]98-mary and [Kitty]97-lady catherine have been very kind , and would have shared in every fatigue , [I]348-her sister am sure , but [I]348-her sister did not think it right for either of [them]4670-them . [Kitty]97-lady catherine is slight and delicate , and [Mary]98-mary studies so much , that [her]98-mary hours of repose should not be broken in on . [[My]348-her sister aunt]3208-my aunt [Philips]126-philips came to [Longbourn]7-longbourn on Tuesday , after [[my]348-her sister father]3259-my father went away ; and was so good as to stay till Thursday with [me]348-her sister . [She]3208-my aunt was of great use and comfort to [[us]4673-us all]4674-us all , and [lady Lucas]114-charlotte has been very kind ; [she]3208-my aunt walked here on Wednesday morning to condole with [us]4673-us , and offered [her]3208-my aunt services , or any of [[her]3208-my aunt daughters]257-her daughters , if [they]257-her daughters could be of use to [us]4673-us . "[348-her sister]

" [She]3208-my aunt had better have stayed at [home]3223-home , "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; " perhaps [she]3208-my aunt _ meant _ well , but , under such a misfortune as this , one can not see too little of [[one]3064-one 's neighbours]4678-one 's neighbours . Assistance is impossible ; condolence , insufferable . Let [them]4678-one 's neighbours triumph over [us]4673-us at a distance , and be satisfied . "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth then proceeded to enquire into the measures which [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father had intended to pursue , while in [town]285-town , for the recovery of [[his]264-her father daughter]1127-his daughter .

" [He]264-her father meant , [I]94-jane believe , "[94-jane] replied [Jane]94-jane , " to go to [Epsom]62-epsom , [the place where [they]4678-one 's neighbours last changed horses]4679-the place where they last changed horses , see [the postilions]4680-the postilions , and try if any thing could be made out from [them]4680-the postilions . [His]264-her father principal object must be , to discover the number of [the hackney coach]4681-the hackney coach which took [them]4678-one 's neighbours from [Clapham]61-clapham . It had come with a fare from [London]5-london ; and as [he]264-her father thought the circumstance of [a gentleman]3404-a gentleman and [lady]440-lady 's removing from [one carriage]4684-one carriage into another , might be remarked , [he]264-her father meant to make enquiries at [Clapham]61-clapham . If [he]264-her father could any how discover at [what house [the coachman]1706-the coachman had before set down [his]264-her father fare]4685-what house the coachman had before set down his fare , [he]264-her father determined to make enquiries [there]325-there , and hoped it might not be impossible to find out the stand and number of [the coach]3225-the coach . [I]94-jane do not know of any other designs that [he]264-her father had formed : but [he]264-her father was in such a hurry to be gone , and [his]264-her father spirits so greatly discomposed , that [I]94-jane had difficulty in finding out even so much as this . "[94-jane]

CHAPTER VI .

[The whole party]531-the whole party were in hopes of a letter from [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet the next morning , but the post came in without bringing a single line from [him]86-mr. bennet . [[His]86-mr. bennet family]394-his family knew [him]86-mr. bennet to be on all common occasions , [a most negligent and dilatory correspondent]2326-a most negligent and dilatory correspondent , but at such a time , [they]394-his family had hoped for exertion . [They]394-his family were forced to conclude , that [he]86-mr. bennet had no pleasing intelligence to send , but even of _ that _ [they]394-his family would have been glad to be certain . [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner had waited only for the letters before [he]86-mr. bennet set off .

When [he]86-mr. bennet was gone , [they]394-his family were certain at least of receiving constant information of what was going on , and [[their]394-his family uncle]3250-their uncle promised , at parting , to prevail on [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet to return to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , as soon as [he]86-mr. bennet could , to the great consolation of [[his]86-mr. bennet sister]569-his sister , who considered it as the only security for [[her]569-his sister husband]276-her husband 's not being killed in a duel .

[Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner and [the children]1862-the children were to remain in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire a few days longer , as [the former]347-the former thought [her]347-the former presence might be serviceable to [[her]347-the former nieces]3068-her nieces . [She]347-the former shared in [their]394-his family attendance on [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , and was a great comfort to [them]394-his family , in [their]394-his family hours of freedom . [[Their]394-his family other aunt]2333-their other aunt also visited [them]394-his family frequently , and always , as [she]2333-their other aunt said , with the design of cheering and heartening [them]394-his family up , though as [she]2333-their other aunt never came without reporting some fresh instance of [Wickham]156-wickham 's extravagance or irregularity , [she]2333-their other aunt seldom went away without leaving [them]394-his family more dispirited than [she]2333-their other aunt found [them]394-his family .

[All Meryton]9-meryton seemed striving to blacken [the man , who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light]2334-the man , who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light . [He]2334-the man , who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light was declared to be in debt to [every tradesman in [the place]3023-the place]2335-every tradesman in the place , and [his]2334-the man , who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light intrigues , all honoured with the title of seduction , had been extended into [[every tradesman]2337-every tradesman 's family]2338-every tradesman 's family . [Every body]324-every body declared that [he]2334-the man , who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light was [the wickedest young man in [the world]323-the world]2340-the wickedest young man in the world ; and [every body]324-every body began to find out , that [they]324-every body had always distrusted the appearance of [his]2334-the man , who , but three months before , had been almost an angel of light goodness . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , though [she]93-elizabeth did not credit above half of what was said , believed enough to make [her]93-elizabeth former assurance of [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister 's ruin still more certain ; and even [Jane]94-jane , who believed still less of it , became almost hopeless , more especially as the time was now come , when if [they]2344-they had gone to [Scotland]58-scotland , which [she]94-jane had never before entirely despaired of , [they]2344-they must in all probability have gained some news of [them]2344-they .

[Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner left [Longbourn]7-longbourn on Sunday ; on Tuesday , [[his]180-mr. gardiner wife]251-his wife received a letter from [him]180-mr. gardiner ; it told [them]251-his wife , that on [his]180-mr. gardiner arrival , [he]180-mr. gardiner had immediately found out [[his]180-mr. gardiner brother]2346-his brother , and persuaded [him]2346-his brother to come to [Gracechurch street]33-gracechurch street . That [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet had been to [Epsom]62-epsom and [Clapham]61-clapham , before [his]86-mr. bennet arrival , but without gaining any satisfactory information ; and that [he]86-mr. bennet was now determined to enquire at [all the principal hotels in [town]285-town]2347-all the principal hotels in town , as [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet thought it possible [they]2349-they might have gone to [one of [them]2347-all the principal hotels in town]3042-one of them , on [their]2349-they first coming to [London]5-london , before [they]2349-they procured [lodgings]2351-lodgings . [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner [himself]180-mr. gardiner did not expect any success from this measure , but as [[his]180-mr. gardiner brother]2346-his brother was eager in it , [he]180-mr. gardiner meant to assist [him]2346-his brother in pursuing it . [He]180-mr. gardiner added , that [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet seemed wholly disinclined at present , to leave [London]5-london , and promised to write again very soon . There was also a postscript to this effect .

" [I]93-elizabeth have written to [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster to desire [him]123-colonel forster to find out , if possible , from [some of [[the young man]787-the young man 's intimates in [the regiment]656-the regiment]4691-the young man 's intimates in the regiment , whether [Wickham]156-wickham has any relations or connections , who would be likely to know in what part of [[the town]1054-the town [he]123-colonel forster has now concealed [himself]123-colonel forster]4694-the town he has now concealed himself]4689-some of the young man 's intimates in the regiment , whether wickham has any relations or connections , who would be likely to know in what part of the town he has now concealed himself . If there were any one , that [one]3064-one could apply to , with a probability of gaining such a clue as that , it might be of essential consequence . At present [we]4696-us have nothing to guide [us]4696-us . [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster will , [I]93-elizabeth dare say , do every thing in [his]2353-his power to satisfy [us]4696-us on this head . But , on second thoughts , perhaps [Lizzy]93-elizabeth could tell [us]4696-us , what relations [he]2353-his has now living , better than [any other person]1106-any other person . "[93-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was at no loss to understand from whence this deference for [her]93-elizabeth authority proceeded ; but it was not in [her]93-elizabeth power to give any information of so satisfactory a nature , as the compliment deserved .

[She]93-elizabeth had never heard of [his]2353-his having had any relations , except [a father]3248-a father and [mother , both of whom had been dead many years]2355-mother , both of whom had been dead many years . It was possible , however , that [some of [[his]2353-his companions in [the ----shire]7-longbourn]2357-his companions in the ----shire]2356-some of his companions in the ----shire , might be able to give more information ; and , though [she]93-elizabeth was not very sanguine in expecting it , the application was a something to look forward to .

Every day at [Longbourn]7-longbourn was now a day of anxiety ; but the most anxious part of each was when the post was expected . The arrival of letters was the first grand object of every morning 's impatience . Through letters , whatever of good or bad was to be told , would be communicated , and every succeeding day was expected to bring some news of importance .

But before [they]2358-they heard again from [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner , a letter arrived for [[their]2358-they father]267-their father , from [a different quarter]2360-a different quarter , from [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins ; which , as [Jane]94-jane had received directions to open all that came for [him]149-mr. collins in [his]149-mr. collins absence , [she]94-jane accordingly read ; and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , who knew what curiosities [his]2353-his letters always were , looked over [her]94-jane , and read it likewise . It was as follows :

" [[MY]94-jane DEAR SIR]3808-my dear sir , "[94-jane]

" [I]94-jane feel [myself]94-jane called upon , by [our]4699-our relationship , and [my]94-jane situation in life , to condole with [you]3808-my dear sir on the grievous affliction [you]3808-my dear sir are now suffering under , of which [we]4699-our were yesterday informed by a letter from [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire . Be assured , [[my]94-jane dear]3018-my dear Sir , that [Mrs. Collins]186-mrs. collins and [myself]94-jane sincerely sympathise with [you]3808-my dear sir , and all [[your]3808-my dear sir respectable family]4701-your respectable family , in [your]3808-my dear sir present distress , which must be of the bitterest kind , because proceeding from a cause which no time can remove . No arguments shall be wanting on [my]94-jane part , that can alleviate so severe a misfortune ; or that may comfort [you]3808-my dear sir , under a circumstance that must be of all others most afflicting to [a parent]4702-a parent 's mind . The death of [[your]3808-my dear sir daughter]3235-your daughter would have been a blessing in comparison of this . And it is the more to be lamented , because there is reason to suppose , as [[my]94-jane dear]3018-my dear [Charlotte]114-charlotte informs [me]94-jane , that this licentiousness of behaviour in [[your]3808-my dear sir daughter]3235-your daughter , has proceeded from a faulty degree of indulgence , though , at the same time , for the consolation of [yourself]3808-my dear sir and [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , [I]94-jane am inclined to think that [her]3235-your daughter own disposition must be naturally bad , or [she]3235-your daughter could not be guilty of such an enormity , at so early an age . Howsoever that may be , [you]3808-my dear sir are grievously to be pitied , in which opinion [I]94-jane am not only joined by [Mrs. Collins]186-mrs. collins , but likewise by lady [Catherine]97-lady catherine and [[her]97-lady catherine daughter]475-her daughter , to whom [I]94-jane have related the affair . [They]4707-they agree with [me]94-jane in apprehending that this false step in [one daughter]4708-one daughter , will be injurious to the fortunes of [all the others]1179-all the others , for who , as [lady Catherine]97-lady catherine [herself]97-lady catherine condescendingly says , will connect [themselves]4707-they with [such a family]4710-such a family . And this consideration leads [me]94-jane moreover to reflect with augmented satisfaction on a certain event of last November , for had it been otherwise , [I]94-jane must have been involved in all [your]3808-my dear sir sorrow and disgrace . Let [me]94-jane advise [you]3808-my dear sir then , [[my]94-jane dear [Sir]3172-sir]3808-my dear sir , to console [yourself]3808-my dear sir as much as possible , to throw off [[your]3808-my dear sir unworthy child]4713-your unworthy child from [your]3808-my dear sir affection for ever , and leave [her]4713-your unworthy child to reap the fruits of [her]4713-your unworthy child own heinous offence . "[94-jane]

" [I]94-jane am , [dear Sir]672-dear sir , & c. & c. "[94-jane]

[Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner did not write again , till [he]180-mr. gardiner had received an answer from [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster ; and then [he]180-mr. gardiner had nothing of a pleasant nature to send . It was not known that [Wickham]156-wickham had [a single relation]2361-a single relation , with whom [he]156-wickham kept up any connection , and it was certain that [he]156-wickham had [no near one living]2362-no near one living . [[His]156-wickham former acquaintance]2363-his former acquaintance had been numerous ; but since [he]156-wickham had been in [the militia]2364-the militia , it did not appear that [he]156-wickham was on terms of particular friendship with [any of [them]2363-his former acquaintance]2365-any of them . There was [no one therefore who could be pointed out]2366-no one therefore who could be pointed out , as likely to give any news of [him]156-wickham . And in the wretched state of [his]156-wickham own finances , there was a very powerful motive for secrecy , in addition to [his]156-wickham fear of discovery by [Lydia]95-lydia 's relations , for it had just transpired that [he]156-wickham had left gaming debts behind [him]156-wickham , to a very considerable amount . [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster believed that more than a thousand pounds would be necessary to clear [his]156-wickham expences at [Brighton]40-brighton . [He]156-wickham owed a good deal in [the town]1054-the town , but [his]156-wickham debts of honour were still more formidable . [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner did not attempt to conceal these particulars from [[the Longbourn]7-longbourn family]748-the longbourn family ; [Jane]94-jane heard [them]2369-them with horror . " [A gamester]4715-a gamester ! "[94-jane] [she]94-jane cried . " This is wholly unexpected . [I]94-jane had not an idea of it . "[94-jane]

[Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner added in [his]180-mr. gardiner letter , that [they]748-the longbourn family might expect to see [[their]748-the longbourn family father]267-their father at [home]3223-home on the following day , which was Saturday . Rendered spiritless by the ill - success of all [their]748-the longbourn family endeavours , [he]180-mr. gardiner had yielded to [[his]180-mr. gardiner brother - in - law]305-his brother - in - law 's intreaty that [he]180-mr. gardiner would return to [[his]180-mr. gardiner family]394-his family , and leave it to [him]180-mr. gardiner to do , whatever occasion might suggest to be advisable for continuing [their]748-the longbourn family pursuit . When [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet was told of this , [she]96-mrs. bennet did not express so much satisfaction as [[her]96-mrs. bennet children]1010-her children expected , considering what [her]96-mrs. bennet anxiety for [his]180-mr. gardiner life had been before .

" What , is [he]180-mr. gardiner coming [home]3223-home , and without poor [Lydia]95-lydia ! "[96-mrs. bennet] [she]96-mrs. bennet cried . " Sure [he]180-mr. gardiner will not leave [London]5-london before [he]180-mr. gardiner has found [them]1010-her children . Who is to fight [Wickham]156-wickham , and make [him]180-mr. gardiner marry [her]95-lydia , if [he]180-mr. gardiner comes away ? "[96-mrs. bennet]

As [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner began to wish to be at [home]3223-home , it was settled that [she]141-mrs. gardiner and [[her]96-mrs. bennet children]1010-her children should go to [London]5-london , at the same time that [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet came from [it]2377-it . [The coach]3225-the coach , therefore , took [them]2379-them the first stage of [their]2379-them journey , and brought [its master]1187-its master back to [Longbourn]7-longbourn .

[Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner went away in all the perplexity about [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth and [[her]93-elizabeth Derbyshire friend]2381-her derbyshire friend , that had attended [her]141-mrs. gardiner from [that part of [the world]323-the world]2382-that part of the world . [His]86-mr. bennet name had never been voluntarily mentioned before [them]2379-them by [[her]96-mrs. bennet niece]1304-her niece ; and the kind of half - expectation which [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner had formed , of [their]2379-them being followed by a letter from [him]86-mr. bennet , had ended in nothing . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had received none since [her]93-elizabeth return , that could come from [Pemberley]12-pemberley .

The present unhappy state of [the family]432-the family , rendered any other excuse for the lowness of [her]93-elizabeth spirits unnecessary ; nothing , therefore , could be fairly conjectured from _ that _ , though [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , who was by this time tolerably well acquainted with [her]93-elizabeth own feelings , was perfectly aware , that , had [she]93-elizabeth known nothing of [Darcy]100-mr. darcy , [she]93-elizabeth could have borne the dread of [Lydia]95-lydia 's infamy somewhat better . It would have spared [her]93-elizabeth , [she]93-elizabeth thought , one sleepless night out of two .

When [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet arrived , [he]86-mr. bennet had all the appearance of [his]86-mr. bennet usual philosophic composure . [He]86-mr. bennet said as little as [he]86-mr. bennet had ever been in the habit of saying ; made no mention of the business that had taken [him]86-mr. bennet away , and it was some time before [[his]86-mr. bennet daughters]443-his daughters had courage to speak of it .

It was not till the afternoon , when [he]86-mr. bennet joined [them]2387-them at tea , that [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ventured to introduce the subject ; and then , on [her]93-elizabeth briefly expressing [her]93-elizabeth sorrow for what [he]86-mr. bennet must have endured , [he]86-mr. bennet replied , " Say nothing of that . Who should suffer but [myself]86-mr. bennet ? It has been [my]86-mr. bennet own doing , and [I]86-mr. bennet ought to feel it . "[86-mr. bennet]

" [You]86-mr. bennet must not be too severe upon [yourself]86-mr. bennet , "[93-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth .

" [You]86-mr. bennet may well warn [me]86-mr. bennet against such an evil . Human nature is so prone to fall into it ! No , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , let [me]86-mr. bennet once in [my]86-mr. bennet life feel how much [I]86-mr. bennet have been to blame . [I]86-mr. bennet am not afraid of being overpowered by the impression . It will pass away soon enough . "[86-mr. bennet]

" Do [you]264-her father suppose [them]4717-them to be in [London]5-london ? "[86-mr. bennet]

" Yes ; where else can [they]4717-them be so well concealed ? "[86-mr. bennet]

" And [Lydia]95-lydia used to want to go to [London]5-london , "[97-lady catherine] added [Kitty]97-lady catherine .

" [She]95-lydia is happy , then , "[264-her father] said [[her]97-lady catherine father]264-her father , drily ; " and [[her]95-lydia residence]4718-her residence there will probably be of some duration . "[264-her father]

Then , after a short silence , [he]264-her father continued , " [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [I]264-her father bear [you]93-elizabeth no ill - will for being justified in [your]93-elizabeth advice to [me]264-her father last May , which , considering the event , [shews]4719-shews some greatness of mind . "[264-her father]

[They]2389-they were interrupted by [Miss Bennet]95-lydia , who came to fetch [[her]97-lady catherine mother]261-her mother 's tea .

" This is a parade , "[264-her father] cried [he]264-her father , " which does one good ; it gives such an elegance to misfortune ! Another day [I]264-her father will do the same ; [I]264-her father will sit in [[my]264-her father library]4720-my library , in [my]264-her father night cap and powdering gown , and give as much trouble as [I]264-her father can,--or , perhaps , [I]264-her father may defer it , till [Kitty]97-lady catherine runs away . "[264-her father]

" [I]97-lady catherine am not going to run away , [Papa]226-papa , "[97-lady catherine] said [Kitty]97-lady catherine , fretfully ; " if _ [I]97-lady catherine _ should ever go to [Brighton]40-brighton , [I]97-lady catherine would behave better than [Lydia]95-lydia . "[97-lady catherine]

" _ [You]97-lady catherine _ go to [Brighton!--I]65-brighton!--i would not trust [you]97-lady catherine so near [it]40-brighton as [East Bourne]227-east bourne for fifty pounds ! No , [Kitty]97-lady catherine , [I]264-her father have at last learnt to be cautious , and [you]97-lady catherine will feel the effects of it . [No officer]4721-no officer is ever to enter [[my]264-her father house]4722-my house again , nor even to pass through [the village]339-the village . Balls will be absolutely prohibited , unless [you]97-lady catherine stand up with [one of [[your]97-lady catherine sisters]3082-your sisters]4724-one of your sisters . And [you]97-lady catherine are never to stir out of doors , till [you]97-lady catherine can prove , that [you]97-lady catherine have spent ten minutes of every day in a rational manner . "[264-her father]

[Kitty]97-lady catherine , who took all these threats in a serious light , began to cry .

" Well , well , "[2391-he] said [he]2391-he , " do not make [yourself]97-lady catherine unhappy . If [you]97-lady catherine are [a good girl]4726-a good girl for the next ten years , [I]2391-he will take [you]97-lady catherine to a review at the end of [them]4727-them . "[2391-he]

CHAPTER VII .

Two days after [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet 's return , as [Jane]94-jane and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth were walking together in the shrubbery behind [the house]3026-the house , [they]2393-they saw [the housekeeper]839-the housekeeper coming towards [them]2393-they , and , concluding that [she]839-the housekeeper came to call [them]2393-they to [[their]2393-they mother]446-their mother , went forward to meet [her]839-the housekeeper ; but , instead of the expected summons , when [they]2393-they approached [her]839-the housekeeper , [she]839-the housekeeper said to [Miss Bennet]95-lydia , " [I]839-the housekeeper beg [your]95-lydia pardon , [madam]3285-madam , for interrupting [you]95-lydia , but [I]839-the housekeeper was in hopes [you]95-lydia might have got some good news from [town]285-town , so [I]839-the housekeeper took the liberty of coming to ask . "[839-the housekeeper]

" What do [you]95-lydia mean , [Hill]148-hill ? [We]2393-they have heard nothing from [town]285-town . "[839-the housekeeper]

" [Dear madam]4731-dear madam , "[148-hill] cried [Mrs. Hill]148-hill , in great astonishment , " do n't [you]95-lydia know there is an express come for [master]4732-master from [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner ? [He]2399-the library;--their father has been [here]3019-here this half hour , and [master]4732-master has had a letter . "[148-hill]

Away ran [the girls]3033-the girls , too eager to get in to have time for speech . [They]3033-the girls ran through [the vestibule]1023-the vestibule into [the breakfast room]2398-the breakfast room ; from thence to [the library;--their father]2399-the library;--their father was in neither ; and [they]3033-the girls were on the point of seeking [him]2399-the library;--their father up [stairs]529-stairs with [[their]3033-the girls mother]446-their mother , when [they]3033-the girls were met by [the butler]2402-the butler , who said ,

" If [you]3033-the girls are looking for [[my]2402-the butler master]4451-my master , [ma'am]4043-ma'am , [he]4451-my master is walking towards [the little copse]4737-the little copse . "[2402-the butler]

Upon this information , [they]3033-the girls instantly passed through [the hall]708-the hall once more , and ran across [the lawn]1967-the lawn after [[their]3033-the girls father]267-their father , who was deliberately pursuing [his]2399-the library;--their father way towards a small wood on [one side of [the paddock]2281-the paddock]2406-one side of the paddock .

[Jane]94-jane , who was not so light , nor so much in the habit of running as [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , soon lagged behind , while [[her]94-jane sister]348-her sister , panting for breath , came up with [him]267-their father , and eagerly cried out ,

" Oh , [Papa]226-papa , what news ? what news ? have [you]226-papa heard from [[my]348-her sister uncle]3468-my uncle ? "[348-her sister]

" Yes , [I]348-her sister have had a letter from [him]3468-my uncle by express . "[348-her sister]

" Well , and what news does it bring ? good or bad ? "[348-her sister]

" What is there of good to be expected ? "[267-their father] said [he]267-their father , taking the letter from [his]267-their father pocket ; " but perhaps [you]93-elizabeth would like to read it . "[267-their father]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth impatiently caught it from [his]267-their father hand . [Jane]94-jane now came up .

" Read it aloud , "[267-their father] said [[their]2409-they father]267-their father , " for [I]267-their father hardly know [myself]267-their father what it is about . "[267-their father]

" [Gracechurch - street]39-gracechurch - street , Monday ,[267-their father]

August 2 .

[[MY]7-longbourn DEAR BROTHER]4638-my dear brother , "[4638-my dear brother]

" At last [I]267-their father am able to send [you]4638-my dear brother some tidings of [[my]267-their father niece]4294-my niece , and such as , upon the whole , [I]267-their father hope will give [you]4638-my dear brother satisfaction . Soon after [you]4638-my dear brother left [me]267-their father on Saturday , [I]267-their father was fortunate enough to find out in what part of [London]5-london [they]2409-they were . The particulars , [I]267-their father reserve till [we]4740-we meet . It is enough to know [they]2409-they are discovered , [I]267-their father have seen [them]2409-they both---- "[267-their father]

" Then it is , as [I]94-jane always hoped , "[94-jane] cried [Jane]94-jane ; " [they]2409-they are married ! "[94-jane]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth read on ; " [I]93-elizabeth have seen [them]2409-they both . [They]2409-they are not married , nor can [I]93-elizabeth find there was any intention of being so ; but if [you]4638-my dear brother are willing to perform the engagements which [I]93-elizabeth have ventured to make on [your]4638-my dear brother side , [I]93-elizabeth hope it will not be long before [they]2409-they are . All that is required of [you]4638-my dear brother is , to assure to [[your]4638-my dear brother daughter]3235-your daughter , by settlement , [her]3235-your daughter equal share of the five thousand pounds , secured among [[your]4638-my dear brother children]4742-your children after the decease of [yourself]4638-my dear brother and [[my]93-elizabeth sister]3284-my sister ; and , moreover , to enter into an engagement of allowing [her]3235-your daughter , during [your]4638-my dear brother life , one hundred pounds per annum . These are conditions , which , considering every thing , [I]93-elizabeth had no hesitation in complying with , as far as [I]93-elizabeth thought [myself]93-elizabeth privileged , for [you]4638-my dear brother . [I]93-elizabeth shall send this by express , that no time may be lost in bringing [me]93-elizabeth [your]4638-my dear brother answer . [You]4638-my dear brother will easily comprehend , from these particulars , that [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham 's circumstances are not so hopeless as they are generally believed to be . [The world]323-the world has been deceived in that respect ; and [I]93-elizabeth am happy to say , there will be some little money , even when all [his]156-wickham debts are discharged , to settle on [[my]93-elizabeth niece]4294-my niece , in addition to [her]4294-my niece own fortune . If , as [I]93-elizabeth conclude will be the case , [you]4638-my dear brother send [me]93-elizabeth full powers to act in [your]4638-my dear brother name , throughout the whole of this business , [I]93-elizabeth will immediately give directions to [Haggerston]228-haggerston for preparing a proper settlement . There will not be the smallest occasion for [your]4638-my dear brother coming to [town]285-town again ; therefore , stay quietly at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and depend on [my]93-elizabeth diligence and care . Send back [your]4638-my dear brother answer as soon as [you]4638-my dear brother can , and be careful to write explicitly . [We]4747-we have judged it best , that [[my]93-elizabeth niece]4294-my niece should be married from [this house]3413-this house , of which [I]93-elizabeth hope [you]4638-my dear brother will approve . [She]4294-my niece comes to [us]4747-we to - day . [I]93-elizabeth shall write again as soon as any thing more is determined on . [Your]4638-my dear brother 's , & c. "[93-elizabeth]

" EDW . GARDINER . "[348-her sister]

" Is it possible ! "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , when [she]93-elizabeth had finished . " Can it be possible that [he]4750-he will marry [her]4294-my niece ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [Wickham]156-wickham is not so undeserving , then , as [we]4747-we have thought [him]156-wickham ; "[348-her sister] said [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister . " [[My]348-her sister dear father]4406-my dear father , [I]348-her sister congratulate [you]4406-my dear father . "[348-her sister]

" And have [you]2413-he answered the letter ? "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth .

" No ; but it must be done soon . "[348-her sister]

Most earnestly did [she]93-elizabeth then intreat [him]2413-he to lose no more time before [he]2413-he wrote .

" Oh ! [[my]93-elizabeth dear father]4406-my dear father , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth cried , " come back , and write immediately . Consider how important every moment is , in such a case . "[93-elizabeth]

" Let [me]94-jane write for [you]4406-my dear father , "[94-jane] said [Jane]94-jane , " if [you]4406-my dear father dislike the trouble [yourself]4406-my dear father . "[94-jane]

" [I]2413-he dislike it very much , "[2413-he] [he]2413-he replied ; " but it must be done . "[2413-he]

And so saying , [he]2413-he turned back with [them]2414-they , and walked towards [the house]3026-the house .

" And may [I]93-elizabeth ask ? "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " but the terms , [I]93-elizabeth suppose , must be complied with . "[93-elizabeth]

" Complied with ! [I]94-jane am only ashamed of [his]2413-he asking so little . "[94-jane]

" And [they]2414-they _ must _ marry ! Yet [he]2413-he is _ such _ [a man]3065-a man ! "[93-elizabeth]

" Yes , yes , [they]2414-they must marry . There is nothing else to be done . But there are two things that [I]94-jane want very much to know:--one is , how much money [[your]4406-my dear father uncle]3373-your uncle has laid down , to bring it about ; and the other , how [I]94-jane am ever to pay [him]2413-he . "[94-jane]

" Money ! [[my]94-jane uncle]3468-my uncle ! "[94-jane] cried [Jane]94-jane , " what do [you]3468-my uncle mean , [Sir]3172-sir ? "[94-jane]

" [I]94-jane mean , that [no man in [his]2413-he senses]4757-no man in his senses , would marry [Lydia]95-lydia on so slight a temptation as one hundred a - year during [my]94-jane life , and fifty after [I]94-jane am gone . "[94-jane]

" That is very true , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; " though it had not occurred to [me]93-elizabeth before . [His]2413-he debts to be discharged , and something still to remain ! Oh ! it must be [[my]93-elizabeth uncle]3468-my uncle 's doings ! [Generous , good man]4759-generous , good man , [I]93-elizabeth am afraid [he]2413-he has distressed [himself]2413-he . A small sum could not do all this . "[93-elizabeth]

" No , "[264-her father] said [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father , " [Wickham]156-wickham 's [a fool]4760-a fool , if [he]156-wickham takes [her]93-elizabeth with a farthing less than ten thousand pounds . [I]264-her father should be sorry to think so ill of [him]156-wickham , in the very beginning of [our]4761-we relationship . "[264-her father]

" Ten thousand pounds ! Heaven forbid ! How is half such a sum to be repaid ? "[3033-the girls]

[Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet made no answer , and each of [them]2417-they , deep in thought , continued silent till [they]2417-they reached [the house]3026-the house . [[Their]2417-they father]267-their father then went to [the library]1030-the library to write , and [the girls]3033-the girls walked into [the breakfast - room]1024-the breakfast - room .

" And [they]2417-they are really to be married ! "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , as soon as [they]2417-they were by [themselves]2417-they . " How strange this is ! And for _ this _ [we]4761-we are to be thankful . That [they]2417-they should marry , small as is [their]2417-they chance of happiness , and wretched as is [his]156-wickham character , [we]4761-we are forced to rejoice ! Oh , [Lydia]95-lydia ! "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]94-jane comfort [myself]94-jane with thinking , "[94-jane] replied [Jane]94-jane , " that [he]156-wickham certainly would not marry [Lydia]95-lydia , if [he]156-wickham had not a real regard for [her]95-lydia . Though [[our]4761-we kind uncle]4762-our kind uncle has done something towards clearing [him]156-wickham , [I]94-jane can not believe that ten thousand pounds , or any thing like it , has been advanced . [He]156-wickham has [children]4475-children of [his]156-wickham own , and may have more . How could [he]156-wickham spare half ten thousand pounds ? "[94-jane]

" If [we]4761-we are ever able to learn what [Wickham]156-wickham 's debts have been , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " and how much is settled on [his]156-wickham side on [[our]4761-we sister]3776-our sister , [we]4761-we shall exactly know what [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner has done for [them]4475-children , because [Wickham]156-wickham has not sixpence of [his]156-wickham own . The kindness of [[my]93-elizabeth uncle]3468-my uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt can never be requited . [Their]4475-children taking [her]3776-our sister [home]3223-home , and affording [her]3776-our sister [their]4475-children personal protection and countenance , is such a sacrifice to [her]3776-our sister advantage , as years of gratitude can not enough acknowledge . By this time [she]3776-our sister is actually with [them]4475-children ! If such goodness does not make [her]3776-our sister miserable now , [she]3776-our sister will never deserve to be happy ! What a meeting for [her]3776-our sister , when [she]3776-our sister first sees [[my]93-elizabeth aunt]3208-my aunt ! "[93-elizabeth]

" [We]4769-we must endeavour to forget all that has passed on either side , "[94-jane] said [Jane]94-jane : " [I]94-jane hope and trust [they]4475-children will yet be happy . [His]3468-my uncle consenting to marry [her]3776-our sister is a proof , [I]94-jane will believe , that [he]3468-my uncle is come to a right way of thinking . [Their]4475-children mutual affection will steady [them]4475-children ; and [I]94-jane flatter [myself]94-jane [they]4475-children will settle so quietly , and live in so rational a manner , as may in time make [their]4475-children past imprudence forgotten . "[94-jane]

" [Their]4475-children conduct has been such , "[93-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " as neither [you]267-their father , nor [I]93-elizabeth , nor [any body]3670-any body , can ever forget . It is useless to talk of it . "[93-elizabeth]

It now occurred to [the girls]3033-the girls that [[their]3033-the girls mother]446-their mother was in all likelihood perfectly ignorant of what had happened . [They]3033-the girls went to [the library]1030-the library , therefore , and asked [[their]3033-the girls father]267-their father , whether [he]267-their father would not wish [them]3033-the girls to make it known to [her]446-their mother . [He]267-their father was writing , and , without raising [his]267-their father head , coolly replied ,

" Just as [you]93-elizabeth please . "[267-their father]

" May [we]3033-the girls take [[my]267-their father uncle]3468-my uncle 's letter to read to [her]446-their mother ? "[267-their father]

" Take whatever [you]267-their father like , and get away . "[267-their father]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth took the letter from [his]267-their father writing table , and [they]3033-the girls went up [stairs]529-stairs together . [Mary]98-mary and [Kitty]97-lady catherine were both with [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet : one communication would , therefore , do for all . After a slight preparation for good news , the letter was read aloud . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet could hardly contain [herself]96-mrs. bennet . As soon as [Jane]94-jane had read [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner 's hope of [Lydia]95-lydia 's being soon married , [her]94-jane joy burst forth , and every following sentence added to its exuberance . [She]94-jane was now in an irritation as violent from delight , as [she]94-jane had ever been fidgetty from alarm and vexation . To know that [[her]94-jane daughter]475-her daughter would be married was enough . [She]94-jane was disturbed by no fear for [her]94-jane felicity , nor humbled by any remembrance of [her]94-jane misconduct .

" [[My]94-jane dear]3018-my dear , dear [Lydia]95-lydia ! "[94-jane] [she]94-jane cried : " This is delightful indeed!--She will be married!--I shall see [her]95-lydia again!--She will be married at sixteen!--My good , kind brother!--I knew how it would be -- [I]94-jane knew [he]180-mr. gardiner would manage every thing . How [I]94-jane long to see [her]95-lydia ! and to see [dear Wickham]156-wickham too ! But the clothes , the wedding clothes ! [I]94-jane will write to [[my]94-jane sister]3284-my sister [Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner about [them]4774-them directly . [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [[my]94-jane dear]3018-my dear , run down to [[your]93-elizabeth father]3227-your father , and ask [him]3227-your father how much [he]3227-your father will give [her]95-lydia . Stay , stay , [I]94-jane will go [myself]94-jane . Ring the bell , [Kitty]97-lady catherine , for [Hill]148-hill . [I]94-jane will put on [my]94-jane things in a moment . [[My]94-jane dear]3018-my dear , dear Lydia!--How merry [we]4778-we shall be together when [we]4778-we meet ! "[94-jane]

[[Her]2429-her eldest daughter]332-her eldest daughter endeavoured to give some relief to the violence of [these transports]2431-these transports , by leading [her]332-her eldest daughter thoughts to the obligations which [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner 's behaviour laid [them]2432-them all under .

" For [we]4778-we must attribute this happy conclusion , "[2429-her] [she]2429-her added , " in a great measure , to [his]180-mr. gardiner kindness . [We]4778-we are persuaded that [he]180-mr. gardiner has pledged [himself]180-mr. gardiner to assist [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham with money . "[2429-her]

" Well , "[261-her mother] cried [[her]332-her eldest daughter mother]261-her mother , " it is all very right ; who should do it but [[her]332-her eldest daughter own uncle]4779-her own uncle ? If [he]180-mr. gardiner had not had [a family of [his]180-mr. gardiner own]4780-a family of his own , [I]261-her mother and [[my]261-her mother children]3197-my children must have had all [his]180-mr. gardiner money [you]332-her eldest daughter know , and it is the first time [we]4778-we have ever had any thing from [him]180-mr. gardiner , except a few presents . Well ! [I]261-her mother am so happy . In a short time , [I]261-her mother shall have [a daughter]1139-a daughter married . [Mrs. Wickham]229-mrs. wickham ! How well it sounds . And [she]1139-a daughter was only sixteen last June . [[My]261-her mother dear]3018-my dear [Jane]94-jane , [I]261-her mother am in such a flutter , that [I]261-her mother am sure [I]261-her mother ca n't write ; so [I]261-her mother will dictate , and [you]94-jane write for [me]261-her mother . [We]4784-we will settle with [[your]94-jane father]3227-your father about the money afterwards ; but the things should be ordered immediately . "[261-her mother]

[She]2434-i was then proceeding to all the particulars of calico , muslin , and cambric , and would shortly have dictated some very plentiful orders , had not [Jane]94-jane , though with some difficulty , persuaded [her]2434-i to wait , till [[her]2434-i father]264-her father was at leisure to be consulted . One day 's delay [she]2434-i observed , would be of small importance ; and [[her]2434-i mother]261-her mother was too happy , to be quite so obstinate as usual . Other schemes too came into [her]2434-i head .

" [I]2434-i will go to [Meryton]9-meryton , "[2434-i] said [she]2434-i , " as soon as [I]2434-i am dressed , and tell the good , good news to [[my]2434-i sister]3284-my sister [Philips]126-philips . And as [I]2434-i come back , [I]2434-i can call on [Lady Lucas]92-lady lucas and [Mrs. Long]87-mrs. long . [Kitty]97-lady catherine , run down and order [the carriage]3221-the carriage . An airing would do [me]2434-i a great deal of good , [I]2434-i am sure . [Girls]3074-girls , can [I]2434-i do any thing for [you]3074-girls in [Meryton]9-meryton ? Oh ! here comes [Hill]148-hill . [[My]2434-i dear]3018-my dear [Hill]148-hill , have [you]148-hill heard the good news ? [Miss Lydia]95-lydia is going to be married ; and [you]148-hill shall all have a bowl of punch , to make merry at [her]95-lydia wedding . "[2434-i]

[Mrs. Hill]148-hill began instantly to express [her]148-hill joy . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth received [her]93-elizabeth congratulations amongst the rest , and then , sick of this folly , took refuge in [[her]93-elizabeth own room]1580-her own room , that [she]93-elizabeth might think with freedom .

[Poor Lydia]230-lydia 's situation must , at best , be bad enough ; but that it was no worse , [she]230-lydia had need to be thankful . [She]230-lydia felt it so ; and though , in looking forward , neither rational happiness nor worldly prosperity , could be justly expected for [[her]230-lydia sister]348-her sister ; in looking back to what [they]2439-they had feared , only two hours ago , [she]230-lydia felt all the advantages of what [they]2439-they had gained .

CHAPTER VIII .

[Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet had very often wished , before this period of [his]86-mr. bennet life , that , instead of spending [his]86-mr. bennet whole income , [he]86-mr. bennet had laid by an annual sum , for the better provision of [[his]86-mr. bennet children]2440-his children , and of [[his]86-mr. bennet wife]251-his wife , if [she]251-his wife survived [him]86-mr. bennet . [He]86-mr. bennet now wished it more than ever . Had [he]86-mr. bennet done [his]86-mr. bennet duty in that respect , [Lydia]230-lydia need not have been indebted to [[her]230-lydia uncle]583-her uncle , for whatever of honour or credit could now be purchased for [her]230-lydia . The satisfaction of prevailing on [one of [the most worthless young men in [Great Britain]67-great britain]2444-the most worthless young men in great britain to be [[her]230-lydia husband]276-her husband]2443-one of the most worthless young men in great britain to be her husband , might then have rested in its proper place .

[He]86-mr. bennet was seriously concerned , that a cause of so little advantage to [any one]3122-any one , should be forwarded at the sole expence of [[his]86-mr. bennet brother - in - law]305-his brother - in - law , and [he]86-mr. bennet was determined , if possible , to find out the extent of [his]86-mr. bennet assistance , and to discharge the obligation as soon as [he]86-mr. bennet could .

When [first Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet had married , economy was held to be perfectly useless ; for , of course , [they]2448-their were to have [a son]2449-a son . [This son]2450-this son was to join in cutting off the entail , as soon as [he]2450-this son should be of age , and [the widow]2451-the widow and [younger children]2452-younger children would by that means be provided for . [Five daughters]664-five daughters successively entered [the world]323-the world , but yet [the son]1639-the son was to come ; and [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , for many years after [Lydia]230-lydia 's birth , had been certain that [he]86-mr. bennet would . This event had at last been despaired of , but it was then too late to be saving . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet had no turn for economy , and [[her]96-mrs. bennet husband]276-her husband 's love of independence had alone prevented [their]2448-their exceeding [their]2448-their income .

Five thousand pounds was settled by marriage articles on [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet and [the children]1862-the children . But in what proportions it should be divided amongst [the latter]499-the latter , depended on the will of [the parents]2459-the parents . This was one point , with regard to [Lydia]230-lydia at least , which was now to be settled , and [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet could have no hesitation in acceding to the proposal before [him]86-mr. bennet . In terms of grateful acknowledgment for the kindness of [[his]86-mr. bennet brother]2346-his brother , though expressed most concisely , [he]86-mr. bennet then delivered on paper [his]86-mr. bennet perfect approbation of all that was done , and [his]86-mr. bennet willingness to fulfil the engagements that had been made for [him]86-mr. bennet . [He]86-mr. bennet had never before supposed that , could [Wickham]156-wickham be prevailed on to marry [[his]156-wickham daughter]1127-his daughter , it would be done with so little inconvenience to [himself]156-wickham , as by the present arrangement . [He]156-wickham would scarcely be ten pounds a - year the loser , by the hundred that was to be paid [them]2448-their ; for , what with [her]230-lydia board and pocket allowance , and the continual presents in money , which passed to [her]230-lydia , through [[her]230-lydia mother]261-her mother 's hands , [Lydia]230-lydia 's expences had been very little within that sum .

That it would be done with such trifling exertion on [his]156-wickham side , too , was another very welcome surprise ; for [his]156-wickham chief wish at present , was to have as little trouble in the business as possible . When the first transports of rage which had produced [his]156-wickham activity in seeking [her]230-lydia were over , [he]156-wickham naturally returned to all [his]156-wickham former indolence . [His]156-wickham letter was soon dispatched ; for though dilatory in undertaking business , [he]156-wickham was quick in its execution . [He]156-wickham begged to know farther particulars of what [he]156-wickham was indebted to [[his]156-wickham brother]2346-his brother ; but was too angry with [Lydia]230-lydia , to send any message to [her]230-lydia .

The good news quickly spread through [the house]3026-the house ; and with proportionate speed through [the neighbourhood]3040-the neighbourhood . It was borne in the latter with decent philosophy . To be sure it would have been more for the advantage of conversation , had [Miss Lydia Bennet]95-lydia come upon [the town]1054-the town ; or , as the happiest alternative , been secluded from [the world]323-the world , in [some distant farm house]2468-some distant farm house . But there was much to be talked of , in marrying [her]230-lydia ; and the good - natured wishes for [her]230-lydia well - doing , which had proceeded before , from [all the spiteful old ladies in [Meryton]9-meryton]2469-all the spiteful old ladies in meryton , lost but little of [their]2469-all the spiteful old ladies in meryton spirit in this change of circumstances , because with such [an husband]2470-an husband , [her]230-lydia misery was considered certain .

It was a fortnight since [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet had been down [stairs]529-stairs , but on this happy day , [she]230-lydia again took [her]230-lydia seat at the head of [her]230-lydia table , and in spirits oppressively high . No sentiment of shame gave a damp to [her]230-lydia triumph . The marriage of [a daughter]1139-a daughter , which had been the first object of [her]230-lydia wishes , since [Jane]94-jane was sixteen , was now on the point of accomplishment , and [her]230-lydia thoughts and [her]230-lydia words ran wholly on [those attendants of elegant nuptials , fine muslins , new carriages]2473-those attendants of elegant nuptials , fine muslins , new carriages , and [servants]1377-servants . [She]230-lydia was busily searching through [the neighbourhood]3040-the neighbourhood for a proper situation for [[her]230-lydia daughter]475-her daughter , and , without knowing or considering what [their]2477-their income might be , rejected many as deficient in size and importance .

" [Haye - Park]68-haye - park might do , "[230-lydia] said [she]230-lydia , " if [the Gouldings]231-the gouldings would quit [it]68-haye - park , or [the great house at [Stoke]69-stoke]4790-the great house at stoke , if [the drawing - room]530-the drawing - room were larger ; but [Ashworth]70-ashworth is too far off ! [I]230-lydia could not bear to have [her]475-her daughter ten miles from [me]230-lydia ; and as for [Purvis Lodge]71-purvis lodge , the attics are dreadful . "[230-lydia]

[[Her]230-lydia husband]276-her husband allowed [her]230-lydia to talk on without interruption , while [the servants]715-the servants remained . But when [they]715-the servants had withdrawn , [he]276-her husband said to [her]230-lydia , " [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , before [you]230-lydia take any , or all of [these houses]4792-these houses , for [[your]230-lydia son]4793-your son and [daughter]4011-daughter , let [us]4795-us come to a right understanding . Into [_ one _ house in [this neighbourhood]3318-this neighbourhood]4796-_ one _ house in this neighbourhood , [they]715-the servants shall never have admittance . [I]276-her husband will not encourage the impudence of either , by receiving [them]715-the servants at [Longbourn]7-longbourn . "[276-her husband]

A long dispute followed this declaration ; but [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet was firm : it soon led to another ; and [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet found , with amazement and horror , that [[her]96-mrs. bennet husband]276-her husband would not advance a guinea to buy clothes for [[his]276-her husband daughter]1127-his daughter . [He]276-her husband protested that [she]96-mrs. bennet should receive from [him]276-her husband no mark of affection whatever , on the occasion . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet could hardly comprehend it . That [his]276-her husband anger could be carried to such a point of inconceivable resentment , as to refuse [[his]276-her husband daughter]1127-his daughter a privilege , without which [her]96-mrs. bennet marriage would scarcely seem valid , exceeded all that [she]96-mrs. bennet could believe possible . [She]96-mrs. bennet was more alive to the disgrace , which the want of new clothes must reflect on [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter 's nuptials , than to any sense of shame at [her]96-mrs. bennet eloping and living with [Wickham]156-wickham , a fortnight before [they]2484-they took place .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was now most heartily sorry that [she]93-elizabeth had , from the distress of the moment , been led to make [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy acquainted with [their]2485-their fears for [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister ; for since [her]93-elizabeth marriage would so shortly give the proper termination to the elopement , [they]2485-their might hope to conceal its unfavourable beginning , from [all those who were not immediately on the spot]2487-all those who were not immediately on the spot .

[She]93-elizabeth had no fear of its spreading farther , through [his]276-her husband means . There were [few people on whose secrecy]2488-few people on whose secrecy [she]93-elizabeth would have more confidently depended ; but at the same time , there was [no one]3275-no one , whose knowledge of [a sister]449-a sister 's frailty would have mortified [her]93-elizabeth so much . Not , however , from any fear of disadvantage from it , individually to [herself]93-elizabeth ; for at any rate , there seemed a gulf impassable between [them]2491-them . Had [Lydia]95-lydia 's marriage been concluded on the most honourable terms , it was not to be supposed that [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy would connect [himself]100-mr. darcy with [a family]4617-a family , where to every other objection would now be added , an alliance and relationship of the nearest kind with [the man whom [he]100-mr. darcy so justly scorned]2493-the man whom he so justly scorned .

From such a connection [she]93-elizabeth could not wonder that [he]100-mr. darcy should shrink . The wish of procuring [her]93-elizabeth regard , which [she]93-elizabeth had assured [herself]93-elizabeth of [his]100-mr. darcy feeling in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , could not in rational expectation survive such a blow as this . [She]93-elizabeth was humbled , [she]93-elizabeth was grieved ; [she]93-elizabeth repented , though [she]93-elizabeth hardly knew of what . [She]93-elizabeth became jealous of [his]100-mr. darcy esteem , when [she]93-elizabeth could no longer hope to be benefited by it . [She]93-elizabeth wanted to hear of [him]100-mr. darcy , when there seemed the least chance of gaining intelligence . [She]93-elizabeth was convinced that [she]93-elizabeth could have been happy with [him]100-mr. darcy ; when it was no longer likely [they]2494-they should meet .

What a triumph for [him]100-mr. darcy , as [she]93-elizabeth often thought , could [he]100-mr. darcy know that the proposals which [she]93-elizabeth had proudly spurned only four months ago , would now have been gladly and gratefully received ! [He]100-mr. darcy was as generous , [she]93-elizabeth doubted not , as the most generous of [his]100-mr. darcy sex . But while [he]100-mr. darcy was mortal , there must be a triumph .
