[She]93-elizabeth began now to comprehend that [he]100-mr. darcy was exactly [the man , who , in disposition and talents , would most suit [her]93-elizabeth]2495-the man , who , in disposition and talents , would most suit her . [His]100-mr. darcy understanding and temper , though unlike [her]93-elizabeth own , would have answered all [her]93-elizabeth wishes . It was an union that must have been to the advantage of both ; by [her]93-elizabeth ease and liveliness , [his]100-mr. darcy mind might have been softened , [his]100-mr. darcy manners improved , and from [his]100-mr. darcy judgment , information , and knowledge of [the world]323-the world , [she]93-elizabeth must have received benefit of greater importance .

But no such happy marriage could now teach [the admiring multitude]2497-the admiring multitude what connubial felicity really was . An union of a different tendency , and precluding the possibility of the other , was soon to be formed in [[their]2498-their family]2499-their family .

How [Wickham]156-wickham and [Lydia]95-lydia were to be supported in tolerable independence , [she]93-elizabeth could not imagine . But how little of permanent happiness could belong to [a couple who were only brought together because [their]2500-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue passions were stronger than [their]2500-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue virtue]2500-a couple who were only brought together because their passions were stronger than their virtue , [she]93-elizabeth could easily conjecture .

* * * * *

[Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner soon wrote again to [[his]180-mr. gardiner brother]2346-his brother . To [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet 's acknowledgments [he]100-mr. darcy briefly replied , with assurances of [his]100-mr. darcy eagerness to promote the welfare of [any of [[his]100-mr. darcy family]394-his family]2502-any of his family ; and concluded with intreaties that the subject might never be mentioned to [him]100-mr. darcy again . The principal purport of [his]100-mr. darcy letter was to inform [them]2498-their , that [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham had resolved on quitting [the Militia]72-the militia .

" It was greatly [my]100-mr. darcy wish that [he]156-wickham should do so , "[100-mr. darcy] [he]100-mr. darcy added , " as soon as [his]156-wickham marriage was fixed on . And [I]100-mr. darcy think [you]2498-their will agree with [me]100-mr. darcy , in considering a removal from [that corps]4798-that corps as highly advisable , both on [his]156-wickham account and [[my]100-mr. darcy niece]4294-my niece 's . It is [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham 's intention to go into [the regulars]4800-the regulars ; and , among [[his]156-wickham former friends]4801-his former friends , there are still [some who are able and willing to assist [him]156-wickham in [the army]4450-the army]4802-some who are able and willing to assist him in the army . [He]156-wickham has the promise of [an ensigncy in [General ---- 's regiment]4805-general ---- 's regiment , now quartered in [the North]73-the north]4804-an ensigncy in general ---- 's regiment , now quartered in the north . It is an advantage to have it so far from [this part of [the kingdom]3650-the kingdom]4806-this part of the kingdom . [He]156-wickham promises fairly , and [I]100-mr. darcy hope among [different people]4808-different people , where [they]4808-different people may each have a character to preserve , [they]4808-different people will both be more prudent . [I]100-mr. darcy have written to [Colonel Forster]123-colonel forster , to inform [him]123-colonel forster of [our]4809-our present arrangements , and to request that [he]123-colonel forster will satisfy [the various creditors of [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham in and near [Brighton]40-brighton]4810-the various creditors of mr. wickham in and near brighton , with assurances of speedy payment , for which [I]100-mr. darcy have pledged [myself]100-mr. darcy . And will [you]4811-you give [yourself]4811-you the trouble of carrying similar assurances to [[his]156-wickham creditors]4812-his creditors in [Meryton]9-meryton , of whom [I]100-mr. darcy shall subjoin a list , according to [his]156-wickham information . [He]156-wickham has given in all [his]156-wickham debts ; [I]100-mr. darcy hope at least [he]156-wickham has not deceived [us]4809-our . [Haggerston]228-haggerston has [our]4809-our directions , and all will be completed in a week . [They]4812-his creditors will then join [[his]156-wickham regiment]4813-his regiment , unless [they]4812-his creditors are first invited to [Longbourn]7-longbourn ; and [I]100-mr. darcy understand from [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner , that [[my]100-mr. darcy niece]4294-my niece is very desirous of seeing [you]4815-you all , before [she]4294-my niece leaves [the South]74-the south . [She]4294-my niece is well , and begs to be dutifully remembered to [you]4815-you and [[her]4294-my niece mother.--Your]4816-her mother.--your 's , & c. "[100-mr. darcy]

" [E. GARDINER]232-e. gardiner . "[95-lydia]

[Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet and [[his]86-mr. bennet daughters]443-his daughters saw all the advantages of [Wickham]156-wickham 's removal from [the ----shire]2505-the ----shire , as clearly as [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner could do . But [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , was not so well pleased with it . [Lydia]95-lydia 's being settled in [the North]2506-the north , just when [she]95-lydia had expected most pleasure and pride in [her]95-lydia company , for [she]95-lydia had by no means given up [her]95-lydia plan of [their]2507-their residing in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , was a severe disappointment ; and besides , it was such a pity that [Lydia]95-lydia should be taken from [a regiment where [she]95-lydia was acquainted with every body , and had so many favourites]2508-a regiment where she was acquainted with every body , and had so many favourites .

" [She]95-lydia is so fond of [Mrs. Forster]204-mrs. forster , "[95-lydia] said [she]95-lydia , " it will be quite shocking to send [her]95-lydia away ! And there are [several of [the young men]4818-the young men]4817-several of the young men , too , that [she]95-lydia likes very much . [The officers]466-the officers may not be so pleasant in [General ---- 's regiment]4805-general ---- 's regiment . "[95-lydia]

[[His]2509-his daughter]1127-his daughter 's request , for such it might be considered , of being admitted into [[her]1127-his daughter family]905-her family again , before [she]1127-his daughter set off for [the North]2506-the north , received at first an absolute negative . But [Jane]94-jane and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , who agreed in wishing , for the sake of [[their]2513-they sister]964-their sister 's feelings and consequence , that [she]1127-his daughter should be noticed on [her]1127-his daughter marriage by [[her]1127-his daughter parents]1737-her parents , urged [him]2509-his so earnestly , yet so rationally and so mildly , to receive [her]1127-his daughter and [[her]1127-his daughter husband]276-her husband at [Longbourn]7-longbourn , as soon as [they]2513-they were married , that [he]2509-his was prevailed on to think as [they]2513-they thought , and act as [they]2513-they wished . And [[their]2513-they mother]446-their mother had the satisfaction of knowing , that [she]446-their mother should be able to shew [[her]446-their mother married daughter]2518-her married daughter in [the neighbourhood]3040-the neighbourhood , before [she]446-their mother was banished to [the North]2506-the north . When [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet wrote again to [[his]86-mr. bennet brother]2346-his brother , therefore , [he]86-mr. bennet sent [his]86-mr. bennet permission for [them]2513-they to come ; and it was settled , that as soon as the ceremony was over , [they]2513-they should proceed to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was surprised , however , that [Wickham]156-wickham should consent to such a scheme , and , had [she]93-elizabeth consulted only [her]93-elizabeth own inclination , any meeting with [him]156-wickham would have been the last object of [her]93-elizabeth wishes .

CHAPTER IX .

[[Their]2513-they sister]964-their sister 's wedding day arrived ; and [Jane]94-jane and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth felt for [her]964-their sister probably more than [she]964-their sister felt for [herself]964-their sister . [The carriage]3221-the carriage was sent to meet [them]2513-they at ---- , and [they]2513-they were to return in [it]3221-the carriage , by dinner - time . [Their]2513-they arrival was dreaded by [the elder Miss Bennets]111-the bennets ; and [Jane]94-jane more especially , who gave [Lydia]95-lydia the feelings which would have attended [herself]94-jane , had _ [she]94-jane _ been [the culprit]2524-the culprit , was wretched in the thought of what [[her]94-jane sister]348-her sister must endure .

[They]2513-they came . [The family]432-the family were assembled in [the breakfast room]2398-the breakfast room , to receive [them]2513-they . Smiles decked the face of [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , as [the carriage]3221-the carriage drove up to the door ; [[her]96-mrs. bennet husband]276-her husband looked impenetrably grave ; [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughters]257-her daughters , alarmed , anxious , uneasy .

[Lydia]95-lydia 's voice was heard in [the vestibule]1023-the vestibule ; the door was thrown open , and [she]95-lydia ran into [the room]271-the room . [[Her]95-lydia mother]261-her mother stepped forwards , embraced [her]95-lydia , and welcomed [her]95-lydia with rapture ; gave [her]95-lydia hand with an affectionate smile to [Wickham]156-wickham , who followed [[his]156-wickham lady]250-his lady , and wished [them]2535-their both joy , with an alacrity which [shewed]2536-shewed no doubt of [their]2535-their happiness .

[Their]2535-their reception from [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet , to whom [they]2535-their then turned , was not quite so cordial . [His]86-mr. bennet countenance rather gained in austerity ; and [he]86-mr. bennet scarcely opened [his]86-mr. bennet lips . The easy assurance of [the young couple]2537-the young couple , indeed , was enough to provoke [him]86-mr. bennet . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was disgusted , and even [Miss Bennet]95-lydia was shocked . [Lydia]95-lydia was [Lydia]95-lydia still ; untamed , unabashed , wild , noisy , and fearless . [She]95-lydia turned from [sister]3866-sister to [sister]3866-sister , demanding [their]2535-their congratulations , and when at length [they]2535-their all sat down , looked eagerly round [the room]271-the room , took notice of some little alteration in it , and observed , with a laugh , that it was a great while since [she]95-lydia had been [there]325-there .

[Wickham]156-wickham was not at all more distressed than [herself]93-elizabeth , but [his]156-wickham manners were always so pleasing , that had [his]156-wickham character and [his]156-wickham marriage been exactly what [they]2535-their ought , [his]156-wickham smiles and [his]156-wickham easy address , while [he]156-wickham claimed [their]2535-their relationship , would have delighted [them]2535-their all . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had not before believed [him]156-wickham quite equal to such assurance ; but [she]93-elizabeth sat down , resolving within [herself]93-elizabeth , to draw no limits in future to the impudence of [an impudent man]2542-an impudent man . _ [She]93-elizabeth _ blushed , and [Jane]94-jane blushed ; but the cheeks of [the two who caused [their]2535-their confusion]2543-the two who caused their confusion , suffered no variation of colour .

There was no want of discourse . [The bride]1250-the bride and [[her]1250-the bride mother]261-her mother could neither of [them]2535-their talk fast enough ; and [Wickham]156-wickham , who happened to sit near [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , began enquiring after [his]156-wickham acquaintance in [that neighbourhood]3264-that neighbourhood , with a good humoured ease , which [she]93-elizabeth felt very unable to equal in [her]93-elizabeth replies . [They]2535-their seemed each of [them]2535-their to have the happiest memories in [the world]323-the world . Nothing of the past was recollected with pain ; and [Lydia]95-lydia led voluntarily to subjects , which [[her]93-elizabeth sisters]3048-her sisters would not have alluded to for [the world]323-the world .

" Only think of its being three months , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth cried , " since [I]93-elizabeth went away ; it seems but a fortnight [I]93-elizabeth declare ; and yet there have been things enough happened in the time . Good gracious ! when [I]93-elizabeth went away , [I]93-elizabeth am sure [I]93-elizabeth had no more idea of being married till [I]93-elizabeth came back again ! though [I]93-elizabeth thought it would be very good fun if [I]93-elizabeth was . "[93-elizabeth]

[[Her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father lifted up [his]264-her father eyes . [Jane]94-jane was distressed . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth looked expressively at [Lydia]95-lydia ; but [she]93-elizabeth , who never heard nor saw any thing of which [she]93-elizabeth chose to be insensible , gaily continued , " Oh ! [mamma]4821-mamma , do [the people here abouts]4822-the people here abouts know [I]93-elizabeth am married to - day ? [I]93-elizabeth was afraid [they]4822-the people here abouts might not ; and [we]4823-we overtook [William Goulding]233-william goulding in [his]233-william goulding curricle , so [I]93-elizabeth was determined [he]233-william goulding should know it , and so [I]93-elizabeth let down the side glass next to [him]233-william goulding , and took off [my]93-elizabeth glove , and let [my]93-elizabeth hand just rest upon the window frame , so that [he]233-william goulding might see the ring , and then [I]93-elizabeth bowed and smiled like any thing . "[93-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth could bear it no longer . [She]93-elizabeth got up , and ran out of [the room]271-the room ; and returned no more , till [she]93-elizabeth heard [them]2552-them passing through [the hall]708-the hall to [the dining - parlour]528-the dining - parlour . [She]93-elizabeth then joined [them]2552-them soon enough to see [Lydia]95-lydia , with anxious parade , walk up to [[her]95-lydia mother]261-her mother 's right hand , and hear [her]95-lydia say to [[her]95-lydia eldest sister]938-her eldest sister , " Ah ! [Jane]94-jane , [I]95-lydia take [your]94-jane place now , and [you]94-jane must go lower , because [I]95-lydia am [a married woman]4824-a married woman . "[95-lydia]

It was not to be supposed that time would give [Lydia]95-lydia that embarrassment , from which [she]95-lydia had been so wholly free at first . [Her]93-elizabeth ease and good spirits increased . [She]93-elizabeth longed to see [Mrs. Philips]127-mrs. philips , [the Lucases]2557-the lucases , and all [[their]2552-them other neighbours]2558-their other neighbours , and to hear [herself]93-elizabeth called " [Mrs. Wickham]229-mrs. wickham , "[93-elizabeth] by each of [them]2552-them ; and in the mean time , [she]93-elizabeth went after dinner to shew [her]93-elizabeth ring and boast of being married , to [Mrs. Hill]148-hill and [the two housemaids]2559-the two housemaids .

" Well , [mamma]4821-mamma , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , when [they]2552-them were all returned to [the breakfast room]2398-the breakfast room , " and what do [you]4821-mamma think of [[my]93-elizabeth husband]4826-my husband ? Is not [he]4826-my husband [a charming man]4827-a charming man ? [I]93-elizabeth am sure [[my]93-elizabeth sisters]4828-my sisters must all envy [me]93-elizabeth . [I]93-elizabeth only hope [they]4828-my sisters may have half [my]93-elizabeth good luck . [They]4828-my sisters must all go to [Brighton]40-brighton . That is the place to get [husbands]4340-husbands . What a pity it is , [mamma]4821-mamma , [we]2552-them did not all go . "[93-elizabeth]

" Very true ; and if [I]93-elizabeth had [my]93-elizabeth will , [we]2552-them should . But [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Lydia]95-lydia , [I]93-elizabeth do n't at all like [your]95-lydia going such a way off . Must it be so ? "[93-elizabeth]

" Oh , [lord]4341-lord ! yes;--there is nothing in that . [I]93-elizabeth shall like it of all things . [You]95-lydia and [papa]4396-papa , and [[my]93-elizabeth sisters]4828-my sisters , must come down and see [us]2552-them . [We]2552-them shall be at [Newcastle]75-newcastle all the winter , and [I]93-elizabeth dare say there will be some balls , and [I]93-elizabeth will take care to get [good partners]4835-good partners for [them]2552-them all . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]261-her mother should like it beyond any thing ! "[261-her mother] said [[her]2561-her mother]261-her mother .

" And then when [you]95-lydia go away , [you]95-lydia may leave [one or two of [[my]93-elizabeth sisters]4828-my sisters]4836-one or two of my sisters behind [you]95-lydia ; and [I]93-elizabeth dare say [I]93-elizabeth shall get [husbands]4340-husbands for [them]2552-them before the winter is over . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth thank [you]95-lydia for [my]93-elizabeth share of the favour , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; " but [I]93-elizabeth do not particularly like [your]95-lydia way of getting [husbands]4340-husbands . "[93-elizabeth]

[[Their]2563-their visitors]2128-their visitors were not to remain above ten days with [them]2563-their . [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham had received [his]156-wickham commission before [he]156-wickham left [London]5-london , and [he]156-wickham was to join [[his]156-wickham regiment]4813-his regiment at the end of a fortnight .

[No one]3275-no one but [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , regretted that [their]2563-their stay would be so short ; and [she]96-mrs. bennet made the most of the time , by visiting about with [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter , and having very frequent parties at [home]3223-home . These parties were acceptable to [all]778-all ; to avoid a family circle was even more desirable to such as did think , than such as did not .

[Wickham]156-wickham 's affection for [Lydia]95-lydia , was just what [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had expected to find it ; not equal to [Lydia]95-lydia 's for [him]156-wickham . [She]93-elizabeth had scarcely needed [her]93-elizabeth present observation to be satisfied , from the reason of things , that [their]2563-their elopement had been brought on by the strength of [her]93-elizabeth love , rather than by [his]156-wickham ; and [she]93-elizabeth would have wondered why , without violently caring for [her]93-elizabeth , [he]156-wickham chose to elope with [her]93-elizabeth at all , had [she]93-elizabeth not felt certain that [his]156-wickham flight was rendered necessary by distress of circumstances ; and if that were the case , [he]156-wickham was not [the young man]787-the young man to resist an opportunity of having [a companion]1332-a companion .

[Lydia]95-lydia was exceedingly fond of [him]156-wickham . [He]156-wickham was [[her]95-lydia dear]2572-her dear [Wickham]156-wickham on every occasion ; [no one]3275-no one was to be put in competition with [him]156-wickham . [He]156-wickham did every thing best in [the world]323-the world ; and [she]93-elizabeth was sure [he]156-wickham would kill more birds on the first of September , than [any body else in [the country]460-the country]2575-any body else in the country .

One morning , soon after [their]2577-their arrival , as [she]93-elizabeth was sitting with [[her]93-elizabeth two elder sisters]2578-her two elder sisters , [she]93-elizabeth said to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ,

" [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [I]93-elizabeth never gave _ [you]93-elizabeth _ an account of [my]93-elizabeth wedding , [I]93-elizabeth believe . [You]93-elizabeth were not by , when [I]93-elizabeth told [mamma]4821-mamma , and [the others]517-the others , all about it . Are not [you]93-elizabeth curious to hear how it was managed ? "[93-elizabeth]

" No really , "[93-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; " [I]93-elizabeth think there can not be too little said on the subject . "[93-elizabeth]

" La ! [You]93-elizabeth are so strange ! But [I]93-elizabeth must tell [you]93-elizabeth how it went off . [We]4842-we were married , [you]93-elizabeth know , at [St. Clement 's]76-st. clement 's , because [[Wickham]156-wickham 's lodgings]4843-wickham 's lodgings were in [that parish]4844-that parish . And it was settled that [we]4842-we should all be [there]325-there by eleven o'clock . [[My]93-elizabeth uncle]3468-my uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt and [I]93-elizabeth were to go together ; and [the others]517-the others were to meet [us]4842-we at [the church]3507-the church . Well , Monday morning came , and [I]93-elizabeth was in such a fuss ! [I]93-elizabeth was so afraid [you]93-elizabeth know that something would happen to put it off , and then [I]93-elizabeth should have gone quite distracted . And there was [[my]93-elizabeth aunt]3208-my aunt , all the time [I]93-elizabeth was dressing , preaching and talking away just as if [she]3208-my aunt was reading a sermon . However , [I]93-elizabeth did not hear above one word in ten , for [I]93-elizabeth was thinking , [you]93-elizabeth may suppose , of [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Wickham]156-wickham . [I]93-elizabeth longed to know whether [he]156-wickham would be married in [his]156-wickham blue coat . "[93-elizabeth]

" Well , and so [we]4842-we breakfasted at ten as usual ; [I]93-elizabeth thought it would never be over ; for , by the bye , [you]93-elizabeth are to understand , that [[my]93-elizabeth uncle]3468-my uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt were horrid unpleasant all the time [I]93-elizabeth was with [them]4854-them . If [you]93-elizabeth 'll believe [me]93-elizabeth , [I]93-elizabeth did not once put [my]93-elizabeth foot out of doors , though [I]93-elizabeth was there a fortnight . [Not one party]4855-not one party , or scheme , or any thing . To be sure [London]5-london was rather thin , but however [the little Theatre]4856-the little theatre was open . Well , and so just as [the carriage]3221-the carriage came to the door , [[my]93-elizabeth uncle]3468-my uncle was called away upon business to [that horrid man [Mr. Stone]234-mr. stone]4859-that horrid man mr. stone . And then , [you]93-elizabeth know , when once [they]4854-them get together , there is no end of it . Well , [I]93-elizabeth was so frightened [I]93-elizabeth did not know what to do , for [[my]93-elizabeth uncle]3468-my uncle was to give [me]93-elizabeth away ; and if [we]4861-we were beyond the hour , [we]4861-we could not be married all day . But , luckily , [he]3468-my uncle came back again in ten minutes time , and then [we]4861-we all set out . However , [I]93-elizabeth recollected afterwards , that if [he]3468-my uncle _ had _ been prevented going , the wedding need not be put off , for [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy might have done as well . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy ! "[93-elizabeth] repeated [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , in utter amazement .

" Oh , yes!--he was to come [there]325-there with [Wickham]156-wickham , [you]93-elizabeth know . But gracious [me]93-elizabeth ! [I]93-elizabeth quite forgot ! [I]93-elizabeth ought not to have said a word about it . [I]93-elizabeth promised [them]4863-them so faithfully ! What will [Wickham]156-wickham say ? It was to be such a secret ! "[93-elizabeth]

" If it was to be secret , "[94-jane] said [Jane]94-jane , " say not another word on the subject . [You]93-elizabeth may depend upon [my]94-jane seeking no further . "[94-jane]

" Oh ! certainly , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , though burning with curiosity ; " [we]4864-we will ask [you]93-elizabeth no questions . "[93-elizabeth]

" Thank [you]93-elizabeth , "[95-lydia] said [Lydia]95-lydia , " for if [you]93-elizabeth did , [I]95-lydia should certainly tell [you]93-elizabeth all , and then [Wickham]156-wickham would be angry . "[95-lydia]

On such encouragement to ask , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was forced to put it out of [her]93-elizabeth power , by running away .

But to live in ignorance on such a point was impossible ; or at least it was impossible not to try for information . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy had been at [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister 's wedding . It was exactly a scene , and exactly among [people]3236-people , where [he]100-mr. darcy had apparently least to do , and least temptation to go . Conjectures as to the meaning of it , rapid and wild , hurried into [her]93-elizabeth brain ; but [she]93-elizabeth was satisfied with none . Those that best pleased [her]93-elizabeth , as placing [his]100-mr. darcy conduct in the noblest light , seemed most improbable . [She]93-elizabeth could not bear such suspense ; and hastily seizing a sheet of paper , wrote a short letter to [[her]93-elizabeth aunt]1226-her aunt , to request an explanation of what [Lydia]95-lydia had dropt , if it were compatible with the secrecy which had been intended .

" [You]1226-her aunt may readily comprehend , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth added , " what [my]93-elizabeth curiosity must be to know how [a person unconnected with any of [us]4866-us]4865-a person unconnected with any of us , and ( comparatively speaking ) [a stranger to [[our]4866-us family]4868-our family]4867-a stranger to our family , should have been amongst [you]1226-her aunt at such a time . Pray write instantly , and let [me]93-elizabeth understand it -- unless it is , for very cogent reasons , to remain in the secrecy which [Lydia]95-lydia seems to think necessary ; and then [I]93-elizabeth must endeavour to be satisfied with ignorance . "[93-elizabeth]

" Not that [I]93-elizabeth _ shall _ though , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth added to [herself]93-elizabeth , as [she]93-elizabeth finished the letter ; " and [[my]93-elizabeth dear aunt]3907-my dear aunt , if [you]3907-my dear aunt do not tell [me]93-elizabeth in an honourable manner , [I]93-elizabeth shall certainly be reduced to tricks and stratagems to find it out . "[93-elizabeth]

[Jane]94-jane 's delicate sense of honour would not allow [her]94-jane to speak to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth privately of what [Lydia]95-lydia had let fall ; [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was glad of it;--till it appeared whether [her]93-elizabeth inquiries would receive any satisfaction , [she]93-elizabeth had rather be without [a confidante]2582-a confidante .

CHAPTER X.

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had the satisfaction of receiving an answer to [her]93-elizabeth letter , as soon as [she]93-elizabeth possibly could . [She]93-elizabeth was no sooner in possession of it , than hurrying into [the little copse]4737-the little copse , where [she]93-elizabeth was least likely to be interrupted , [she]93-elizabeth sat down on one of the benches , and prepared to be happy ; for the length of the letter convinced [her]93-elizabeth that it did not contain a denial .

" [Gracechurch - street]39-gracechurch - street , Sept. 6 . "[93-elizabeth]

" [[MY]93-elizabeth DEAR NIECE]4870-my dear niece , "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth have just received [your]4870-my dear niece letter , and shall devote this whole morning to answering it , as [I]93-elizabeth foresee that a _ little _ writing will not comprise what [I]93-elizabeth have to tell [you]4870-my dear niece . [I]93-elizabeth must confess [myself]93-elizabeth surprised by [your]4870-my dear niece application ; [I]93-elizabeth did not expect it from _ [you]4870-my dear niece _ . Do n't think [me]93-elizabeth angry , however , for [I]93-elizabeth only mean to let [you]4870-my dear niece know , that [I]93-elizabeth had not imagined such enquiries to be necessary on _ [your]4870-my dear niece _ side . If [you]4870-my dear niece do not choose to understand [me]93-elizabeth , forgive [my]93-elizabeth impertinence . [[Your]4870-my dear niece uncle]3373-your uncle is as much surprised as [I]93-elizabeth am -- and nothing but the belief of [your]4870-my dear niece being [a party concerned]4872-a party concerned , would have allowed [him]3373-your uncle to act as [he]3373-your uncle has done . But if [you]4870-my dear niece are really innocent and ignorant , [I]93-elizabeth must be more explicit . On the very day of [my]93-elizabeth coming [home]3223-home from [Longbourn]7-longbourn , [[your]4870-my dear niece uncle]3373-your uncle had [a most unexpected visitor]4875-a most unexpected visitor . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy called , and was shut up with [him]3373-your uncle several hours . It was all over before [I]93-elizabeth arrived ; so [my]93-elizabeth curiosity was not so dreadfully racked as _ [your]4870-my dear niece 's _ seems to have been . [He]3373-your uncle came to tell [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner that [he]3373-your uncle had found out where [[your]4870-my dear niece sister]3152-your sister and [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham were , and that [he]3373-your uncle had seen and talked with [them]4877-them both , [Wickham]156-wickham repeatedly , Lydia once . From what [I]93-elizabeth can collect , [he]3373-your uncle left [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire only one day after [ourselves]4878-ourselves , and came to [town]285-town with the resolution of hunting for [them]4877-them . The motive professed , was [his]3373-your uncle conviction of its being owing to [himself]3373-your uncle that [Wickham]156-wickham 's worthlessness had not been so well known , as to make it impossible for [any young woman of character]4880-any young woman of character , to love or confide in [him]3373-your uncle . [He]3373-your uncle generously imputed the whole to [his]3373-your uncle mistaken pride , and confessed that [he]3373-your uncle had before thought it beneath [him]3373-your uncle , to lay [his]3373-your uncle private actions open to [the world]323-the world . [His]3373-your uncle character was to speak for itself . [He]3373-your uncle called it , therefore , [his]3373-your uncle duty to step forward , and endeavour to remedy an evil , which had been brought on by [himself]3373-your uncle . If [he]3373-your uncle _ had another _ motive , [I]93-elizabeth am sure it would never disgrace [him]3373-your uncle . [He]3373-your uncle had been some days in [town]285-town , before [he]3373-your uncle was able to discover them ; but [he]3373-your uncle had something to direct [his]3373-your uncle search , which was more than _ [we]4883-we _ had ; and the consciousness of this , was another reason for [his]3373-your uncle resolving to follow [us]4883-we . There is [a lady]3166-a lady , it seems , [a Mrs. Younge , who was some time ago governess to [Miss Darcy]139-miss darcy , and was dismissed from [her]3166-a lady charge on some cause of disapprobation , though [he]3373-your uncle did not say what]139-miss darcy . [She]3166-a lady then took [a large house in [Edward - street]77-edward - street]4885-a large house in edward - street , and has since maintained [herself]3166-a lady by [letting lodgings]4886-letting lodgings . [This Mrs. Younge]139-miss darcy was , [he]3373-your uncle knew , intimately acquainted with [Wickham]156-wickham ; and [he]3373-your uncle went to [her]3166-a lady for intelligence of [him]156-wickham , as soon as [he]3373-your uncle got to [town]285-town . But it was two or three days before [he]3373-your uncle could get from [her]3166-a lady what [he]3373-your uncle wanted . [She]3166-a lady would not betray [her]3166-a lady trust , [I]93-elizabeth suppose , without bribery and corruption , for [she]3166-a lady really did know where [[her]3166-a lady friend]418-her friend was to be found . [Wickham]156-wickham indeed had gone to [her]3166-a lady , on [their]4889-their first arrival in [London]5-london , and had [she]3166-a lady been able to receive [them]4889-their into [[her]3166-a lady house]4890-her house , [they]4889-their would have taken up [[their]4889-their abode]4891-their abode with [her]3166-a lady . At length , however , [[our]4892-our kind friend]4893-our kind friend procured the wished - for direction . [They]4889-their were in ---- [street]4894-street . [He]4893-our kind friend saw [Wickham]156-wickham , and afterwards insisted on seeing [Lydia]95-lydia . [His]4893-our kind friend first object with [her]3166-a lady , [he]4893-our kind friend acknowledged , had been to persuade [her]3166-a lady to quit [her]3166-a lady present disgraceful situation , and return to [[her]3166-a lady friends]330-her friends as soon as [they]330-her friends could be prevailed on to receive [her]3166-a lady , offering [his]4893-our kind friend assistance , as far as it would go . But [he]4893-our kind friend found [Lydia]95-lydia absolutely resolved on remaining where [she]95-lydia was . [She]95-lydia cared for [none of [[her]95-lydia friends]330-her friends]4896-none of her friends , [she]95-lydia wanted no help of [his]4893-our kind friend , [she]95-lydia would not hear of leaving [Wickham]156-wickham . [She]95-lydia was sure [they]4898-they should be married some time or other , and it did not much signify when . Since such were [her]95-lydia feelings , it only remained , [he]4893-our kind friend thought , to secure and expedite a marriage , which , in [his]4893-our kind friend very first conversation with [Wickham]156-wickham , [he]4893-our kind friend easily learnt , had never been _ [his]4893-our kind friend _ design . [He]4893-our kind friend confessed [himself]4893-our kind friend obliged to leave [the regiment]656-the regiment , on account of some debts of honour , which were very pressing ; and scrupled not to lay all the ill - consequences of [Lydia]95-lydia 's flight , on [her]95-lydia own folly alone . [He]4893-our kind friend meant to resign [his]4893-our kind friend commission immediately ; and as to [his]4893-our kind friend future situation , [he]4893-our kind friend could conjecture very little about it . [He]4893-our kind friend must go somewhere , but [he]4893-our kind friend did not know where , and [he]4893-our kind friend knew [he]4893-our kind friend should have nothing to live on . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy asked [him]4893-our kind friend why [he]4893-our kind friend had not married [[your]4900-your sister]3152-your sister at once . Though [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet was not imagined to be very rich , [he]86-mr. bennet would have been able to do something for [him]86-mr. bennet , and [his]86-mr. bennet situation must have been benefited by marriage . But [he]4893-our kind friend found , in reply to this question , that [Wickham]156-wickham still cherished the hope of more effectually making [his]156-wickham fortune by marriage , in [some other country]4902-some other country . Under such circumstances , however , [he]156-wickham was not likely to be proof against the temptation of immediate relief . [They]4903-they met several times , for there was much to be discussed . [Wickham]156-wickham of course wanted more than [he]156-wickham could get ; but at length was reduced to be reasonable . Every thing being settled between _ [them]4903-they _ , [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy 's next step was to make [[your]4900-your uncle]3373-your uncle acquainted with it , and [he]3373-your uncle first called in [Gracechurch - street]39-gracechurch - street the evening before [I]93-elizabeth came [home]3223-home . But [Mr. Gardiner]180-mr. gardiner could not be seen , and [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy found , on further enquiry , that [[your]4900-your father]3227-your father was still with [him]3373-your uncle , but would quit [town]285-town the next morning . [He]3373-your uncle did not judge [[your]4900-your father]3227-your father to be [a person whom [he]3373-your uncle could so properly consult as [[your]4900-your uncle]3373-your uncle , and therefore readily postponed seeing [him]3227-your father , till after the departure of [the former]347-the former]4909-a person whom he could so properly consult as your uncle , and therefore readily postponed seeing him , till after the departure of the former . [He]3373-your uncle did not leave [his]3373-your uncle name , and till the next day , it was only known that [a gentleman had called on business]4912-a gentleman had called on business . On Saturday [he]3373-your uncle came again . [[Your]4900-your father]3227-your father was gone , [[your]4900-your uncle]3373-your uncle at [home]3223-home , and , as [I]93-elizabeth said before , [they]4916-they had a great deal of talk together . [They]4916-they met again on Sunday , and then _ [I]93-elizabeth _ saw [him]3373-your uncle too . It was not all settled before Monday : as soon as it was , the express was sent off to [Longbourn]7-longbourn . But [[our]4917-our visitor]4918-our visitor was very obstinate . [I]93-elizabeth fancy , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , that obstinacy is the real defect of [his]3373-your uncle character after all . [He]3373-your uncle has been accused of many faults at different times ; but _ this _ is the true one . Nothing was to be done that [he]3373-your uncle did not do [himself]3373-your uncle ; though [I]93-elizabeth am sure ( and [I]93-elizabeth do not speak it to be thanked , therefore say nothing about it , ) [[your]4900-your uncle]3373-your uncle would most readily have settled the whole . [They]4916-they battled it together for a long time , which was more than either [the gentleman]306-the gentleman or lady concerned in it deserved . But at last [[your]4900-your uncle]3373-your uncle was forced to yield , and instead of being allowed to be of use to [[his]3373-your uncle niece]4922-his niece , was forced to put up with only having the probable credit of it , which went sorely against the grain ; and [I]93-elizabeth really believe [your]4900-your letter this morning gave [him]3373-your uncle great pleasure , because it required an explanation that would rob [him]3373-your uncle of [his]3373-your uncle borrowed feathers , and give the praise where it was due . But , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , this must go no farther than [yourself]4900-your , or [Jane]94-jane at most . [You]4900-your know pretty well , [I]93-elizabeth suppose , what has been done for [the young people]826-the young people . [His]3373-your uncle debts are to be paid , amounting , [I]93-elizabeth believe , to considerably more than a thousand pounds , another thousand in addition to [her]4922-his niece own settled upon _ [her]4922-his niece _ , and [his]3373-your uncle commission purchased . The reason why all this was to be done by [him]3373-your uncle alone , was such as [I]93-elizabeth have given above . It was owing to [him]3373-your uncle , to [his]3373-your uncle reserve , and want of proper consideration , that [Wickham]156-wickham 's character had been so misunderstood , and consequently that [he]3373-your uncle had been received and noticed as [he]3373-your uncle was . Perhaps there was some truth in _ this _ ; though [I]93-elizabeth doubt whether _ [his]3373-your uncle _ reserve , or _ [anybody]605-anybody 's _ reserve , can be answerable for the event . But in spite of all this fine talking , [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [you]93-elizabeth may rest perfectly assured , that [[your]93-elizabeth uncle]3373-your uncle would never have yielded , if [we]4927-us had not given [him]3373-your uncle credit for _ another interest _ in the affair . When all this was resolved on , [he]3373-your uncle returned again to [[his]3373-your uncle friends]423-his friends , who were still staying at [Pemberley]12-pemberley ; but it was agreed that [he]3373-your uncle should be in [London]5-london once more when the wedding took place , and all money matters were then to receive the last finish . [I]93-elizabeth believe [I]93-elizabeth have now told [you]93-elizabeth every thing . It is a relation which [you]93-elizabeth tell [me]93-elizabeth is to give [you]93-elizabeth great surprise ; [I]93-elizabeth hope at least it will not afford [you]93-elizabeth any displeasure . [Lydia]95-lydia came to [us]4927-us ; and [Wickham]156-wickham had constant admission to [the house]3026-the house . _ [He]156-wickham _ was exactly what [he]156-wickham had been , when [I]93-elizabeth knew [him]156-wickham in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire ; but [I]93-elizabeth would not tell [you]93-elizabeth how little [I]93-elizabeth was satisfied with _ [her]95-lydia _ behaviour while [she]95-lydia staid with [us]4927-us , if [I]93-elizabeth had not perceived , by [Jane]94-jane 's letter last Wednesday , that [her]95-lydia conduct on coming [home]3223-home was exactly of a piece with it , and therefore what [I]93-elizabeth now tell [you]93-elizabeth , can give [you]93-elizabeth no fresh pain . [I]93-elizabeth talked to [her]95-lydia repeatedly in the most serious manner , representing to [her]95-lydia all the wickedness of what [she]95-lydia had done , and all the unhappiness [she]95-lydia had brought on [[her]95-lydia family]905-her family . If [she]95-lydia heard [me]93-elizabeth , it was by good luck , for [I]93-elizabeth am sure [she]95-lydia did not listen . [I]93-elizabeth was sometimes quite provoked , but then [I]93-elizabeth recollected [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth and [Jane]94-jane , and for [their]3018-my dear sakes had patience with [her]95-lydia . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy was punctual in [his]100-mr. darcy return , and as [Lydia]95-lydia informed [you]4933-you , attended the wedding . [He]100-mr. darcy dined with [us]4934-us the next day , and was to leave [town]285-town again on Wednesday or Thursday . Will [you]4933-you be very angry with [me]93-elizabeth , [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , if [I]93-elizabeth take this opportunity of saying ( what [I]93-elizabeth was never bold enough to say before ) how much [I]93-elizabeth like [him]100-mr. darcy . [His]100-mr. darcy behaviour to [us]4934-us has , in every respect , been as pleasing as when [we]4934-us were in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . [His]100-mr. darcy understanding and opinions all please [me]93-elizabeth ; [he]100-mr. darcy wants nothing but a little more liveliness , and _ that _ , if [he]100-mr. darcy marry _ prudently _ , [[his]100-mr. darcy wife]251-his wife may teach [him]100-mr. darcy . [I]93-elizabeth thought [him]100-mr. darcy very sly;--he hardly ever mentioned [your]93-elizabeth name . But slyness seems the fashion . Pray forgive [me]93-elizabeth , if [I]93-elizabeth have been very presuming , or at least do not punish [me]93-elizabeth so far , as to exclude [me]93-elizabeth from P. [I]93-elizabeth shall never be quite happy till [I]93-elizabeth have been all round [the park]1342-the park . A low phaeton , with [a nice little pair of ponies]4939-a nice little pair of ponies , would be the very thing . But [I]93-elizabeth must write no more . [The children]1862-the children have been wanting [me]93-elizabeth this half hour . [Your]93-elizabeth 's , very sincerely , "[93-elizabeth]

" [M. GARDINER]235-m. gardiner . "[93-elizabeth]

The contents of this letter threw [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth into a flutter of spirits , in which it was difficult to determine whether pleasure or pain bore the greatest share . The vague and unsettled suspicions which uncertainty had produced of what [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy might have been doing to forward [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister 's match , which [she]93-elizabeth had feared to encourage , as an exertion of goodness too great to be probable , and at the same time dreaded to be just , from the pain of obligation , were proved beyond their greatest extent to be true ! [He]100-mr. darcy had followed [them]2585-them purposely to [town]285-town , [he]100-mr. darcy had taken on [himself]100-mr. darcy all the trouble and mortification attendant on such a research ; in which supplication had been necessary to [a woman whom [he]100-mr. darcy must abominate and despise , and where [he]100-mr. darcy was reduced to meet , frequently meet , reason with , persuade , and finally bribe]2587-a woman whom he must abominate and despise , and where he was reduced to meet , frequently meet , reason with , persuade , and finally bribe , [the man whom [he]100-mr. darcy always most wished to avoid , and whose very name it was punishment to [him]100-mr. darcy to pronounce]2588-the man whom he always most wished to avoid , and whose very name it was punishment to him to pronounce . [He]100-mr. darcy had done all this for [a girl whom [he]100-mr. darcy could neither regard nor esteem]2589-a girl whom he could neither regard nor esteem . [Her]93-elizabeth heart did whisper , that [he]100-mr. darcy had done it for [her]2589-a girl whom he could neither regard nor esteem . But it was a hope shortly checked by other considerations , and [she]93-elizabeth soon felt that even [her]93-elizabeth vanity was insufficient , when required to depend on [his]100-mr. darcy affection for [her]2589-a girl whom he could neither regard nor esteem , for [a woman who had already refused [him]100-mr. darcy , as able to overcome a sentiment so natural as abhorrence against relationship with [Wickham]156-wickham]2590-a woman who had already refused him , as able to overcome a sentiment so natural as abhorrence against relationship with wickham . [Brother - in - law of [Wickham]156-wickham]2591-brother - in - law of wickham ! Every kind of pride must revolt from the connection . [He]100-mr. darcy had to be sure done much . [She]93-elizabeth was ashamed to think how much . But [he]100-mr. darcy had given a reason for [his]100-mr. darcy interference , which asked no extraordinary stretch of belief . It was reasonable that [he]100-mr. darcy should feel [he]100-mr. darcy had been wrong ; [he]100-mr. darcy had liberality , and [he]100-mr. darcy had the means of exercising it ; and though [she]93-elizabeth would not place [herself]93-elizabeth as [his]100-mr. darcy principal inducement , [she]93-elizabeth could , perhaps , believe , that remaining partiality for [her]93-elizabeth , might assist [his]100-mr. darcy endeavours in a cause where [her]93-elizabeth peace of mind must be materially concerned . It was painful , exceedingly painful , to know that [they]2592-they were under obligations to [a person who could never receive a return]2593-a person who could never receive a return . [They]2592-they owed the restoration of [Lydia]95-lydia , [her]95-lydia character , every thing to [him]100-mr. darcy . Oh ! how heartily did [she]93-elizabeth grieve over every ungracious sensation [she]93-elizabeth had ever encouraged , every saucy speech [she]93-elizabeth had ever directed towards [him]100-mr. darcy . For [herself]93-elizabeth [she]93-elizabeth was humbled ; but [she]93-elizabeth was proud of [him]100-mr. darcy . Proud that in a cause of compassion and honour , [he]100-mr. darcy had been able to get the better of [himself]100-mr. darcy . [She]93-elizabeth read over [[her]93-elizabeth aunt]1226-her aunt 's commendation of [him]100-mr. darcy again and again . It was hardly enough ; but it pleased [her]93-elizabeth . [She]93-elizabeth was even sensible of some pleasure , though mixed with regret , on finding how steadfastly both [she]93-elizabeth and [[her]93-elizabeth uncle]583-her uncle had been persuaded that affection and confidence subsisted between [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy and [herself]93-elizabeth .

[She]93-elizabeth was roused from [her]93-elizabeth seat , and [her]93-elizabeth reflections , by [some one]2596-some one 's approach ; and before [she]93-elizabeth could strike into another path , [she]93-elizabeth was overtaken by [Wickham]156-wickham .

" [I]156-wickham am afraid [I]156-wickham interrupt [your]93-elizabeth solitary ramble , [[my]156-wickham dear sister]3799-my dear sister ? "[156-wickham] said [he]156-wickham , as [he]156-wickham joined [her]93-elizabeth .

" [You]156-wickham certainly do , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth replied with a smile ; " but it does not follow that the interruption must be unwelcome . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth should be sorry indeed , if it were . _ [We]4942-we _ were always [good friends]4943-good friends ; and now [we]4942-we are better . "[93-elizabeth]

" True . Are [the others]517-the others coming out ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth do not know . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet and [Lydia]95-lydia are going in [the carriage]3221-the carriage to [Meryton]9-meryton . And so , [[my]93-elizabeth dear sister]3799-my dear sister , [I]93-elizabeth find from [[our]4942-we uncle]4947-our uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt , that [you]3799-my dear sister have actually seen [Pemberley]12-pemberley . "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth replied in the affirmative .

" [I]93-elizabeth almost envy [you]3799-my dear sister the pleasure , and yet [I]93-elizabeth believe it would be too much for [me]93-elizabeth , or else [I]93-elizabeth could take it in [my]93-elizabeth way to [Newcastle]75-newcastle . And [you]3799-my dear sister saw [the old housekeeper]4949-the old housekeeper , [I]93-elizabeth suppose ? [Poor Reynolds]236-poor reynolds , [she]4949-the old housekeeper was always very fond of [me]93-elizabeth . But of course [she]4949-the old housekeeper did not mention [my]93-elizabeth name to [you]3799-my dear sister . "[93-elizabeth]

" Yes , [she]4949-the old housekeeper did . "[93-elizabeth]

" And what did [she]4949-the old housekeeper say ? "[93-elizabeth]

" That [you]3799-my dear sister were gone into [the army]4450-the army , and [she]4949-the old housekeeper was afraid had -- not turned out well . At such a distance as _ that _ , [you]3799-my dear sister know , things are strangely misrepresented . "[93-elizabeth]

" Certainly , "[2597-i] [he]2597-i replied , biting [his]2597-i lips . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth hoped [she]93-elizabeth had silenced [him]2597-i ; but [he]2597-i soon afterwards said ,

" [I]2597-i was surprised to see [Darcy]100-mr. darcy in [town]285-town last month . [We]4952-we passed [each other]3157-each other several times . [I]2597-i wonder what [he]100-mr. darcy can be doing [there]325-there . "[2597-i]

" Perhaps preparing for [his]100-mr. darcy marriage with [Miss de Bourgh]152-miss de bourgh , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " It must be something particular , to take [him]100-mr. darcy [there]325-there at this time of year . "[93-elizabeth]

" Undoubtedly . Did [you]3799-my dear sister see [him]100-mr. darcy while [you]3799-my dear sister were at [Lambton]53-lambton ? [I]2597-i thought [I]2597-i understood from [the Gardiners]182-the gardiners that [you]3799-my dear sister had . "[2597-i]

" Yes ; [he]100-mr. darcy introduced [us]4952-we to [[his]100-mr. darcy sister]569-his sister . "[93-elizabeth]

" And do [you]3799-my dear sister like [her]569-his sister ? "[2597-i]

" Very much . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]2597-i have heard , indeed , that [she]569-his sister is uncommonly improved within this year or two . When [I]2597-i last saw [her]569-his sister , [she]569-his sister was not very promising . [I]2597-i am very glad [you]3799-my dear sister liked [her]569-his sister . [I]2597-i hope [she]569-his sister will turn out well . "[2597-i]

" [I]93-elizabeth dare say [she]569-his sister will ; [she]569-his sister has got over the most trying age . "[93-elizabeth]

" Did [you]3799-my dear sister go by [the village of]4957-the village of [Kympton]78-kympton ? "[2597-i]

" [I]93-elizabeth do not recollect that [we]4958-we did . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]2597-i mention it , because it is the living which [I]2597-i ought to have had . [A most delightful place!--Excellent Parsonage House]4959-a most delightful place!--excellent parsonage house ! It would have suited [me]2597-i in every respect . "[2597-i]

" How should [you]3799-my dear sister have liked making sermons ? "[93-elizabeth]

" Exceedingly well . [I]2597-i should have considered it as part of [my]2597-i duty , and the exertion would soon have been nothing . [One]3064-one ought not to repine;--but , to be sure , it would have been such a thing for [me]2597-i ! The quiet , the retirement of such a life , would have answered all [my]2597-i ideas of happiness ! But it was not to be . Did [you]3799-my dear sister ever hear [Darcy]100-mr. darcy mention the circumstance , when [you]3799-my dear sister were in [Kent]18-kent ? "[2597-i]

" [I]93-elizabeth _ have _ heard from authority , which [I]93-elizabeth thought _ as good _ , that it was left [you]3799-my dear sister conditionally only , and at the will of [the present patron]4961-the present patron . "[93-elizabeth]

" [You]3799-my dear sister have . Yes , there was something in _ that _ ; [I]2597-i told [you]3799-my dear sister so from the first , [you]3799-my dear sister may remember . "[2597-i]

" [I]93-elizabeth _ did _ hear , too , that there was a time , when sermon - making was not so palatable to [you]3799-my dear sister as it seems to be at present ; that [you]3799-my dear sister actually declared [your]3799-my dear sister resolution of never taking orders , and that the business had been compromised accordingly . "[93-elizabeth]

" [You]3799-my dear sister did ! and it was not wholly without foundation . [You]3799-my dear sister may remember what [I]2597-i told [you]3799-my dear sister on that point , when first [we]2598-we talked of it . "[2597-i]

[They]2598-we were now almost at the door of [the house]3026-the house , for [she]2600-she had walked fast to get rid of [him]2601-him ; and unwilling for [[her]2600-she sister]348-her sister 's sake , to provoke [him]2601-him , [she]2600-she only said in reply , with a good - humoured smile ,

" Come , [Mr. Wickham]156-wickham , [we]2598-we are [brother]4634-brother and [sister]3866-sister , [you]156-wickham know . Do not let [us]2598-we quarrel about the past . In future , [I]2600-she hope [we]2598-we shall be always of one mind . "[2600-she]

[She]2600-she held out [her]2600-she hand ; [he]2601-him kissed it with affectionate gallantry , though [he]2601-him hardly knew how to look , and [they]2598-we entered [the house]3026-the house .

[CHAPTER XI]237-chapter xi .

[Mr. Wickham]156-wickham was so perfectly satisfied with this conversation , that [he]156-wickham never again distressed [himself]156-wickham , or provoked [[his]156-wickham dear sister]2604-his dear sister [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , by introducing the subject of it ; and [she]2600-she was pleased to find that [she]2600-she had said enough to keep [him]2601-him quiet .

The day of [his]156-wickham and [Lydia]95-lydia 's departure soon came , and [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet was forced to submit to a separation , which , as [[her]96-mrs. bennet husband]276-her husband by no means entered into [her]96-mrs. bennet scheme of [their]2598-we all going to [Newcastle]75-newcastle , was likely to continue at least a twelvemonth .

" Oh ! [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear [Lydia]95-lydia , "[96-mrs. bennet] [she]96-mrs. bennet cried , " when shall [we]2598-we meet again ? "[96-mrs. bennet]

" Oh , [lord]4341-lord ! [I]96-mrs. bennet do n't know . Not these two or three years perhaps . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" Write to [me]96-mrs. bennet very often , [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" As often as [I]96-mrs. bennet can . But [you]3018-my dear know [married women]4967-married women have never much time for writing . [[My]96-mrs. bennet sisters]4828-my sisters may write to _ [me]96-mrs. bennet _ . [They]4828-my sisters will have nothing else to do . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Mr. Wickham]156-wickham 's adieus were much more affectionate than [[his]156-wickham wife]251-his wife 's . [He]156-wickham smiled , looked handsome , and said many pretty things .

" [He]156-wickham is as fine [a fellow]4969-a fellow , "[86-mr. bennet] said [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet , as soon as [they]2607-they were out of [the house]3026-the house , " as ever [I]86-mr. bennet saw . [He]156-wickham simpers , and smirks , and makes love to [[us]2607-they all]4674-us all . [I]86-mr. bennet am prodigiously proud of [him]156-wickham . [I]86-mr. bennet defy even [Sir William Lucas]91-sir william [himself]91-sir william , to produce [a more valuable son - in - law]4971-a more valuable son - in - law . "[86-mr. bennet]

The loss of [[her]251-his wife daughter]475-her daughter made [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet very dull for several days .

" [I]251-his wife often think , "[251-his wife] said [she]251-his wife , " that there is nothing so bad as parting with [[one]3064-one 's friends]4973-one 's friends . [One]4974-one seems so forlorn without [them]4973-one 's friends . "[251-his wife]

" This is the consequence [you]96-mrs. bennet see , [Madam]3285-madam , of marrying [a daughter]1139-a daughter , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " It must make [you]96-mrs. bennet better satisfied that [[your]96-mrs. bennet other four]4977-your other four are single . "[93-elizabeth]

" It is no such thing . [Lydia]95-lydia does not leave [me]251-his wife because [she]95-lydia is married ; but only because [[her]95-lydia husband]276-her husband 's regiment happens to be so far off . If that had been nearer , [she]95-lydia would not have gone so soon . "[251-his wife]

But the spiritless condition which this event threw [her]96-mrs. bennet into , was shortly relieved , and [her]96-mrs. bennet mind opened again to the agitation of hope , by an article of news , which then began to be in circulation . [The housekeeper at [Netherfield]2-netherfield]2610-the housekeeper at netherfield had received orders to prepare for the arrival of [[her]2610-the housekeeper at netherfield master]1919-her master , who was coming down in a day or two , to shoot there for several weeks . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet was quite in the fidgets . [She]96-mrs. bennet looked at [Jane]94-jane , and smiled , and shook [her]96-mrs. bennet head by turns .

" Well , well , and so [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley is coming down , [sister]3866-sister , "[96-mrs. bennet] ( for [Mrs. Philips]127-mrs. philips first brought [her]96-mrs. bennet the news . ) " Well , so much the better . Not that [I]96-mrs. bennet care about it , though . [He]90-mr. bingley is nothing to [us]4980-us , [you]3866-sister know , and [I]96-mrs. bennet am sure _ [I]96-mrs. bennet _ never want to see [him]90-mr. bingley again . But , however , [he]90-mr. bingley is very welcome to come to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , if [he]90-mr. bingley likes it . And who knows what _ may _ happen ? But that is nothing to [us]4980-us . [You]3866-sister know , [sister]3866-sister , [we]4980-us agreed long ago never to mention a word about it . And so , is it quite certain [he]90-mr. bingley is coming ? "[96-mrs. bennet]

" [You]3866-sister may depend on it , "[3363-the other] replied [the other]3363-the other , " for [Mrs. Nicholls]143-nicholls was in [Meryton]9-meryton last night ; [I]3363-the other saw [her]143-nicholls passing by , and went out [myself]3363-the other on purpose to know the truth of it ; and [she]143-nicholls told [me]3363-the other that it was certain true . [He]2613-his comes down on Thursday at the latest , very likely on Wednesday . [She]143-nicholls was going to [the butcher]4982-the butcher 's , [she]143-nicholls told [me]3363-the other , on purpose to order in some meat on Wednesday , and [she]143-nicholls has got three couple of ducks , just fit to be killed . "[3363-the other]

[Miss Bennet]95-lydia had not been able to hear of [his]2613-his coming , without changing colour . It was many months since [she]95-lydia had mentioned [his]2613-his name to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; but now , as soon as [they]2614-they were alone together , [she]95-lydia said ,

" [I]95-lydia saw [you]93-elizabeth look at [me]95-lydia to - day , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , when [[my]95-lydia aunt]3208-my aunt told [us]2614-they of the present report ; and [I]95-lydia know [I]95-lydia appeared distressed . But do n't imagine it was from any silly cause . [I]95-lydia was only confused for the moment , because [I]95-lydia felt that [I]95-lydia _ should _ be looked at . [I]95-lydia do assure [you]93-elizabeth , that the news does not affect [me]95-lydia either with pleasure or pain . [I]95-lydia am glad of one thing , that [he]2615-him comes alone ; because [we]2614-they shall see the less of [him]2615-him . Not that [I]95-lydia am afraid of _ [myself]95-lydia _ , but [I]95-lydia dread [other people]3860-other people 's remarks . "[95-lydia]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth did not know what to make of it . Had [she]93-elizabeth not seen [him]2615-him in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , [she]93-elizabeth might have supposed [him]2615-him capable of coming [there]325-there , with no other view than what was acknowledged ; but [she]93-elizabeth still thought [him]2615-him partial to [Jane]94-jane , and [she]93-elizabeth wavered as to the greater probability of [his]2615-him coming [there]325-there _ with _ [[his]2615-him friend]307-his friend 's permission , or being bold enough to come without it .

" Yet it is hard , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth sometimes thought , " that [this poor man]4985-this poor man can not come to [a house]1071-a house , which [he]2615-him has legally hired , without raising all this speculation ! [I]93-elizabeth _ will _ leave [him]2615-him to [himself]2615-him . "[93-elizabeth]

In spite of what [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister declared , and really believed to be [her]93-elizabeth feelings , in the expectation of [his]2615-him arrival , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth could easily perceive that [her]93-elizabeth spirits were affected by it . [They]2620-they were more disturbed , more unequal , than [she]93-elizabeth had often seen [them]2620-they .

The subject which had been so warmly canvassed between [[their]2620-they parents]2621-their parents , about a twelvemonth ago , was now brought forward again .

" As soon as ever [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley comes , [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , " [you]3018-my dear will wait on [him]2615-him of course . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" No , no . [You]3018-my dear forced [me]251-his wife into visiting [him]2615-him last year , and promised if [I]251-his wife went to see [him]2615-him , [he]2615-him should marry [one of [[my]251-his wife daughters]3080-my daughters]3079-one of my daughters . But it ended in nothing , and [I]251-his wife will not be sent on [a fool]4760-a fool 's errand again . "[251-his wife]

[[His]2622-his wife]251-his wife represented to [him]2622-his how absolutely necessary such an attention would be from all [the neighbouring gentlemen]2624-the neighbouring gentlemen , on [his]2622-his returning to [Netherfield]2-netherfield .

" ' Tis an etiquette [I]2622-his despise , "[2622-his] said [he]2622-his . " If [he]2615-him wants [our]4991-we society , let [him]2615-him seek it . [He]2615-him knows where [we]4991-we live . [I]2622-his will not spend _ [my]2622-his _ hours in running after [[my]2622-his neighbours]4992-my neighbours every time [they]4992-my neighbours go away , and come back again . "[2622-his]

" Well , all [I]276-her husband know is , that it will be abominably rude if [you]4993-you do not wait on [him]2615-him . [We]4991-we must have [Mrs. Long]87-mrs. long and [the Gouldings]231-the gouldings soon . That will make thirteen with [ourselves]4991-we , so there will be just room at table for [him]2615-him . "[276-her husband]

Consoled by this resolution , [she]2625-her was the better able to bear [[her]2625-her husband]276-her husband 's incivility ; though it was very mortifying to know that [[her]2625-her neighbours]844-her neighbours might all see [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley in consequence of it , before _ [they]844-her neighbours _ did . As the day of [his]90-mr. bingley arrival drew near ,

[[My]94-jane mother]3230-my mother means well ; but [she]3230-my mother does not know , [no one]3275-no one can know how much [I]94-jane suffer from what [she]3230-my mother says . [Happy]4997-happy shall [I]94-jane be , when [his]90-mr. bingley stay at [Netherfield]2-netherfield is over ! "[94-jane]

" [I]93-elizabeth wish [I]93-elizabeth could say any thing to comfort [you]90-mr. bingley , "[93-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; " but it is wholly out of [my]93-elizabeth power . "[93-elizabeth]

[Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley arrived . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , through the assistance of [servants]1377-servants , contrived to have the earliest tidings of it , that the period of anxiety and fretfulness on [her]96-mrs. bennet side , might be as long as it could . [She]96-mrs. bennet counted the days that must intervene before [their]2630-their invitation could be sent ; hopeless of seeing [him]90-mr. bingley before . But on the third morning after [his]90-mr. bingley arrival in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , [she]96-mrs. bennet saw [him]90-mr. bingley from [her]96-mrs. bennet dressing - room window , enter [the paddock]2281-the paddock , and ride towards [the house]3026-the house .

[[Her]96-mrs. bennet daughters]257-her daughters were eagerly called to partake of [her]96-mrs. bennet joy . [Jane]94-jane resolutely kept [her]94-jane place at the table ; but [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , to satisfy [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , went to the window -- [she]93-elizabeth looked,--she saw [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy with [him]90-mr. bingley , and sat down again by [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister .

" There is [a gentleman]3404-a gentleman with [him]90-mr. bingley , [mamma]4821-mamma , "[97-lady catherine] said [Kitty]97-lady catherine ; " who can it be ? "[97-lady catherine]

" [Some acquaintance]1872-some acquaintance or other , [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear , [I]93-elizabeth suppose ; [I]93-elizabeth am sure [I]93-elizabeth do not know . "[93-elizabeth]

" La ! "[97-lady catherine] replied [Kitty]97-lady catherine , " it looks just like [that man that used to be with [him]90-mr. bingley before]5003-that man that used to be with him before . " Good gracious ! [Mr. Darcy!--and]238-mr. darcy!--and so it does [I]348-her sister vow . Well , [any friend of [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley 's]5006-any friend of mr. bingley 's will always be welcome here to be sure ; but else [I]348-her sister must say that [I]348-her sister hate the very sight of [him]2638-his . "[348-her sister]

[Jane]94-jane looked at [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth with surprise and concern . [She]94-jane knew but little of [their]2636-their meeting in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire , and therefore felt for the awkwardness which must attend [[her]94-jane sister]348-her sister , in seeing [him]2638-his almost for the first time after receiving [his]2638-his explanatory letter . [Both sisters]2639-both sisters were uncomfortable enough . [Each]2640-each felt for [the other]3363-the other , and of course for [themselves]2639-both sisters ; and [[their]2639-both sisters mother]446-their mother talked on , of [her]446-their mother dislike of [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy , and [her]446-their mother resolution to be civil to [him]2638-his only as [[Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley 's friend]2643-mr. bingley 's friend , without being heard by either of [them]2639-both sisters . But [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had sources of uneasiness which could not be suspected by [Jane]94-jane , to whom [she]94-jane had never yet had courage to shew [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner 's letter , or to relate [her]94-jane own change of sentiment towards [him]2638-his . To [Jane]94-jane , [he]2638-his could be only [a man whose proposals [she]94-jane had refused , and whose merit [she]94-jane had undervalued]2644-a man whose proposals she had refused , and whose merit she had undervalued ; but to [her]94-jane own more extensive information , [he]2638-his was the person , to whom [the whole family were indebted for the first of benefits]2645-the whole family were indebted for the first of benefits , and whom [she]94-jane regarded [herself]94-jane with an interest , if not quite so tender , at least as reasonable and just , as what [Jane]94-jane felt for [Bingley]90-mr. bingley . [Her]93-elizabeth astonishment at [his]2638-his coming -- at [his]2638-his coming to [Netherfield]2-netherfield , to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , and voluntarily seeking [her]93-elizabeth again , was almost equal to what [she]93-elizabeth had known on first witnessing [his]2638-his altered behaviour in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire .

The colour which had been driven from [her]93-elizabeth face , returned for half a minute with an additional glow , and a smile of delight added lustre to [her]93-elizabeth eyes , as [she]93-elizabeth thought for that space of time , that [his]2638-his affection and wishes must still be unshaken . But [she]93-elizabeth would not be secure .

" Let [me]93-elizabeth first see how [he]2638-his behaves , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth ; " it will then be early enough for expectation . "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth sat intently at work , striving to be composed , and without daring to lift up [her]93-elizabeth eyes , till anxious curiosity carried them to the face of [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister , as [the servant]474-the servant was approaching the door . [Jane]94-jane looked a little paler than usual , but more sedate than [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had expected . On [the gentlemen]311-the gentlemen 's appearing , [her]93-elizabeth colour increased ; yet [she]93-elizabeth received [them]311-the gentlemen with tolerable ease , and with a propriety of behaviour equally free from any symptom of resentment , or any unnecessary complaisance .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth said as little to either as civility would allow , and sat down again to [her]93-elizabeth work , with an eagerness which it did not often command . [She]93-elizabeth had ventured only one glance at [Darcy]100-mr. darcy . [He]100-mr. darcy looked serious as usual ; and [she]93-elizabeth thought , more as [he]100-mr. darcy had been used to look in [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire , than as [she]93-elizabeth had seen [him]100-mr. darcy at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . But , perhaps [he]100-mr. darcy could not in [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother 's presence be what [he]100-mr. darcy was before [[her]93-elizabeth uncle]583-her uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt . It was a painful , but not an improbable , conjecture .

[Bingley]90-mr. bingley , [she]93-elizabeth had likewise seen for an instant , and in that short period saw [him]90-mr. bingley looking both pleased and embarrassed . [He]90-mr. bingley was received by [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet with a degree of civility , which made [[her]96-mrs. bennet two daughters]2652-her two daughters ashamed , especially when contrasted with the cold and ceremonious politeness of [her]96-mrs. bennet curtsey and address to [[his]90-mr. bingley friend]307-his friend .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth particularly , who knew that [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother owed to [the latter]499-the latter the preservation of [[her]261-her mother favourite daughter]2656-her favourite daughter from irremediable infamy , was hurt and distressed to a most painful degree by a distinction so ill applied .

[Darcy]100-mr. darcy , after enquiring of [her]93-elizabeth how [Mr.]2657-mr. and [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner did , a question which [she]93-elizabeth could not answer without confusion , said scarcely any thing . [He]90-mr. bingley was not seated by [her]93-elizabeth ; perhaps that was the reason of [his]90-mr. bingley silence ; but it had not been so in [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire . There [he]90-mr. bingley had talked to [[her]93-elizabeth friends]330-her friends , when [he]90-mr. bingley could not to [herself]93-elizabeth . But now several minutes elapsed , without bringing the sound of [his]90-mr. bingley voice ; and when occasionally , unable to resist the impulse of curiosity , [she]93-elizabeth raised [her]93-elizabeth eyes to [his]90-mr. bingley face , [she]93-elizabeth as often found [him]90-mr. bingley looking at [Jane]94-jane , as at [herself]93-elizabeth , and frequently on no object but the ground . More thoughtfulness , and less anxiety to please than when [they]2659-they last met , were plainly expressed . [She]93-elizabeth was disappointed , and angry with [herself]93-elizabeth for being so .

" Could [I]93-elizabeth expect it to be otherwise ! "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth . " Yet why did [he]90-mr. bingley come ? "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth was in no humour for conversation with [any one]3122-any one but [himself]90-mr. bingley ; and to [him]90-mr. bingley [she]93-elizabeth had hardly courage to speak .

[She]93-elizabeth enquired after [[his]90-mr. bingley sister]569-his sister , but could do no more .

" It is a long time , [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley , since [you]90-mr. bingley went away , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet .

[He]90-mr. bingley readily agreed to it .

" [I]90-mr. bingley began to be afraid [you]90-mr. bingley would never come back again . [People]3236-people _ did _ say , [you]90-mr. bingley meant to quit [the place]3023-the place entirely at [Michaelmas]89-michaelmas ; but , however , [I]90-mr. bingley hope it is not true . A great many changes have happened in [the neighbourhood]3040-the neighbourhood , since [you]90-mr. bingley went away . [Miss Lucas]103-miss lucas is married and settled . And [one of [[my]90-mr. bingley own daughters]5011-my own daughters]5010-one of my own daughters . [I]90-mr. bingley suppose [you]90-mr. bingley have heard of it ; indeed , [you]90-mr. bingley must have seen it in the papers . It was in the Times and [the Courier]5012-the courier , [I]90-mr. bingley know ; though it was not put in as it ought to be . It was only said , ' Lately , [George Wickham]165-george wickham , Esq . to [Miss Lydia Bennet]95-lydia , ' without there being a syllable said of [[her]95-lydia father]264-her father , or the place where [she]95-lydia lived , or any thing . It was [[my]90-mr. bingley brother]3216-my brother [Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner 's drawing up too , and [I]90-mr. bingley wonder how [he]3216-my brother came to make such an awkward business of it . Did [you]93-elizabeth see it ? "[90-mr. bingley]

[Bingley]90-mr. bingley replied that [he]90-mr. bingley did , and made [his]90-mr. bingley congratulations . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth dared not lift up [her]93-elizabeth eyes . How [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy looked , therefore , [she]93-elizabeth could not tell .

" It is a delightful thing , to be sure , to have [a daughter well married]5015-a daughter well married , "[261-her mother] continued [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , " but at the same time , [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley , it is very hard to have [her]95-lydia taken such a way from [me]261-her mother . [They]5016-they are gone down to [Newcastle]75-newcastle , [a place quite northward]5017-a place quite northward , it seems , and there [they]5016-they are to stay , [I]261-her mother do not know how long . [[His]100-mr. darcy regiment]4813-his regiment is there ; for [I]261-her mother suppose [you]93-elizabeth have heard of [his]100-mr. darcy leaving [the ----shire]7-longbourn , and of [his]100-mr. darcy being gone into the regulars . Thank [Heaven]221-heaven ! [he]100-mr. darcy has _ [some _ friends]5019-some _ friends , though perhaps not so many as [he]100-mr. darcy deserves . "[261-her mother]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , who knew this to be levelled at [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy , was in such misery of shame , that [she]93-elizabeth could hardly keep [her]93-elizabeth seat . It drew from [her]93-elizabeth , however , the exertion of speaking , which nothing else had so effectually done before ; and [she]93-elizabeth asked [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , whether [he]90-mr. bingley meant to make any stay in [the country]460-the country at present . A few weeks , [he]90-mr. bingley believed .

" When [you]90-mr. bingley have killed all [your]90-mr. bingley own birds , [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley , "[261-her mother] said [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , " [I]261-her mother beg [you]90-mr. bingley will come here , and shoot as many as [you]90-mr. bingley please , on [[Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet 's manor]5020-mr. bennet 's manor . [I]261-her mother am sure [he]86-mr. bennet will be vastly happy to oblige [you]90-mr. bingley , and will save all the best of the covies for [you]90-mr. bingley . "[261-her mother]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's misery increased , at such unnecessary , such officious attention ! Were the same fair prospect to arise at present , as had flattered [them]2665-them a year ago , every thing , [she]93-elizabeth was persuaded , would be hastening to the same vexatious conclusion . At that instant [she]93-elizabeth felt , that years of happiness could not make [Jane]94-jane or [herself]94-jane amends , for moments of such painful confusion .

" The first wish of [my]93-elizabeth heart , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth to [herself]93-elizabeth , " is never more to be in company with [either of [them]2665-them]5021-either of them . [[Their]2665-them society]5022-their society can afford no pleasure , that will atone for such wretchedness as this ! Let [me]93-elizabeth never see either one or [the other]3363-the other again ! "[93-elizabeth]

Yet the misery , for which years of happiness were to offer no compensation , received soon afterwards material relief , from observing how much the beauty of [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister re - kindled the admiration of [[her]93-elizabeth former lover]2667-her former lover . When first [he]2667-her former lover came in , [he]2667-her former lover had spoken to [her]93-elizabeth but little ; but every five minutes seemed to be giving [her]93-elizabeth more of [his]2667-her former lover attention . [He]2667-her former lover found [her]93-elizabeth as handsome as [she]93-elizabeth had been last year ; as good natured , and as unaffected , though not quite so chatty . [Jane]94-jane was anxious that no difference should be perceived in [her]94-jane at all , and was really persuaded that [she]94-jane talked as much as ever . But [her]94-jane mind was so busily engaged , that [she]94-jane did not always know when [she]94-jane was silent .

When [the gentlemen]311-the gentlemen rose to go away , [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet was mindful of [her]96-mrs. bennet intended civility , and [they]311-the gentlemen were invited and engaged to dine at [Longbourn]7-longbourn in a few days time .

" [You]2667-her former lover are quite a visit in [my]96-mrs. bennet debt , [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley , "[96-mrs. bennet] [she]96-mrs. bennet added , " for when [you]2667-her former lover went to [town]285-town last winter , [you]2667-her former lover promised to take a family dinner with [us]311-the gentlemen , as soon as [you]2667-her former lover returned . [I]96-mrs. bennet have not forgot , [you]2667-her former lover see ; and [I]96-mrs. bennet assure [you]2667-her former lover , [I]96-mrs. bennet was very much disappointed that [you]2667-her former lover did not come back and keep [your]2667-her former lover engagement . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Bingley]90-mr. bingley looked a little silly at this reflection , and said something of [his]90-mr. bingley concern , at having been prevented by business . [They]311-the gentlemen then went away .

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet had been strongly inclined to ask [them]311-the gentlemen to stay and dine [there]325-there , that day ; but , though [she]96-mrs. bennet always kept a very good table , [she]96-mrs. bennet did not think any thing less than two courses , could be good enough for [a man]3065-a man , on whom [she]96-mrs. bennet had such anxious designs , or satisfy the appetite and pride of one who had ten thousand a - year .

CHAPTER XII .
