As soon as [they]311-the gentlemen were gone , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth walked out to recover [her]93-elizabeth spirits ; or in other words , to dwell without interruption on those subjects that must deaden [them]311-the gentlemen more . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy 's behaviour astonished and vexed [her]93-elizabeth .

" Why , if [he]100-mr. darcy came only to be silent , grave , and indifferent , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , " did [he]100-mr. darcy come at all ? "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth could settle it in no way that gave [her]93-elizabeth pleasure .

" [He]100-mr. darcy could be still amiable , still pleasing , to [[my]2672-me uncle]3468-my uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt , when [he]100-mr. darcy was in [town]285-town ; and why not to [me]2672-me ? If [he]100-mr. darcy fears [me]2672-me , why come hither ? If [he]100-mr. darcy no longer cares for [me]2672-me , why silent ? Teazing , teazing , [man]5028-man ! [I]2672-me will think no more about [him]100-mr. darcy . "[2672-me]

[Her]93-elizabeth resolution was for a short time involuntarily kept by the approach of [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister , who joined [her]93-elizabeth with a cheerful look , which [shewed]2672-me [her]93-elizabeth better satisfied with [[their]2673-their visitors]2128-their visitors , than [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth .

" Now , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , " that this first meeting is over , [I]93-elizabeth feel perfectly easy . [I]93-elizabeth know [my]93-elizabeth own strength , and [I]93-elizabeth shall never be embarrassed again by [his]100-mr. darcy coming . [I]93-elizabeth am glad [he]100-mr. darcy dines [here]3019-here on Tuesday . It will then be publicly seen , that on both sides , [we]2673-their meet only as [common and indifferent acquaintance]5030-common and indifferent acquaintance . "[93-elizabeth]

" Yes , very indifferent indeed , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , laughingly . " Oh , [Jane]94-jane , take care . "[93-elizabeth]

" [[My]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [you]93-elizabeth can not think [me]93-elizabeth so weak , as to be in danger now . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth think [you]93-elizabeth are in very great danger of making [him]90-mr. bingley as much in love with [you]93-elizabeth as ever . "[93-elizabeth]

* * * * *

[They]2675-they did not see [the gentlemen]311-the gentlemen again till Tuesday ; and [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , in the meanwhile , was giving way to all the happy schemes , which the good humour , and common politeness of [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , in half an hour 's visit , had revived .

On Tuesday there was [a large party assembled at [Longbourn]7-longbourn]2677-a large party assembled at longbourn ; and [the two , who were most anxiously expected]2678-the two , who were most anxiously expected , to the credit of [their]2678-the two , who were most anxiously expected punctuality as [sportsmen]2679-sportsmen , were in very good time . When [they]2678-the two , who were most anxiously expected repaired to [the dining - room]709-the dining - room , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth eagerly watched to see whether [Bingley]90-mr. bingley would take the place , which , in all [their]2678-the two , who were most anxiously expected former parties , had belonged to [him]90-mr. bingley , by [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister . [[Her]93-elizabeth prudent mother]2682-her prudent mother , occupied by the same ideas , forbore to invite [him]90-mr. bingley to sit by [herself]2682-her prudent mother . On entering [the room]271-the room , [he]90-mr. bingley seemed to hesitate ; but [Jane]94-jane happened to look round , and happened to smile : it was decided . [He]90-mr. bingley placed [himself]90-mr. bingley by [her]94-jane .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , with a triumphant sensation , looked towards [[his]90-mr. bingley friend]307-his friend . [He]90-mr. bingley bore it with noble indifference , and [she]93-elizabeth would have imagined that [Bingley]90-mr. bingley had received [his]90-mr. bingley sanction to be happy , had [she]93-elizabeth not seen [his]90-mr. bingley eyes likewise turned towards [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy , with an expression of half - laughing alarm .

[His]90-mr. bingley behaviour to [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister was such , during dinner time , as [shewed]2686-shewed an admiration of [her]348-her sister , which , though more guarded than formerly , persuaded [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , that if left wholly to [himself]90-mr. bingley , [Jane]94-jane 's happiness , and [his]90-mr. bingley own , would be speedily secured . Though [she]93-elizabeth dared not depend upon the consequence , [she]93-elizabeth yet received pleasure from observing [his]90-mr. bingley behaviour . It gave [her]93-elizabeth all the animation that [her]93-elizabeth spirits could boast ; for [she]93-elizabeth was in no cheerful humour . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy was almost as far from [her]93-elizabeth , as the table could divide [them]2687-them . [He]100-mr. darcy was on one side of [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother . [She]93-elizabeth knew how little such a situation would give pleasure to either , or make either appear to advantage . [She]93-elizabeth was not near enough to hear any of [their]2687-them discourse , but [she]93-elizabeth could see how seldom [they]2687-them spoke to [each other]3157-each other , and how formal and cold was [their]2687-them manner , whenever [they]2687-them did . [[Her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother 's ungraciousness , made the sense of what [they]2687-them owed [him]100-mr. darcy more painful to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's mind ; and [she]93-elizabeth would , at times , have given any thing to be privileged to tell [him]100-mr. darcy , that [his]100-mr. darcy kindness was neither unknown nor unfelt by [the whole of [the family]432-the family]2691-the whole of the family .

[She]93-elizabeth was in hopes that the evening would afford some opportunity of bringing [them]2687-them together ; that the whole of the visit would not pass away without enabling [them]2687-them to enter into something more of conversation , than the mere ceremonious salutation attending [his]100-mr. darcy entrance . Anxious and uneasy , the period which passed in [the drawing - room]530-the drawing - room , before [the gentlemen]311-the gentlemen came , was wearisome and dull to a degree , that almost made [her]93-elizabeth uncivil . [She]93-elizabeth looked forward to [their]2687-them entrance , as the point on which all [her]93-elizabeth chance of pleasure for the evening must depend .

" If [he]100-mr. darcy does not come to [me]93-elizabeth , _ then _ , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , " [I]93-elizabeth shall give [him]100-mr. darcy up for ever . "[93-elizabeth]

[The gentlemen]311-the gentlemen came ; and [she]93-elizabeth thought [he]100-mr. darcy looked as if [he]100-mr. darcy would have answered [her]93-elizabeth hopes ; but , alas ! [the ladies]269-the ladies had crowded round the table , where [Miss Bennet]95-lydia was making tea , and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth pouring out the coffee , in so close a confederacy , that there was not a single vacancy near [her]93-elizabeth , which would admit of a chair . And on [the gentlemen]311-the gentlemen 's approaching , [one of [the girls]3033-the girls]2698-one of the girls moved closer to [her]93-elizabeth than ever , and said , in a whisper ,

" [The men]4352-the men sha n't come and part [us]5033-we , [I]2698-one of the girls am determined . [We]5033-we want none of [them]4352-the men ; do [we]5033-we ? "[2698-one of the girls]

[Darcy]100-mr. darcy had walked away to [another part of [the room]271-the room]2700-another part of the room . [She]93-elizabeth followed [him]100-mr. darcy with [her]93-elizabeth eyes , envied every one to whom [he]100-mr. darcy spoke , had scarcely patience enough to help [anybody]605-anybody to coffee ; and then was enraged against [herself]93-elizabeth for being so silly !

" [A man who has once been refused]5034-a man who has once been refused ! How could [I]93-elizabeth ever be foolish enough to expect a renewal of [his]100-mr. darcy love ? Is there [one among the sex , who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to [the same woman]5036-the same woman]5035-one among the sex , who would not protest against such a weakness as a second proposal to the same woman ? There is no indignity so abhorrent to [their]5037-their feelings ! "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth was a little revived , however , by [his]100-mr. darcy bringing back [his]100-mr. darcy coffee cup [himself]100-mr. darcy ; and [she]93-elizabeth seized the opportunity of saying ,

" Is [[your]100-mr. darcy sister]3152-your sister at [Pemberley]12-pemberley still ? "[93-elizabeth]

" Yes , [she]93-elizabeth will remain [there]325-there till Christmas . "[93-elizabeth]

" And quite alone ? Have [all [her]93-elizabeth friends]5040-all her friends left [her]93-elizabeth ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [Mrs. Annesley]215-mrs. annesley is with [her]93-elizabeth . [The others]517-the others have been gone on to [Scarborough]81-scarborough , these three weeks . "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth could think of nothing more to say ; but if [he]100-mr. darcy wished to converse with [her]93-elizabeth , [he]100-mr. darcy might have better success . [He]100-mr. darcy stood by [her]93-elizabeth , however , for some minutes , in silence ; and , at last , on [the young lady]1278-the young lady 's whispering to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth again , [he]100-mr. darcy walked away .

When the tea - things were removed , and the card tables placed , [the ladies]269-the ladies all rose , and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was then hoping to be soon joined by [him]100-mr. darcy , when all [her]93-elizabeth views were overthrown , by seeing [him]100-mr. darcy fall a victim to [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother 's rapacity for [whist players]2706-whist players , and in a few moments after seated with [the rest of the party]2707-the rest of the party . [She]93-elizabeth now lost every expectation of pleasure . [They]2708-they were confined for the evening at different tables , and [she]93-elizabeth had nothing to hope , but that [his]100-mr. darcy eyes were so often turned towards [her]93-elizabeth side of [the room]271-the room , as to make [him]100-mr. darcy play as unsuccessfully as [herself]93-elizabeth .

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet had designed to keep [the two Netherfield gentlemen]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen to supper ; but [[their]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen carriage]2209-their carriage was unluckily ordered before any of [the others]517-the others , and [she]96-mrs. bennet had no opportunity of detaining [them]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen .

" [Well girls]5042-well girls , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [she]96-mrs. bennet , as soon as [they]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen were left to [themselves]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen , " What say [you]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen to the day ? [I]96-mrs. bennet think every thing has passed off uncommonly well , [I]96-mrs. bennet assure [you]2710-the two netherfield gentlemen . The dinner was as well dressed as any [I]96-mrs. bennet ever saw . The venison was roasted to a turn -- and [everybody]5043-everybody said , [they]5043-everybody never saw so fat a haunch . The soup was fifty times better than what [we]5044-we had at [the [Lucas]103-miss lucas 's]5045-the lucas 's last week ; and even [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy acknowledged , that the partridges were remarkably well done ; and [I]96-mrs. bennet suppose [he]100-mr. darcy has [two or three French cooks]5046-two or three french cooks at least . And , [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear [Jane]94-jane , [I]96-mrs. bennet never saw [you]94-jane look in greater beauty . [Mrs. Long]87-mrs. long said so too , for [I]96-mrs. bennet asked [her]87-mrs. long whether [you]94-jane did not . And what do [you]94-jane think [she]87-mrs. long said besides ? ' Ah ! [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , [we]5044-we shall have [her]87-mrs. long at [Netherfield]2-netherfield at last . ' [She]87-mrs. long did indeed . [I]96-mrs. bennet do think [Mrs. Long]87-mrs. long is as good a creature as ever lived -- and [[her]87-mrs. long nieces]3068-her nieces are [very pretty behaved girls]5049-very pretty behaved girls , and not at all handsome : [I]96-mrs. bennet like [them]3068-her nieces prodigiously . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , in short , was in very great spirits ; [she]96-mrs. bennet had seen enough of [Bingley]90-mr. bingley 's behaviour to [Jane]94-jane , to be convinced that [she]96-mrs. bennet would get [him]90-mr. bingley at last ; and [her]96-mrs. bennet expectations of advantage to [[her]96-mrs. bennet family]905-her family , when in a happy humour , were so far beyond reason , that [she]96-mrs. bennet was quite disappointed at not seeing [him]90-mr. bingley [there]325-there again the next day , to make [his]90-mr. bingley proposals .

" It has been a very agreeable day , "[95-lydia] said [Miss Bennet]95-lydia to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " [The party]3034-the party seemed so well selected , so suitable one with [the other]3363-the other . [I]95-lydia hope [we]5052-we may often meet again . "[95-lydia]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth smiled .

" [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [you]93-elizabeth must not do so . [You]93-elizabeth must not suspect [me]96-mrs. bennet . It mortifies [me]96-mrs. bennet . [I]96-mrs. bennet assure [you]93-elizabeth that [I]96-mrs. bennet have now learnt to enjoy [his]90-mr. bingley conversation as [an agreeable and sensible young man]5053-an agreeable and sensible young man , without having a wish beyond it . [I]96-mrs. bennet am perfectly satisfied from what [his]90-mr. bingley manners now are , that [he]90-mr. bingley never had any design of engaging [my]96-mrs. bennet affection . It is only that [he]90-mr. bingley is blessed with greater sweetness of address , and a stronger desire of generally pleasing than [any other man]5054-any other man . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" [You]93-elizabeth are very cruel , "[348-her sister] said [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister , " [you]93-elizabeth will not let [me]348-her sister smile , and are provoking [me]348-her sister to it every moment . "[348-her sister]

" How hard it is in some cases to be believed ! "[96-mrs. bennet]

" And how impossible in others ! "[348-her sister]

" But why should [you]93-elizabeth wish to persuade [me]96-mrs. bennet that [I]96-mrs. bennet feel more than [I]96-mrs. bennet acknowledge ? "[96-mrs. bennet]

" That is a question which [I]348-her sister hardly know how to answer . [We]5055-we all love to instruct , though [we]5055-we can teach only what is not worth knowing . Forgive [me]348-her sister ; and if [you]93-elizabeth persist in indifference , do not make _ [me]348-her sister _ [[your]93-elizabeth confidante]5056-your confidante . "[348-her sister]

[CHAPTER XIII]146-chapter xiii .

A few days after this visit , [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley called again , and alone . [[His]90-mr. bingley friend]307-his friend had left [him]90-mr. bingley that morning for [London]5-london , but was to return [home]3223-home in ten days time . [He]90-mr. bingley sat with [them]2718-them above an hour , and was in remarkably good spirits . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet invited [him]90-mr. bingley to dine with [them]2718-them ; but , with many expressions of concern , [he]90-mr. bingley confessed [himself]90-mr. bingley engaged elsewhere .

" Next time [you]90-mr. bingley call , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [she]96-mrs. bennet , " [I]96-mrs. bennet hope [we]2718-them shall be more lucky . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[He]90-mr. bingley should be particularly happy at any time , & c. & c. ; and if [she]96-mrs. bennet would give [him]90-mr. bingley leave , would take an early opportunity of waiting on [them]2718-them .

" Can [you]90-mr. bingley come to - morrow ? "[96-mrs. bennet]

Yes , [he]90-mr. bingley had no engagement at all for to - morrow ; and [her]96-mrs. bennet invitation was accepted with alacrity .

[He]90-mr. bingley came , and in such very good time , that [the ladies]269-the ladies were [none of [them]269-the ladies]2720-none of them dressed . In ran [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet to [[[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter 's room]2722-her daughter 's room , in [her]96-mrs. bennet dressing gown , and with [her]96-mrs. bennet hair half finished , crying out ,

" [[My]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear [Jane]94-jane , make haste and hurry down . [He]90-mr. bingley is come -- [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley is come.--He is , indeed . Make haste , make haste . Here , [Sarah]224-sally , come to [Miss Bennet]95-lydia this moment , and help [her]95-lydia on with [her]95-lydia gown . Never mind [Miss Lizzy]93-elizabeth 's hair . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" [We]5058-we will be down as soon as [we]5058-we can , "[94-jane] said [Jane]94-jane ; " but [I]94-jane dare say [Kitty]97-lady catherine is forwarder than either of [us]5058-we , for [she]97-lady catherine went up stairs half an hour ago . "[94-jane]

" Oh ! hang [Kitty]97-lady catherine ! what has [she]97-lady catherine to do with it ? Come be quick , be quick ! where is [your]94-jane sash [[my]261-her mother dear]3018-my dear ? "[261-her mother]

But when [[her]94-jane mother]261-her mother was gone , [Jane]94-jane would not be prevailed on to go down without [one of [[her]94-jane sisters]3048-her sisters]2724-one of her sisters .

The same anxiety to get [them]3048-her sisters by [themselves]3048-her sisters , was visible again in the evening . After tea , [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet retired to [the library]1030-the library , as was [his]86-mr. bennet custom , and [Mary]98-mary went up [stairs]529-stairs to [her]98-mary instrument . Two obstacles of the five being thus removed , [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet sat looking and winking at [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth and [Catherine]97-lady catherine for a considerable time , without making any impression on [them]3048-her sisters . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth would not observe [her]94-jane ; and when at last [Kitty]97-lady catherine did , [she]97-lady catherine very innocently said , " What is the matter [mamma]4821-mamma ? What do [you]4821-mamma keep winking at [me]97-lady catherine for ? What am [I]97-lady catherine to do ? "[97-lady catherine]

" [Nothing child]5061-nothing child , nothing . [I]97-lady catherine did not wink at [you]4821-mamma . "[97-lady catherine] [She]94-jane then sat still five minutes longer ; but unable to waste such a precious occasion , [she]94-jane suddenly got up , and saying to [Kitty]97-lady catherine ,

" Come here , [[my]94-jane love]3076-my love , [I]94-jane want to speak to [you]97-lady catherine , "[94-jane] took [her]97-lady catherine out of [the room]271-the room . [Jane]94-jane instantly gave a look at [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , which spoke [her]94-jane distress at such premeditation , and [her]94-jane intreaty that _ [she]94-jane _ would not give into it . In a few minutes , [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet half opened the door and called out ,

" [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear]3018-my dear , [I]96-mrs. bennet want to speak with [you]93-elizabeth . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was forced to go .

" [We]5064-we may as well leave [them]5065-them by [themselves]5065-them [you]93-elizabeth know ; "[261-her mother] said [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother as soon as [she]261-her mother was in [the hall]708-the hall . " [Kitty]97-lady catherine and [I]261-her mother are going [upstairs]5066-upstairs to sit in [[my]261-her mother dressing - room]5067-my dressing - room . "[261-her mother]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth made no attempt to reason with [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , but remained quietly in [the hall]708-the hall , till [she]93-elizabeth and [Kitty]97-lady catherine were out of sight , then returned into [the drawing - room]530-the drawing - room .

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet 's schemes for this day were ineffectual . [Bingley]90-mr. bingley was every thing that was charming , except [the professed lover of [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter]2734-the professed lover of her daughter . [His]90-mr. bingley ease and cheerfulness rendered [him]90-mr. bingley a most agreeable addition to [their]2736-their evening party ; and [he]90-mr. bingley bore with the ill - judged officiousness of [the mother]412-the mother , and heard all [her]412-the mother silly remarks with a forbearance and command of countenance , particularly grateful to [the daughter]1396-the daughter .

[He]90-mr. bingley scarcely needed an invitation to stay supper ; and before [he]90-mr. bingley went away , an engagement was formed , chiefly through [his]90-mr. bingley own and [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet 's means , for [his]90-mr. bingley coming next morning to shoot with [[her]96-mrs. bennet husband]276-her husband .

After this day , [Jane]94-jane said no more of [her]94-jane indifference . Not a word passed between [the sisters]504-the sisters concerning [Bingley]90-mr. bingley ; but [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth went to bed in the happy belief that all must speedily be concluded , unless [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy returned within the stated time . Seriously , however , [she]93-elizabeth felt tolerably persuaded that all this must have taken place with [that gentleman]3311-that gentleman 's concurrence .

[Bingley]90-mr. bingley was punctual to [his]90-mr. bingley appointment ; and [he]90-mr. bingley and [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet spent the morning together , as had been agreed on . [The latter]499-the latter was much more agreeable than [[his]90-mr. bingley companion]437-his companion expected . There was nothing of presumption or folly in [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , that could provoke [his]90-mr. bingley ridicule , or disgust [him]90-mr. bingley into silence ; and [he]90-mr. bingley was more communicative , and less eccentric than the other had ever seen [him]90-mr. bingley . [Bingley]90-mr. bingley of course returned with [him]90-mr. bingley to dinner ; and in the evening [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet 's invention was again at work to get every body away from [him]86-mr. bennet and [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , who had a letter to write , went into [the breakfast room]2398-the breakfast room for that purpose soon after tea ; for as [the others]517-the others were all going to sit down to cards , [she]93-elizabeth could not be wanted to counteract [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother 's schemes .

But on returning to [the drawing - room]530-the drawing - room , when [her]93-elizabeth letter was finished , [she]93-elizabeth saw , to [her]93-elizabeth infinite surprise , there was reason to fear that [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother had been too ingenious for [her]93-elizabeth . On opening the door , [she]93-elizabeth perceived [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister and [Bingley]90-mr. bingley standing together over the hearth , as if engaged in earnest conversation ; and had this led to no suspicion , the faces of both as [they]2751-they hastily turned round , and moved away from [each other]3157-each other , would have told it all . _ [Their]2751-they _ situation was awkward enough ; but _ [her]2753-her 's _ [she]93-elizabeth thought was still worse . Not a syllable was uttered by either ; and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was on the point of going away again , when [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , who as well as [the other]3363-the other had sat down , suddenly rose , and whispering a few words to [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister , ran out of [the room]271-the room .

[Jane]94-jane could have no reserves from [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , where confidence would give pleasure ; and instantly embracing [her]93-elizabeth , acknowledged , with the liveliest emotion , that [she]93-elizabeth was [the happiest creature in [the world]323-the world]2757-the happiest creature in the world .

" ' Tis too much ! "[94-jane] [she]94-jane added , " by far too much . [I]94-jane do not deserve it . Oh ! why is not every body as happy ? "[94-jane]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's congratulations were given with a sincerity , a warmth , a delight , which words could but poorly express . Every sentence of kindness was a fresh source of happiness to [Jane]94-jane . But [she]93-elizabeth would not allow [herself]93-elizabeth to stay with [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister , or say half that remained to be said , for the present .

" [I]93-elizabeth must go instantly to [[my]93-elizabeth mother]3230-my mother ; "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth cried . " [I]93-elizabeth would not on any account trifle with [her]3230-my mother affectionate solicitude ; or allow [her]3230-my mother to hear it from [any one]3122-any one but [myself]93-elizabeth . [He]5070-he is gone to [[my]93-elizabeth father]3259-my father already . Oh ! [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , to know that what [I]93-elizabeth have to relate will give such pleasure to all [[my]93-elizabeth dear family]5072-my dear family ! how shall [I]93-elizabeth bear so much happiness ! "[93-elizabeth]

[She]93-elizabeth then hastened away to [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , who had purposely broken up the card party , and was sitting up stairs with [Kitty]97-lady catherine .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , who was left by [herself]93-elizabeth , now smiled at the rapidity and ease with which an affair was finally settled , that had given [them]2761-them so many previous months of suspense and vexation .

" And this , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , " is the end of all [[his]90-mr. bingley friend]307-his friend 's anxious circumspection ! of all [[his]90-mr. bingley sister]569-his sister 's falsehood and contrivance ! the happiest , wisest , most reasonable end ! "[93-elizabeth]

In a few minutes [she]93-elizabeth was joined by [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , whose conference with [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father had been short and to the purpose .

" Where is [[your]93-elizabeth sister]3152-your sister ? "[90-mr. bingley] said [he]90-mr. bingley hastily , as [he]90-mr. bingley opened the door .

" With [[my]93-elizabeth mother]3230-my mother up [stairs]529-stairs . [She]3152-your sister will be down in a moment [I]93-elizabeth dare say . "[93-elizabeth]

[He]90-mr. bingley then shut the door , and coming up to [her]93-elizabeth , claimed the good wishes and affection of [a sister]449-a sister . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth honestly and heartily expressed [her]93-elizabeth delight in the prospect of [their]2764-their relationship . [They]2764-their shook hands with great cordiality ; and then till [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister came down , [she]93-elizabeth had to listen to all [he]90-mr. bingley had to say , of [his]90-mr. bingley own happiness , and of [Jane]94-jane 's perfections ; and in spite of [his]90-mr. bingley being [a lover]2766-a lover , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth really believed all [his]90-mr. bingley expectations of felicity , to be rationally founded , because [they]2764-their had for basis the excellent understanding , and super - excellent disposition of [Jane]94-jane , and a general similarity of feeling and taste between [her]94-jane and [himself]90-mr. bingley .

It was an evening of no common delight to [them]2764-their all ; the satisfaction of [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth 's mind gave a glow of such sweet animation to [her]93-elizabeth face , as made [her]93-elizabeth look handsomer than ever . [Kitty]97-lady catherine simpered and smiled , and hoped [her]97-lady catherine turn was coming soon . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet could not give [her]93-elizabeth consent , or speak [her]93-elizabeth approbation in terms warm enough to satisfy [her]93-elizabeth feelings , though [she]93-elizabeth talked to [Bingley]90-mr. bingley of nothing else , for half an hour ; and when [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet joined [them]2764-their at supper , [his]86-mr. bennet voice and manner plainly shewed how really happy [he]86-mr. bennet was .

Not a word , however , passed [his]86-mr. bennet lips in allusion to it , till [[their]2764-their visitor]1581-their visitor took [his]86-mr. bennet leave for the night ; but as soon as [he]86-mr. bennet was gone , [he]86-mr. bennet turned to [[his]86-mr. bennet daughter]1127-his daughter and said ,

" [Jane]94-jane , [I]86-mr. bennet congratulate [you]94-jane . [You]94-jane will be [a very happy woman]5078-a very happy woman . "[86-mr. bennet]

[Jane]94-jane went to [him]86-mr. bennet instantly , kissed [him]86-mr. bennet , and thanked [him]86-mr. bennet for [his]86-mr. bennet goodness .

" [You]94-jane are [a good girl]4726-a good girl ; "[86-mr. bennet] [he]86-mr. bennet replied , " and [I]86-mr. bennet have great pleasure in thinking [you]94-jane will be so happily settled . [I]86-mr. bennet have not a doubt of [your]94-jane doing very well together . [Your]94-jane tempers are by no means unlike . [You]94-jane are each of [you]94-jane so complying , that nothing will ever be resolved on ; so easy , that [every servant]5080-every servant will cheat [you]94-jane ; and so generous , that [you]94-jane will always exceed [your]94-jane income . "[86-mr. bennet]

" [I]86-mr. bennet hope not so . Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters , would be unpardonable in _ [me]86-mr. bennet _ . "[86-mr. bennet]

" Exceed [their]5081-their income ! [[My]251-his wife dear]3018-my dear [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet , "[251-his wife] cried [[his]86-mr. bennet wife]251-his wife , " what are [you]86-mr. bennet talking of ? Why , [he]86-mr. bennet has four or five thousand a - year , and very likely more . "[251-his wife] Then addressing [[her]251-his wife daughter]475-her daughter , " Oh ! [[my]475-her daughter dear]3018-my dear , [dear Jane]94-jane , [I]475-her daughter am so happy ! [I]475-her daughter am sure [I]475-her daughter sha'nt get a wink of sleep all night . [I]475-her daughter knew how it would be . [I]475-her daughter always said it must be so , at last . [I]475-her daughter was sure [you]94-jane could not be so beautiful for nothing ! [I]475-her daughter remember , as soon as ever [I]475-her daughter saw [him]86-mr. bennet , when [he]86-mr. bennet first came into [Hertfordshire]4-hertfordshire last year , [I]475-her daughter thought how likely it was that [you]94-jane should come together . Oh ! [he]86-mr. bennet is [the handsomest young man that ever was seen]5084-the handsomest young man that ever was seen ! "[475-her daughter]

[Wickham]165-george wickham , [Lydia]95-lydia , were all forgotten . [Jane]94-jane was beyond competition [[her]94-jane favourite child]2771-her favourite child . At that moment , [she]94-jane cared for [no other]2277-no other . [[Her]94-jane younger sisters]433-her younger sisters soon began to make interest with [her]94-jane for objects of happiness which [she]94-jane might in future be able to dispense .

[Mary]98-mary petitioned for the use of [the library at [Netherfield]2-netherfield]2774-the library at netherfield ; and [Kitty]97-lady catherine begged very hard for a few balls [there]325-there every winter .

[Bingley]90-mr. bingley , from this time , was of course [a daily visitor at [Longbourn]7-longbourn]2776-a daily visitor at longbourn ; coming frequently before breakfast , and always remaining till after supper ; unless when [some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested]2777-some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested , had given [him]90-mr. bingley an invitation to dinner , which [he]90-mr. bingley thought [himself]90-mr. bingley obliged to accept .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had now but little time for conversation with [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister ; for while [he]90-mr. bingley was present , [Jane]94-jane had no attention to bestow on [any one else]3348-any one else ; but [she]94-jane found [herself]94-jane considerably useful to both of [them]2780-them , in those hours of separation that must sometimes occur . In the absence of [Jane]94-jane , [he]90-mr. bingley always attached [himself]90-mr. bingley to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , for the pleasure of talking of [her]93-elizabeth ; and when [Bingley]90-mr. bingley was gone , [Jane]94-jane constantly sought the same means of relief .

" [He]90-mr. bingley has made [me]94-jane so happy , "[94-jane] said [she]94-jane , one evening , " by telling [me]94-jane , that [he]90-mr. bingley was totally ignorant of [my]94-jane being in [town]285-town last spring ! [I]94-jane had not believed it possible . "[94-jane]

" [I]93-elizabeth suspected as much , "[93-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " But how did [he]90-mr. bingley account for it ? "[93-elizabeth]

" It must have been [[his]90-mr. bingley sister]569-his sister 's doing . [They]5087-they were certainly no friends to [his]90-mr. bingley acquaintance with [me]94-jane , which [I]94-jane can not wonder at , since [he]90-mr. bingley might have chosen so much more advantageously in many respects . But when [they]5087-they see , as [I]94-jane trust [they]5087-they will , that [[their]5087-they brother]359-their brother is happy with [me]94-jane , [they]5087-they will learn to be contented , and [we]5089-we shall be on good terms again ; though [we]5089-we can never be what [we]5089-we once were to [each other]3157-each other . "[94-jane]

" That is the most unforgiving speech , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " that [I]93-elizabeth ever heard [you]94-jane utter . [Good girl]5091-good girl ! It would vex [me]93-elizabeth , indeed , to see [you]94-jane again the dupe of [Miss Bingley]102-miss bingley 's pretended regard . "[93-elizabeth]

" Would [you]94-jane believe it , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , that when [he]2781-he went to [town]285-town last November , [he]2781-he really loved [me]94-jane , and nothing but a persuasion of _ [my]94-jane _ being indifferent , would have prevented [his]2781-he coming down again ! "[94-jane]

" [He]2781-he made a little mistake to be sure ; but it is to the credit of [his]2781-he modesty . "[93-elizabeth]

This naturally introduced a panegyric from [Jane]94-jane on [his]2781-he diffidence , and the little value [he]2781-he put on [his]2781-he own good qualities .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was pleased to find , that [he]2781-he had not betrayed the interference of [[his]2781-he friend]307-his friend , for , though [Jane]94-jane had the most generous and forgiving heart in [the world]323-the world , [she]94-jane knew it was a circumstance which must prejudice [her]94-jane against [him]2781-he .

" [I]94-jane am certainly [the most fortunate creature that ever existed]5093-the most fortunate creature that ever existed ! "[94-jane] cried [Jane]94-jane . " Oh ! [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , why am [I]94-jane thus singled from [[my]94-jane family]3708-my family , and blessed above [them]3708-my family all ! If [I]94-jane could but see _ [you]93-elizabeth _ as happy ! If there _ were _ but [such another man for [you]93-elizabeth]5095-such another man for you ! "[94-jane]

" If [you]93-elizabeth were to give [me]96-mrs. bennet [forty such men]5096-forty such men , [I]96-mrs. bennet never could be so happy as [you]93-elizabeth . Till [I]96-mrs. bennet have [your]93-elizabeth disposition , [your]93-elizabeth goodness , [I]96-mrs. bennet never can have [your]93-elizabeth happiness . No , no , let [me]96-mrs. bennet shift for [myself]96-mrs. bennet ; and , perhaps , if [I]96-mrs. bennet have very good luck , [I]96-mrs. bennet may meet with another [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins in time . "[96-mrs. bennet]

The situation of affairs in [the Longbourn family]748-the longbourn family could not be long a secret . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet was privileged to whisper it to [Mrs. Philips]127-mrs. philips , and _ [she]96-mrs. bennet _ ventured , without any permission , to do the same by [all [[her]96-mrs. bennet neighbours]844-her neighbours in [Meryton]9-meryton]2785-all her neighbours in meryton .

[The Bennets]111-the bennets were speedily pronounced to be [the luckiest family in [the world]323-the world]2787-the luckiest family in the world , though only a few weeks before , when [Lydia]95-lydia had first run away , [they]2787-the luckiest family in the world had been generally proved to be marked out for misfortune .

CHAPTER XIV .

One morning , about a week after [Bingley]102-miss bingley 's engagement with [Jane]94-jane had been formed , as [he]2789-he and [the females of [the family]432-the family]2790-the females of the family were sitting together in [the dining - room]709-the dining - room , [their]2787-the luckiest family in the world attention was suddenly drawn to the window , by the sound of [a carriage]3138-a carriage ; and [they]2787-the luckiest family in the world perceived a chaise and four driving up [the lawn]1967-the lawn . It was too early in the morning for [visitors]1147-visitors , and besides , the equipage did not answer to that of [any of [[their]2787-the luckiest family in the world neighbours]2797-their neighbours]2796-any of their neighbours . The horses were post ; and neither [the carriage]3221-the carriage , nor the livery of [the servant who preceded it]2799-the servant who preceded it , were familiar to [them]2787-the luckiest family in the world . As it was certain , however , that [somebody]3579-somebody was coming , [Bingley]102-miss bingley instantly prevailed on [Miss Bennet]95-lydia to avoid the confinement of such an intrusion , and walk away with [him]2789-he into [the shrubbery]2801-the shrubbery . [They]2787-the luckiest family in the world both set off , and the conjectures of [the remaining three]2802-the remaining three continued , though with little satisfaction , till the door was thrown open , and [[their]2787-the luckiest family in the world visitor]1581-their visitor entered . It was [lady Catherine de Bourgh]97-lady catherine .

[They]2787-the luckiest family in the world were of course all intending to be surprised ; but [their]2787-the luckiest family in the world astonishment was beyond [their]2787-the luckiest family in the world expectation ; and on the part of [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet and [Kitty]97-lady catherine , though [she]97-lady catherine was perfectly unknown to [them]2787-the luckiest family in the world , even inferior to what [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth felt .

[She]97-lady catherine entered [the room]271-the room with an air more than usually ungracious , made no other reply to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's salutation , than a slight inclination of the head , and sat down without saying a word . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had mentioned [her]93-elizabeth name to [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , on [[her]93-elizabeth ladyship]677-her ladyship 's entrance , though no request of introduction had been made .

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet all amazement , though flattered by having [a guest of such high importance]2807-a guest of such high importance , received [her]96-mrs. bennet with the utmost politeness . After sitting for a moment in silence , [she]96-mrs. bennet said very stiffly to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ,

" [I]96-mrs. bennet hope [you]93-elizabeth are well , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth . That lady [I]96-mrs. bennet suppose is [[your]93-elizabeth mother]3695-your mother . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth replied very concisely that [she]96-mrs. bennet was .

" And _ that _ [I]96-mrs. bennet suppose is [one of [[your]96-mrs. bennet sisters]3082-your sisters]4724-one of your sisters . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" Yes , [madam]3285-madam , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , delighted to speak to [a lady [Catherine]97-lady catherine]2808-a lady catherine . " [She]97-lady catherine is [[my]96-mrs. bennet youngest girl]5101-my youngest girl but one . [[My]96-mrs. bennet youngest of all]5102-my youngest of all , is lately married , and [[my]96-mrs. bennet eldest]5103-my eldest is somewhere about [the grounds]4433-the grounds , walking with [a young man , who [I]96-mrs. bennet believe will soon become a part of [the family]432-the family]5105-a young man , who i believe will soon become a part of the family . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" [You]97-lady catherine have [a very small park]5107-a very small park here , "[97-lady catherine] returned [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine after a short silence .

" It is nothing in comparison of Rosings , [[my]96-mrs. bennet lady]5108-my lady , [I]96-mrs. bennet dare say ; but [I]96-mrs. bennet assure [you]97-lady catherine [it]5107-a very small park is much larger than [Sir William Lucas]91-sir william 's . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" This must be a most inconvenient sitting room for the evening , in summer ; the windows are full west . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet assured [her]97-lady catherine that [they]2809-they never sat [there]325-there after dinner ; and then added ,

" May [I]96-mrs. bennet take the liberty of asking [[your]97-lady catherine ladyship]4054-your ladyship whether [you]97-lady catherine left [Mr.]5110-mr. and [Mrs. Collins]186-mrs. collins well . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" Yes , very well . [I]96-mrs. bennet saw [them]2809-they the night before last . "[96-mrs. bennet]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth now expected that [she]93-elizabeth would produce a letter for [her]97-lady catherine from [Charlotte]114-charlotte , as it seemed the only probable motive for [her]97-lady catherine calling . But no letter appeared , and [she]93-elizabeth was completely puzzled .

[Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , with great civility , begged [[her]96-mrs. bennet ladyship]677-her ladyship to take some refreshment ; but [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine very resolutely , and not very politely , declined eating any thing ; and then rising up , said to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ,

" [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , there seemed to be a prettyish kind of a little wilderness on one side of [[your]93-elizabeth lawn]5111-your lawn . [I]97-lady catherine should be glad to take a turn in it , if [you]93-elizabeth will favour [me]97-lady catherine with [your]93-elizabeth company . "[97-lady catherine]

" Go , [[my]261-her mother dear]3018-my dear , "[261-her mother] cried [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother , " and [shew]97-lady catherine [[her]97-lady catherine ladyship]677-her ladyship about the different walks . [I]261-her mother think [she]97-lady catherine will be pleased with [the hermitage]5114-the hermitage . "[261-her mother]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth obeyed , and running into [[her]93-elizabeth own room]1580-her own room for [her]93-elizabeth parasol , attended [[her]93-elizabeth noble guest]2814-her noble guest down stairs . As [they]2815-they passed through [the hall]708-the hall , [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine opened the doors into [the dining - parlour]528-the dining - parlour and [drawing - room]2818-drawing - room , and pronouncing [them]2819-them , after a short survey , to be [decent looking rooms]2820-decent looking rooms , walked on .

[[Her]97-lady catherine carriage]2821-her carriage remained at the door , and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth saw that [[her]97-lady catherine waiting - woman]2822-her waiting - woman was in [it]2821-her carriage . [They]2815-they proceeded in silence along the gravel walk that led to [the copse]2823-the copse ; [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was determined to make no effort for conversation with [a woman]3036-a woman , who was now more than usually insolent and disagreeable .

" How could [I]93-elizabeth ever think [her]3036-a woman like [[her]3036-a woman nephew]3571-her nephew ? "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , as [she]93-elizabeth looked in [her]93-elizabeth face .

As soon as [they]2815-they entered [the copse]2823-the copse , [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine began in the following manner:--

" [You]93-elizabeth can be at no loss , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , to understand the reason of [my]97-lady catherine journey hither . [Your]93-elizabeth own heart , [your]93-elizabeth own conscience , must tell [you]93-elizabeth why [I]97-lady catherine come . "[97-lady catherine]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth looked with unaffected astonishment .

" Indeed , [you]97-lady catherine are mistaken , [Madam]3285-madam . [I]97-lady catherine have not been at all able to account for the honour of seeing [you]93-elizabeth here . "[97-lady catherine]

" [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , "[677-her ladyship] replied [[her]97-lady catherine ladyship]677-her ladyship , in an angry tone , " [you]93-elizabeth ought to know , that [I]677-her ladyship am not to be trifled with . But however insincere _ [you]93-elizabeth _ may choose to be , [you]93-elizabeth shall not find _ [me]677-her ladyship _ so . [My]677-her ladyship character has ever been celebrated for its sincerity and frankness , and in a cause of such moment as this , [I]677-her ladyship shall certainly not depart from it . A report of a most alarming nature , reached [me]677-her ladyship two days ago . [I]677-her ladyship was told , that not only [[your]93-elizabeth sister]3152-your sister was on the point of being most advantageously married , but that _ [you]93-elizabeth _ , that [Miss Elizabeth Bennet]93-elizabeth , would , in all likelihood , be soon afterwards united to [[my]677-her ladyship nephew]5118-my nephew , [[my]677-her ladyship own nephew]5119-my own nephew , [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy . Though [I]677-her ladyship _ know _ it must be a scandalous falsehood ; though [I]677-her ladyship would not injure [him]5118-my nephew so much as to suppose the truth of it possible , [I]677-her ladyship instantly resolved on setting off for [this place]4437-this place , that [I]677-her ladyship might make [my]677-her ladyship sentiments known to [you]93-elizabeth . "[677-her ladyship]

" If [you]93-elizabeth believed it impossible to be true , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , colouring with astonishment and disdain , " [I]93-elizabeth wonder [you]93-elizabeth took the trouble of coming so far . What could [[your]93-elizabeth ladyship]4054-your ladyship propose by it ? "[93-elizabeth]

" At once to insist upon having such a report universally contradicted . "[97-lady catherine]

" [Your]93-elizabeth coming to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , to see [me]93-elizabeth and [[my]93-elizabeth family]3708-my family , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , coolly , " will be rather a confirmation of it ; if , indeed , such a report is in existence . "[93-elizabeth]

" If ! do [you]93-elizabeth then pretend to be ignorant of it ? Has it not been industriously circulated by [yourselves]93-elizabeth ? Do [you]93-elizabeth not know that such a report is spread abroad ? "[677-her ladyship]

" [I]93-elizabeth never heard that it was . "[93-elizabeth]

" And can [you]93-elizabeth likewise declare , that there is no _ foundation _ for it ? "[677-her ladyship]

" [I]93-elizabeth do not pretend to possess equal frankness with [[your]93-elizabeth ladyship]4054-your ladyship . _ [You]93-elizabeth _ may ask questions , which _ [I]93-elizabeth _ shall not choose to answer . "[93-elizabeth]

" This is not to be borne . [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , [I]677-her ladyship insist on being satisfied . Has [he]5124-he , has [[my]677-her ladyship nephew]5118-my nephew , made [you]93-elizabeth an offer of marriage ? "[677-her ladyship]

" [[Your]93-elizabeth ladyship]4054-your ladyship has declared it to be impossible . "[93-elizabeth]

" It ought to be so ; it must be so , while [he]5124-he retains the use of [his]5124-he reason . But _ [your]93-elizabeth _ arts and allurements may , in a moment of infatuation , have made [him]5124-he forget what [he]5124-he owes to [himself]5124-he and to all [[his]5124-he family]394-his family . [You]93-elizabeth may have drawn [him]5124-he in . "[677-her ladyship]

" If [I]93-elizabeth have , [I]93-elizabeth shall be [the last person to confess it]5128-the last person to confess it . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , do [you]93-elizabeth know who [I]677-her ladyship am ? [I]677-her ladyship have not been accustomed to such language as this . [I]677-her ladyship am almost [the nearest relation [he]5124-he has in [the world]323-the world]5129-the nearest relation he has in the world , and am entitled to know all [his]5124-he dearest concerns . "[677-her ladyship]

" But [you]93-elizabeth are not entitled to know _ mine _ ; nor will such behaviour as this , ever induce [me]93-elizabeth to be explicit . "[93-elizabeth]

" Let [me]677-her ladyship be rightly understood . This match , to which [you]93-elizabeth have the presumption to aspire , can never take place . No , never . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy is engaged to _ [[my]677-her ladyship daughter]4385-my daughter _ . Now what have [you]93-elizabeth to say ? "[677-her ladyship]

" Only this ; that if [he]100-mr. darcy is so , [you]93-elizabeth can have no reason to suppose [he]100-mr. darcy will make an offer to [me]93-elizabeth . "[93-elizabeth]

[Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine hesitated for a moment , and then replied ,

" The engagement between [them]5132-their is of a peculiar kind . From [their]5132-their infancy , [they]5132-their have been intended for [each other]3157-each other . It was the favourite wish of _ [[his]100-mr. darcy _ mother]5134-his _ mother , as well as of [her]5134-his _ mother 's . While in [[their]5132-their cradles]5135-their cradles , [we]5136-we planned the union : and now , at the moment when the wishes of [both sisters]2639-both sisters would be accomplished , in [their]5132-their marriage , to be prevented by [a young woman of inferior birth]5138-a young woman of inferior birth , of no importance in [the world]323-the world , and wholly unallied to [the family]432-the family ! Do [you]93-elizabeth pay no regard to the wishes of [[his]100-mr. darcy friends]423-his friends ? To [his]100-mr. darcy tacit engagement with [Miss De Bourgh]152-miss de bourgh ? Are [you]93-elizabeth lost to every feeling of propriety and delicacy ? Have [you]93-elizabeth not heard [me]677-her ladyship say , that from [his]100-mr. darcy earliest hours [he]100-mr. darcy was destined for [[his]100-mr. darcy cousin]727-his cousin ? "[677-her ladyship]

" Yes , and [I]677-her ladyship had heard it before . But what is that to [me]677-her ladyship ? If there is no other objection to [my]677-her ladyship marrying [[your]93-elizabeth nephew]5143-your nephew , [I]677-her ladyship shall certainly not be kept from it , by knowing that [[his]100-mr. darcy mother]5144-his mother and [aunt]3947-aunt wished [him]100-mr. darcy to marry [Miss De Bourgh]152-miss de bourgh . [You]93-elizabeth both did as much as [you]93-elizabeth could , in planning the marriage . Its completion depended on [others]3123-others . If [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy is neither by honour nor inclination confined to [[his]100-mr. darcy cousin]727-his cousin , why is not [he]100-mr. darcy to make another choice ? And if [I]677-her ladyship am that choice , why may not [I]677-her ladyship accept [him]100-mr. darcy ? "[677-her ladyship]

" Because honour , decorum , prudence , nay , interest , forbid it . Yes , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , interest ; for do not expect to be noticed by [[his]100-mr. darcy family]394-his family or [friends]3767-friends , if [you]93-elizabeth wilfully act against the inclinations of all . [You]93-elizabeth will be censured , slighted , and despised , by [every one connected with [him]100-mr. darcy]3572-every one connected with him . [Your]93-elizabeth alliance will be a disgrace ; [your]93-elizabeth name will never even be mentioned by any of [us]5151-us . "[677-her ladyship]

" These are heavy misfortunes , "[93-elizabeth] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " But [the wife of [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy]5152-the wife of mr. darcy must have such extraordinary sources of happiness necessarily attached to [her]5152-the wife of mr. darcy situation , that [she]5152-the wife of mr. darcy could , upon the whole , have no cause to repine . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Obstinate , headstrong girl]5153-obstinate , headstrong girl ! [I]677-her ladyship am ashamed of [you]93-elizabeth ! Is this [your]93-elizabeth gratitude for [my]677-her ladyship attentions to [you]93-elizabeth last spring ? Is nothing due to [me]677-her ladyship on that score ? "[677-her ladyship]

" Let [us]5151-us sit down . [You]93-elizabeth are to understand , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , that [I]93-elizabeth came here with the determined resolution of carrying [my]93-elizabeth purpose ; nor will [I]93-elizabeth be dissuaded from it . [I]93-elizabeth have not been used to submit to [any person]4652-any person 's whims . [I]93-elizabeth have not been in the habit of brooking disappointment . "[93-elizabeth]

" _ That _ will make [[your]93-elizabeth ladyship]4054-your ladyship 's situation at present more pitiable ; but it will have no effect on _ [me]677-her ladyship _ . "[677-her ladyship]

" [I]93-elizabeth will not be interrupted . Hear [me]93-elizabeth in silence . [[My]93-elizabeth daughter]4385-my daughter and [[my]93-elizabeth nephew]5118-my nephew are formed for [each other]3157-each other . [They]3157-each other are descended on the maternal side , from [the same noble line]5159-the same noble line ; and , on [the father]282-the father 's , from respectable , honourable , and ancient , though [untitled families]5161-untitled families . [Their]3157-each other fortune on both sides is splendid . [They]3157-each other are destined for each other by the voice of [every member of [[their]3157-each other respective houses]5163-their respective houses]5162-every member of their respective houses ; and what is to divide [them]3157-each other ? The upstart pretensions of [a young woman without family , connections , or fortune]5164-a young woman without family , connections , or fortune . Is this to be endured ! But it must not , shall not be . If [you]5165-you were sensible of [your]5165-you own good , [you]5165-you would not wish to quit the sphere , in which [you]5165-you have been brought up . "[93-elizabeth]

" In marrying [[your]93-elizabeth nephew]5143-your nephew , [I]677-her ladyship should not consider [myself]677-her ladyship as quitting that sphere . [He]282-the father is [a gentleman]3404-a gentleman ; [I]677-her ladyship am [[a gentleman]3404-a gentleman 's daughter]5169-a gentleman 's daughter ; so far [we]5170-we are equal . "[677-her ladyship]

" True . [You]677-her ladyship _ are _ [[a gentleman]3404-a gentleman 's daughter]5169-a gentleman 's daughter . But who was [[your]677-her ladyship mother]3695-your mother ? Who are [[your]677-her ladyship uncles]5174-your uncles and [aunts]5175-aunts ? Do not imagine [me]93-elizabeth ignorant of [their]5176-their condition . "[93-elizabeth]

" Whatever [my]93-elizabeth connections may be , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " if [[your]93-elizabeth nephew]5143-your nephew does not object to [them]5176-their , [they]5176-their can be nothing to _ [you]93-elizabeth _ . "[93-elizabeth]

" Tell [me]93-elizabeth once for all , are [you]93-elizabeth engaged to [him]5143-your nephew ? "[93-elizabeth]

Though [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth would not , for the mere purpose of obliging [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine , have answered this question ; [she]93-elizabeth could not but say , after a moment 's deliberation ,

" [I]97-lady catherine am not . "[97-lady catherine]

[Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine seemed pleased .

" And will [you]93-elizabeth promise [me]93-elizabeth , never to enter into such an engagement ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth will make no promise of the kind . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth [I]93-elizabeth am shocked and astonished . [I]93-elizabeth expected to find [a more reasonable young woman]5178-a more reasonable young woman . But do not deceive [yourself]93-elizabeth into a belief that [I]93-elizabeth will ever recede . [I]93-elizabeth shall not go away , till [you]93-elizabeth have given [me]93-elizabeth the assurance [I]93-elizabeth require . "[93-elizabeth]

" And [I]93-elizabeth certainly _ never _ shall give it . [I]93-elizabeth am not to be intimidated into anything so wholly unreasonable . [[Your]93-elizabeth ladyship]4054-your ladyship wants [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy to marry [[your]93-elizabeth daughter]3235-your daughter ; but would [my]93-elizabeth giving [you]93-elizabeth the wished - for promise , make _ [their]5181-their _ marriage at all more probable ? Supposing [him]100-mr. darcy to be attached to [me]93-elizabeth , would _ [my]93-elizabeth _ refusing to accept [his]100-mr. darcy hand , make [him]100-mr. darcy wish to bestow it on [[his]100-mr. darcy cousin]727-his cousin ? Allow [me]93-elizabeth to say , [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine , that the arguments with which [you]93-elizabeth have supported this extraordinary application , have been as frivolous as the application was ill - judged . [You]93-elizabeth have widely mistaken [my]93-elizabeth character , if [you]93-elizabeth think [I]93-elizabeth can be worked on by such persuasions as these . How far [[your]93-elizabeth nephew]5143-your nephew might approve of [your]93-elizabeth interference in _ [his]5143-your nephew _ affairs , [I]93-elizabeth can not tell ; but [you]93-elizabeth have certainly no right to concern [yourself]93-elizabeth in [mine]93-elizabeth . [I]93-elizabeth must beg , therefore , to be importuned no farther on the subject . "[93-elizabeth]

" Not so hasty , if [you]93-elizabeth please . [I]93-elizabeth have by no means done . To all the objections [I]93-elizabeth have already urged , [I]93-elizabeth have still another to add . [I]93-elizabeth am no stranger to the particulars of [[your]93-elizabeth youngest sister]5184-your youngest sister 's infamous elopement . [I]93-elizabeth know it all ; that [the young man]787-the young man 's marrying [her]5184-your youngest sister , was a patched - up business , at the expence of [[your]93-elizabeth father]3227-your father and [uncles]3252-uncles . And is _ such _ [a girl]3548-a girl to be [[[my]93-elizabeth nephew]5118-my nephew 's sister]5190-my nephew 's sister ? Is _ [[her]5184-your youngest sister _ husband]5191-her _ husband , is [the son of [[his]787-the young man late father 's steward]5193-his late father 's steward]5192-the son of his late father 's steward , to be [[his]787-the young man brother]2346-his brother ? Heaven and earth!--of what are [you]2827-you thinking ? Are the shades of [Pemberley]12-pemberley to be thus polluted ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [You]2827-you can _ now _ have nothing farther to say , "[2827-you] [she]2827-you resentfully answered . " [You]2827-you have insulted [me]2827-you , in every possible method . [I]2827-you must beg to return to [the house]3026-the house . "[2827-you]

And [she]2827-you rose as [she]2827-you spoke . [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine rose also , and [they]2828-they turned back . [[Her]97-lady catherine ladyship]677-her ladyship was highly incensed .

" [You]2827-you have no regard , then , for the honour and credit of [[my]2827-you nephew]5118-my nephew ! [Unfeeling , selfish girl]5197-unfeeling , selfish girl ! Do [you]2827-you not consider that a connection with [you]2827-you , must disgrace [him]5118-my nephew in the eyes of [everybody]5043-everybody ? "[2827-you]

" [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine , [I]2827-you have nothing farther to say . [You]97-lady catherine know [my]2827-you sentiments . "[2827-you]

" [You]97-lady catherine are then resolved to have [him]5118-my nephew ? "[2827-you]

" [I]2827-you have said no such thing . [I]2827-you am only resolved to act in that manner , which will , in [my]2827-you own opinion , constitute [my]2827-you happiness , without reference to _ [you]97-lady catherine _ , or to [any person so wholly unconnected with [me]2827-you]5199-any person so wholly unconnected with me . "[2827-you]

" It is well . [You]97-lady catherine refuse , then , to oblige [me]2827-you . [You]97-lady catherine refuse to obey the claims of duty , honour , and gratitude . [You]97-lady catherine are determined to ruin [him]5118-my nephew in the opinion of all [[his]5118-my nephew friends]423-his friends , and make [him]5118-my nephew the contempt of [the world]323-the world . "[2827-you]

" Neither duty , nor honour , nor gratitude , "[2827-you] replied [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " have any possible claim on [me]93-elizabeth , in the present instance . No principle of either , would be violated by [my]93-elizabeth marriage with [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy . And with regard to the resentment of [[his]5118-my nephew family]394-his family , or the indignation of [the world]323-the world , if [the former _]5204-the former _ were _ excited by [his]5118-my nephew marrying [me]93-elizabeth , it would not give [me]93-elizabeth one moment 's concern -- and [the world]323-the world in general would have too much sense to join in the scorn . "[93-elizabeth]

" And this is [your]97-lady catherine real opinion ! This is [your]97-lady catherine final resolve ! Very well . [I]97-lady catherine shall now know how to act . Do not imagine , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth , that [your]97-lady catherine ambition will ever be gratified . [I]97-lady catherine came to try [you]97-lady catherine . [I]97-lady catherine hoped to find [you]97-lady catherine reasonable ; but depend upon it [I]97-lady catherine will carry [my]97-lady catherine point . "[97-lady catherine]

In this manner [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine talked on , till [they]2830-they were at the door of [the carriage]3221-the carriage , when turning hastily round , [she]97-lady catherine added ,

" [I]97-lady catherine take no leave of [you]97-lady catherine , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth . [I]97-lady catherine send no compliments to [[your]97-lady catherine mother]3695-your mother . [You]97-lady catherine deserve no such attention . [I]97-lady catherine am most seriously displeased . "[97-lady catherine]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth made no answer ; and without attempting to persuade [[her]93-elizabeth ladyship]677-her ladyship to return into [the house]3026-the house , walked quietly into [it]3026-the house [herself]93-elizabeth . [She]93-elizabeth heard [the carriage]3221-the carriage drive away as [she]93-elizabeth proceeded up [stairs]529-stairs . [[Her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother impatiently met [her]93-elizabeth at the door of [the dressing - room]2837-the dressing - room , to ask why [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine would not come in again and rest [herself]97-lady catherine .

" [She]97-lady catherine did not choose it , "[475-her daughter] said [[her]261-her mother daughter]475-her daughter , " [she]97-lady catherine would go . "[475-her daughter]

" [She]97-lady catherine is [a very fine - looking woman]5207-a very fine - looking woman ! and [her]97-lady catherine calling [here]3019-here was prodigiously civil ! for [she]97-lady catherine only came , [I]475-her daughter suppose , to tell [us]5209-us [the Collinses]4386-the collinses were well . [She]97-lady catherine is on [[her]97-lady catherine road]5211-her road somewhere , [I]475-her daughter dare say , and so passing through [Meryton]9-meryton , thought [she]97-lady catherine might as well call on [you]93-elizabeth . [I]475-her daughter suppose [she]97-lady catherine had nothing particular to say to [you]93-elizabeth , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth ? "[475-her daughter]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was forced to give into a little falsehood here ; for to acknowledge the substance of [their]2839-their conversation was impossible .

CHAPTER XV .

The discomposure of spirits , which this extraordinary visit threw [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth into , could not be easily overcome ; nor could [she]93-elizabeth for many hours , learn to think of it less than incessantly . [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine it appeared , had actually taken the trouble of this journey from [Rosings]22-rosings , for the sole purpose of breaking off [her]97-lady catherine supposed engagement with [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy . It was a rational scheme to be sure ! but from what the report of [their]2839-their engagement could originate , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was at a loss to imagine ; till [she]93-elizabeth recollected that _ [his]2840-his _ being [the intimate friend of [Bingley]102-miss bingley]2841-the intimate friend of bingley , and _ [her]2842-her _ being [the sister of [Jane]94-jane]2843-the sister of jane , was enough , at a time when the expectation of one wedding , made [every body]324-every body eager for another , to supply the idea . [She]93-elizabeth had not [herself]93-elizabeth forgotten to feel that the marriage of [[her]93-elizabeth sister]348-her sister must bring [them]2839-their more frequently together . And [[her]93-elizabeth neighbours]844-her neighbours at [Lucas lodge]10-lucas lodge , therefore , ( for through [their]844-her neighbours communication with [the Collinses]4386-the collinses , the report [she]93-elizabeth concluded had reached [lady Catherine]97-lady catherine ) had only set _ that _ down , as almost certain and immediate , which _ [she]93-elizabeth _ had looked forward to as possible , at some future time .

In revolving [lady Catherine]97-lady catherine 's expressions , however , [she]93-elizabeth could not help feeling some uneasiness as to the possible consequence of [her]93-elizabeth persisting in this interference . From what [she]93-elizabeth had said of [her]93-elizabeth resolution to prevent [their]2839-their marriage , it occurred to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth that [she]93-elizabeth must meditate an application to [[her]93-elizabeth nephew]3571-her nephew ; and how _ [he]3571-her nephew _ might take a similar representation of the evils attached to a connection with [her]93-elizabeth , [she]93-elizabeth dared not pronounce . [She]93-elizabeth knew not the exact degree of [his]3571-her nephew affection for [[his]3571-her nephew aunt]945-his aunt , or [his]3571-her nephew dependence on [her]945-his aunt judgment , but it was natural to suppose that [he]3571-her nephew thought much higher of [her]945-his aunt ladyship than _ [she]945-his aunt _ could do ; and it was certain , that in enumerating the miseries of a marriage with _ one _ , whose immediate connections were so unequal to [his]3571-her nephew own , [[his]3571-her nephew aunt]945-his aunt would address [him]3571-her nephew on [his]3571-her nephew weakest side . With [his]3571-her nephew notions of dignity , [he]3571-her nephew would probably feel that the arguments , which to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had appeared weak and ridiculous , contained much good sense and solid reasoning .

If [he]3571-her nephew had been wavering before , as to what [he]3571-her nephew should do , which had often seemed likely , the advice and intreaty of [so near a relation]2851-so near a relation might settle every doubt , and determine [him]3571-her nephew at once to be as happy , as dignity unblemished could make [him]3571-her nephew . In that case [he]3571-her nephew would return no more . [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine might see [him]3571-her nephew in [her]97-lady catherine way through [town]285-town ; and [his]3571-her nephew engagement to [Bingley]102-miss bingley of coming again to [Netherfield]2-netherfield must give way .

" If , therefore , an excuse for not keeping [his]3571-her nephew promise , should come to [[his]3571-her nephew friend]307-his friend within a few days , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth added , " [I]93-elizabeth shall know how to understand it . [I]93-elizabeth shall then give over every expectation , every wish of [his]3571-her nephew constancy . If [he]3571-her nephew is satisfied with only regretting [me]93-elizabeth , when [he]3571-her nephew might have obtained [my]93-elizabeth affections and hand , [I]93-elizabeth shall soon cease to regret [him]3571-her nephew at all . "[93-elizabeth]

* * * * *

The surprise of [the rest of [the family]432-the family]894-the rest of the family , on hearing who [[their]894-the rest of the family visitor]1581-their visitor had been , was very great ; but [they]894-the rest of the family obligingly satisfied it , with the same kind of supposition , which had appeased [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet 's curiosity ; and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was spared from much teazing on the subject .

The next morning , as [she]93-elizabeth was going down [stairs]529-stairs , [she]93-elizabeth was met by [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father , who came out of [[his]264-her father library]280-his library with a letter in [his]264-her father hand .

" [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , "[264-her father] said [he]264-her father , " [I]264-her father was going to look for [you]93-elizabeth ; come into [[my]264-her father room]3734-my room . "[264-her father]

[She]93-elizabeth followed [him]264-her father thither ; and [her]93-elizabeth curiosity to know what [he]264-her father had to tell [her]93-elizabeth , was heightened by the supposition of its being in some manner connected with the letter [he]264-her father held . It suddenly struck [her]93-elizabeth that it might be from [lady Catherine]97-lady catherine ; and [she]93-elizabeth anticipated with dismay all the consequent explanations .

[She]93-elizabeth followed [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father to [the fire place]2860-the fire place , and [they]2861-they both sat down . [He]264-her father then said ,

" [I]264-her father have received a letter this morning that has astonished [me]264-her father exceedingly . As it principally concerns [yourself]93-elizabeth , [you]93-elizabeth ought to know its contents . [I]264-her father did not know before , that [I]264-her father had [_ two _ daughters]5214-_ two _ daughters on the brink of matrimony . Let [me]264-her father congratulate [you]93-elizabeth , on a very important conquest . "[264-her father]

The colour now rushed into [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's cheeks in the instantaneous conviction of its being a letter from [the nephew]2862-the nephew , instead of [the aunt]2160-the aunt ; and [she]93-elizabeth was undetermined whether most to be pleased that [he]264-her father explained [himself]264-her father at all , or offended that [his]264-her father letter was not rather addressed to [herself]93-elizabeth ; when [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father continued ,

" [You]93-elizabeth look conscious . [Young ladies]3267-young ladies have great penetration in such matters as these ; but [I]264-her father think [I]264-her father may defy even _ [your]93-elizabeth _ sagacity , to discover the name of [[your]93-elizabeth admirer]5216-your admirer . This letter is from [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins . "[264-her father]

" From [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins ! and what can _ [he]264-her father _ have to say ? "[264-her father]

" Something very much to the purpose of course . [He]264-her father begins with congratulations on the approaching nuptials of [[my]264-her father eldest daughter]5217-my eldest daughter , of which it seems [he]264-her father has been told , by [some of [the good - natured , gossiping Lucases]5219-the good - natured , gossiping lucases]5218-some of the good - natured , gossiping lucases . [I]264-her father shall not sport with [your]2865-you impatience , by reading what [he]264-her father says on that point . What relates to [yourself]2865-you , is as follows . "[264-her father] Having thus offered [you]2865-you the sincere congratulations of [Mrs. Collins]186-mrs. collins and [myself]7-longbourn on this happy event , let [me]7-longbourn now add a short hint on the subject of another : of which [we]2866-we have been advertised by [the same authority]2867-the same authority . [[Your]186-mrs. collins daughter]3235-your daughter [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , it is presumed , will not long bear the name of [Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , after [[her]93-elizabeth elder sister]2869-her elder sister has resigned it , and [the chosen partner of [her]93-elizabeth fate]2870-the chosen partner of her fate , may be reasonably looked up to , as [one of the most illustrious personages in [this land]2872-this land]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land . " "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" Can [you]2865-you possibly guess , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , who is meant by this ? "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land] " [This young gentleman]5220-this young gentleman is blessed in a peculiar way , with every thing the heart of [mortal]5221-mortal can most desire,--splendid property , noble kindred , and extensive patronage . Yet in spite of all these temptations , let [me]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land warn [[my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land cousin]3411-my cousin [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , and [yourself]93-elizabeth , of what evils [you]93-elizabeth may incur , by a precipitate closure with [this gentleman]3184-this gentleman 's proposals , which , of course , [you]93-elizabeth will be inclined to take immediate advantage of . "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" Have [you]2865-you any idea , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , who [this gentleman]3184-this gentleman is ? But now it comes out . "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" [My]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land motive for cautioning [you]2865-you , is as follows . [We]5225-we have reason to imagine that [[his]3184-this gentleman aunt]945-his aunt , [lady Catherine de Bourgh]97-lady catherine , does not look on the match with a friendly eye . "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" _ [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy _ , [you]2865-you see , is [the man]3112-the man ! Now , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land think [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land _ have _ surprised [you]2865-you . Could [he]3184-this gentleman , or [the Lucases]113-the lucases , have pitched on [any man , within the circle of [our]5225-we acquaintance]5228-any man , within the circle of our acquaintance , whose name would have given the lie more effectually to what [they]5228-any man , within the circle of our acquaintance related ? [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy , who never looks at [any woman]3781-any woman but to see a blemish , and who probably never looked at _ [you]2865-you _ in [his]3184-this gentleman life ! It is admirable ! "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth tried to join in [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father 's pleasantry , but could only force one most reluctant smile . Never had [his]264-her father wit been directed in a manner so little agreeable to [her]93-elizabeth .

" Are [you]264-her father not diverted ? "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" Oh ! yes . Pray read on . "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" After mentioning the likelihood of this marriage to [[her]3184-this gentleman ladyship]677-her ladyship last night , [she]3184-this gentleman immediately , with [her]3184-this gentleman usual condescension , expressed what [she]3184-this gentleman felt on the occasion ; when it became apparent , that on the score of some family objections on the part of [[my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land cousin]3411-my cousin , [she]3184-this gentleman would never give [her]3184-this gentleman consent to what [she]3184-this gentleman termed so disgraceful a match . [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land thought it [my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land duty to give the speediest intelligence of this to [[my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land cousin]3411-my cousin , that [she]3184-this gentleman and [[her]3184-this gentleman noble admirer]5233-her noble admirer may be aware of what [they]5234-they are about , and not run hastily into a marriage which has not been properly sanctioned . "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land] " [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins moreover adds , "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land] " [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land am truly rejoiced that [[my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land cousin]3411-my cousin [Lydia]95-lydia 's sad business has been so well hushed up , and am only concerned that [their]5234-they living together before the marriage took place , should be so generally known . [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land must not , however , neglect the duties of [my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land station , or refrain from declaring [my]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land amazement , at hearing that [you]5236-your received [the young couple]2537-the young couple into [[your]5236-your house]684-your house as soon as [they]2537-the young couple were married . It was an encouragement of vice ; and had [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land been [the rector of [Longbourn]7-longbourn]5239-the rector of longbourn , [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land should very strenuously have opposed it . [You]5236-your ought certainly to forgive [them]2537-the young couple as [a christian]5240-a christian , but never to admit [them]2537-the young couple in [your]5236-your sight , or allow [their]2537-the young couple names to be mentioned in [your]5236-your hearing . "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land] " _ That _ is [his]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land notion of christian forgiveness ! The rest of [his]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land letter is only about [his]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land dear [Charlotte]114-charlotte 's situation , and [his]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land expectation of [a young olive - branch]5241-a young olive - branch . But , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [you]93-elizabeth look as if [you]93-elizabeth did not enjoy it . [You]93-elizabeth are not going to be [_ Missish _]5242-_ missish _ , [I]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land hope , and pretend to be affronted at an idle report . For what do [we]5243-our live , but to make sport for [[our]5243-our neighbours]5244-our neighbours , and laugh at [them]5244-our neighbours in [our]5243-our turn ? "[2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land]

" Oh ! "[93-elizabeth] cried [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " [I]93-elizabeth am excessively diverted . But it is so strange ! "[93-elizabeth]

" Yes--_that _ is what makes it amusing . Had [they]5244-our neighbours fixed on [any other man]5054-any other man it would have been nothing ; but _ [his]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land _ perfect indifference , and _ [your]93-elizabeth _ pointed dislike , make it so delightfully absurd ! Much as [I]2874-i abominate writing , [I]2874-i would not give up [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins 's correspondence for any consideration . Nay , when [I]2874-i read a letter of [his]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land , [I]2874-i can not help giving [him]2871-one of the most illustrious personages in this land the preference even over [Wickham]165-george wickham , much as [I]2874-i value the impudence and hypocrisy of [[my]2874-i son - in - law]5246-my son - in - law . And pray , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , what said [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine about this report ? Did [she]97-lady catherine call to refuse [her]97-lady catherine consent ? "[2874-i]

To this question [[his]2874-i daughter]1127-his daughter replied only with a laugh ; and as it had been asked without the least suspicion , [she]1127-his daughter was not distressed by [his]2874-i repeating it .
