[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had never been more at a loss to make [her]93-elizabeth feelings appear what they were not . It was necessary to laugh , when [she]93-elizabeth would rather have cried . [[Her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father had most cruelly mortified [her]93-elizabeth , by what [he]264-her father said of [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy 's indifference , and [she]93-elizabeth could do nothing but wonder at such a want of penetration , or fear that perhaps , instead of [his]264-her father seeing too _ little _ , [she]93-elizabeth might have fancied too _ much _ .

CHAPTER XVI .

Instead of receiving any such letter of excuse from [[his]2874-i friend]307-his friend , as [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth half expected [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley to do , [he]90-mr. bingley was able to bring [Darcy]100-mr. darcy with [him]90-mr. bingley to [Longbourn]7-longbourn before many days had passed after [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine 's visit . [The gentlemen]311-the gentlemen arrived early ; and , before [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet had time to tell [him]90-mr. bingley of [their]311-the gentlemen having seen [[his]90-mr. bingley aunt]945-his aunt , of which [[her]96-mrs. bennet daughter]475-her daughter sat in momentary dread , [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , who wanted to be alone with [Jane]94-jane , proposed [their]311-the gentlemen all walking out . It was agreed to . [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet was not in the habit of walking , [Mary]98-mary could never spare time , but [the remaining five]2881-the remaining five set off together . [Bingley]90-mr. bingley and [Jane]94-jane , however , soon allowed [the others]517-the others to outstrip [them]311-the gentlemen . [They]311-the gentlemen lagged behind , while [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , [Kitty]97-lady catherine , and [Darcy]100-mr. darcy , were to entertain [each other]3157-each other . Very little was said by [either]2884-either ; [Kitty]97-lady catherine was too much afraid of [him]90-mr. bingley to talk ; [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was secretly forming a desperate resolution ; and perhaps [he]90-mr. bingley might be doing the same .

[They]311-the gentlemen walked towards [the Lucases]113-the lucases , because [Kitty]97-lady catherine wished to call upon [Maria]105-maria ; and as [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth saw no occasion for making it a general concern , when [Kitty]97-lady catherine left [them]311-the gentlemen , [she]93-elizabeth went boldly on with [him]90-mr. bingley alone . Now was the moment for [her]93-elizabeth resolution to be executed , and , while [her]93-elizabeth courage was high , [she]93-elizabeth immediately said ,

" [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy , [I]93-elizabeth am [a very selfish creature]5247-a very selfish creature ; and , for the sake of giving relief to [my]93-elizabeth own feelings , care not how much [I]93-elizabeth may be wounding [your]100-mr. darcy 's . [I]93-elizabeth can no longer help thanking [you]100-mr. darcy for [your]100-mr. darcy unexampled kindness to [[my]93-elizabeth poor sister]5248-my poor sister . Ever since [I]93-elizabeth have known it , [I]93-elizabeth have been most anxious to acknowledge to [you]100-mr. darcy how gratefully [I]93-elizabeth feel it . Were it known to [the rest of [[my]93-elizabeth family]3708-my family]5249-the rest of my family , [I]93-elizabeth should not have merely [my]93-elizabeth own gratitude to express . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]100-mr. darcy am sorry , exceedingly sorry , "[100-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]100-mr. darcy , in a tone of surprise and emotion , " that [you]100-mr. darcy have ever been informed of what may , in a mistaken light , have given [you]100-mr. darcy uneasiness . [I]100-mr. darcy did not think [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner was so little to be trusted . "[100-mr. darcy]

" [You]100-mr. darcy must not blame [[my]93-elizabeth aunt]3208-my aunt . [Lydia]95-lydia 's thoughtlessness first betrayed to [me]93-elizabeth that [you]100-mr. darcy had been concerned in the matter ; and , of course , [I]93-elizabeth could not rest till [I]93-elizabeth knew the particulars . Let [me]93-elizabeth thank [you]100-mr. darcy again and again , in the name of all [[my]93-elizabeth family]3708-my family , for that generous compassion which induced [you]100-mr. darcy to take so much trouble , and bear so many mortifications , for the sake of discovering them . "[93-elizabeth]

" If [you]100-mr. darcy _ will _ thank [me]100-mr. darcy , "[100-mr. darcy] [he]100-mr. darcy replied , " let it be for [yourself]100-mr. darcy alone . That the wish of giving happiness to [you]100-mr. darcy , might add force to the other inducements which led [me]100-mr. darcy on , [I]100-mr. darcy shall not attempt to deny . But [[your]100-mr. darcy _ family]4511-your _ family _ owe [me]100-mr. darcy nothing . Much as [I]100-mr. darcy respect [them]4511-your _ family , [I]100-mr. darcy believe , [I]100-mr. darcy thought only of _ [you]100-mr. darcy _ . "[100-mr. darcy]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word . After a short pause , [[her]93-elizabeth companion]1696-her companion added , " [You]100-mr. darcy are too generous to trifle with [me]1696-her companion . If [your]100-mr. darcy feelings are still what they were last [April]239-april , tell [me]1696-her companion so at once . _ [My]1696-her companion _ affections and wishes are unchanged , but one word from [you]100-mr. darcy will silence [me]1696-her companion on this subject for ever . "[1696-her companion]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of [his]1696-her companion situation , now forced [herself]93-elizabeth to speak ; and immediately , though not very fluently , gave [him]1696-her companion to understand , that [her]93-elizabeth sentiments had undergone so material a change , since the period to which [he]1696-her companion alluded , as to make [her]93-elizabeth receive with gratitude and pleasure , [his]1696-her companion present assurances . The happiness which this reply produced , was such as [he]1696-her companion had probably never felt before ; and [he]1696-her companion expressed [himself]1696-her companion on the occasion as sensibly and as warmly as [a man violently in love]2886-a man violently in love can be supposed to do . Had [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth been able to encounter [his]1696-her companion eye , [she]93-elizabeth might have seen how well the expression of heart - felt delight , diffused over [his]1696-her companion face , became [him]1696-her companion ; but , though [she]93-elizabeth could not look , [she]93-elizabeth could listen , and [he]1696-her companion told [her]93-elizabeth of feelings , which , in proving of what importance [she]93-elizabeth was to [him]1696-her companion , made [his]1696-her companion affection every moment more valuable .

[They]2887-they walked on , without knowing in what direction . There was too much to be thought ; and felt , and said , for attention to any other objects . [She]93-elizabeth soon learnt that [they]2887-they were indebted for [their]2887-they present good understanding to the efforts of [[his]1696-her companion aunt]945-his aunt , who _ did _ call on [him]1696-her companion in [her]945-his aunt return through [London]5-london , and there relate [her]945-his aunt journey to [Longbourn]7-longbourn , its motive , and the substance of [her]945-his aunt conversation with [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; dwelling emphatically on every expression of the latter , which , in [[her]93-elizabeth ladyship]677-her ladyship 's apprehension , peculiarly denoted [her]93-elizabeth perverseness and assurance , in the belief that such a relation must assist [her]93-elizabeth endeavours to obtain that promise from [[her]93-elizabeth nephew]3571-her nephew , which _ [she]93-elizabeth _ had refused to give . But , unluckily for [[her]93-elizabeth ladyship]677-her ladyship , its effect had been exactly contrariwise .

" It taught [me]1696-her companion to hope , "[1696-her companion] said [he]1696-her companion , " as [I]1696-her companion had scarcely ever allowed [myself]1696-her companion to hope before . [I]1696-her companion knew enough of [your]677-her ladyship disposition to be certain , that , had [you]677-her ladyship been absolutely , irrevocably decided against [me]1696-her companion , [you]677-her ladyship would have acknowledged it to [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine , frankly and openly . "[1696-her companion]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth coloured and laughed as [she]93-elizabeth replied , " Yes , [you]1696-her companion know enough of [my]93-elizabeth _ frankness _ to believe [me]93-elizabeth capable of _ that _ . After abusing [you]677-her ladyship so abominably to [your]677-her ladyship face , [I]93-elizabeth could have no scruple in abusing [you]677-her ladyship to all [your]677-her ladyship relations . "[93-elizabeth]

" What did [you]677-her ladyship say of [me]677-her ladyship , that [I]677-her ladyship did not deserve ? For , though [your]677-her ladyship accusations were ill - founded , formed on mistaken premises , [my]677-her ladyship behaviour to [you]677-her ladyship at the time , had merited the severest reproof . It was unpardonable . [I]677-her ladyship can not think of it without abhorrence . "[677-her ladyship]

" [We]5254-we will not quarrel for the greater share of blame annexed to that evening , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . " The conduct of [neither]5255-neither , if strictly examined , will be irreproachable ; but since then , [we]5254-we have both , [I]93-elizabeth hope , improved in civility . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]677-her ladyship can not be so easily reconciled to [myself]677-her ladyship . The recollection of what [I]677-her ladyship then said , of [my]677-her ladyship conduct , [my]677-her ladyship manners , [my]677-her ladyship expressions during the whole of it , is now , and has been many months , inexpressibly painful to [me]677-her ladyship . [Your]677-her ladyship reproof , so well applied , [I]677-her ladyship shall never forget : ' had [you]677-her ladyship behaved in a more gentleman - like manner . ' Those were [your]677-her ladyship words . [You]677-her ladyship know not , [you]677-her ladyship can scarcely conceive , how [they]5256-their have tortured me;--though it was some time , [I]677-her ladyship confess , before [I]677-her ladyship was reasonable enough to allow [their]5256-their justice . "[677-her ladyship]

" [I]93-elizabeth was certainly very far from expecting [them]5256-their to make so strong an impression . [I]93-elizabeth had not the smallest idea of [their]5256-their being ever felt in such a way . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]677-her ladyship can easily believe it . [You]677-her ladyship thought [me]677-her ladyship then devoid of every proper feeling , [I]677-her ladyship am sure [you]677-her ladyship did . The turn of [your]677-her ladyship countenance [I]677-her ladyship shall never forget , as [you]677-her ladyship said that [I]677-her ladyship could not have addressed [you]677-her ladyship in any possible way , that would induce [you]677-her ladyship to accept [me]677-her ladyship . "[677-her ladyship]

" Oh ! do not repeat what [I]93-elizabeth then said . These recollections will not do at all . [I]93-elizabeth assure [you]677-her ladyship , that [I]93-elizabeth have long been most heartily ashamed of it . "[93-elizabeth]

[Darcy]100-mr. darcy mentioned [his]100-mr. darcy letter . " Did it , "[100-mr. darcy] said [he]100-mr. darcy , " did it _ soon _ make [you]677-her ladyship think better of [me]100-mr. darcy ? Did [you]677-her ladyship , on reading it , give any credit to its contents ? "[100-mr. darcy]

[She]2892-my explained what its effect on [her]2892-my had been , and how gradually all [her]2892-my former prejudices had been removed .

" [I]100-mr. darcy knew , "[100-mr. darcy] said [he]100-mr. darcy , " that what [I]100-mr. darcy wrote must give [you]677-her ladyship pain , but it was necessary . [I]100-mr. darcy hope [you]677-her ladyship have destroyed the letter . There was one part especially , the opening of it , which [I]100-mr. darcy should dread [your]677-her ladyship having the power of reading again . [I]100-mr. darcy can remember some expressions which might justly make [you]677-her ladyship hate [me]100-mr. darcy . "[100-mr. darcy]

" The letter shall certainly be burnt , if [you]677-her ladyship believe it essential to the preservation of [my]2892-my regard ; but , though [we]5257-we have both reason to think [my]2892-my opinions not entirely unalterable , they are not , [I]2892-my hope , quite so easily changed as that implies . "[2892-my]

" When [I]100-mr. darcy wrote that letter , "[100-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]100-mr. darcy , " [I]100-mr. darcy believed [myself]100-mr. darcy perfectly calm and cool , but [I]100-mr. darcy am since convinced that it was written in a dreadful bitterness of spirit . "[100-mr. darcy]

" The letter , perhaps , began in bitterness , but it did not end so . The adieu is charity itself . But think no more of the letter . The feelings of [the person who wrote]5258-the person who wrote , and [the person who received it]5259-the person who received it , are now so widely different from what they were then , that every unpleasant circumstance attending it , ought to be forgotten . [You]677-her ladyship must learn some of [my]2892-my philosophy . Think only of the past as its remembrance gives [you]677-her ladyship pleasure . "[2892-my]

" [I]100-mr. darcy can not give [you]677-her ladyship credit for any philosophy of the kind . _ [Your]677-her ladyship _ retrospections must be so totally void of reproach , that the contentment arising from them , is not of philosophy , but what is much better , of ignorance . But with _ [me]100-mr. darcy _ , it is not so . Painful recollections will intrude , which can not , which ought not to be repelled . [I]100-mr. darcy have been [a selfish being]5260-a selfish being all [my]100-mr. darcy life , in practice , though not in principle . As [a child]3550-a child [I]100-mr. darcy was taught what was _ right _ , but [I]100-mr. darcy was not taught to correct [my]100-mr. darcy temper . [I]100-mr. darcy was given good principles , but left to follow them in pride and conceit . Unfortunately [an only son]5262-an only son , ( for many years [an only _ child _ )]5263-an only _ child _ ) [I]100-mr. darcy was spoilt by [[my]100-mr. darcy parents]5264-my parents , who though good [themselves]5264-my parents , ( [[my]100-mr. darcy father]3259-my father particularly , all that was benevolent and amiable , ) allowed , encouraged , almost taught [me]100-mr. darcy to be selfish and overbearing , to care for none beyond [[my]100-mr. darcy own family circle]5266-my own family circle , to think meanly of all the rest of [the world]323-the world , to _ wish _ at least to think meanly of [their]5264-my parents sense and worth compared with [my]100-mr. darcy own . Such [I]100-mr. darcy was , from eight to eight and twenty ; and such [I]100-mr. darcy might still have been but for [you]5268-you , dearest , loveliest [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ! What do [I]100-mr. darcy not owe [you]5268-you ! [You]5268-you taught [me]100-mr. darcy a lesson , hard indeed at first , but most advantageous . By [you]5268-you , [I]100-mr. darcy was properly humbled . [I]100-mr. darcy came to [you]5268-you without a doubt of [my]100-mr. darcy reception . [You]5268-you shewed [me]100-mr. darcy how insufficient were all [my]100-mr. darcy pretensions to please a woman worthy of being pleased . "[100-mr. darcy]

" Had [you]100-mr. darcy then persuaded [yourself]100-mr. darcy that [I]100-mr. darcy should ? "[100-mr. darcy]

" Indeed [I]100-mr. darcy had . What will [you]5268-you think of [my]100-mr. darcy vanity ? [I]100-mr. darcy believed [you]5268-you to be wishing , expecting [my]100-mr. darcy addresses . "[100-mr. darcy]

" [My]100-mr. darcy manners must have been in fault , but not intentionally [I]100-mr. darcy assure [you]5268-you . [I]100-mr. darcy never meant to deceive [you]5268-you , but [my]100-mr. darcy spirits might often lead [me]100-mr. darcy wrong . How [you]5268-you must have hated [me]100-mr. darcy after _ that _ evening ? "[100-mr. darcy]

" Hate [you]100-mr. darcy ! [I]100-mr. darcy was angry perhaps at first , but [my]100-mr. darcy anger soon began to take a proper direction . "[100-mr. darcy]

" [I]100-mr. darcy am almost afraid of asking what [you]5268-you thought of [me]100-mr. darcy ; when [we]5269-we met at [Pemberley]12-pemberley . [You]5268-you blamed [me]100-mr. darcy for coming ? "[100-mr. darcy]

" No indeed ; [I]100-mr. darcy felt nothing but surprise . "[100-mr. darcy]

" [Your]100-mr. darcy surprise could not be greater than _ mine _ in being noticed by [you]5268-you . [My]100-mr. darcy conscience told [me]100-mr. darcy that [I]100-mr. darcy deserved no extraordinary politeness , and [I]100-mr. darcy confess that [I]100-mr. darcy did not expect to receive _ more _ than [my]100-mr. darcy due . "[100-mr. darcy]

" [My]100-mr. darcy object _ then _ , "[100-mr. darcy] replied [Darcy]100-mr. darcy , " was to shew [you]5268-you , by every civility in [my]100-mr. darcy power , that [I]100-mr. darcy was not so mean as to resent the past ; and [I]100-mr. darcy hoped to obtain [your]5268-you forgiveness , to lessen [your]5268-you ill opinion , by letting [you]5268-you see that [your]5268-you reproofs had been attended to . How soon any other wishes introduced [themselves]5270-themselves [I]100-mr. darcy can hardly tell , but [I]100-mr. darcy believe in about half an hour after [I]100-mr. darcy had seen [you]5268-you . "[100-mr. darcy]

[He]100-mr. darcy then told [her]2893-her of [Georgiana]175-georgiana 's delight in [her]175-georgiana acquaintance , and of [her]175-georgiana disappointment at its sudden interruption ; which naturally leading to the cause of that interruption , [she]2893-her soon learnt that [his]100-mr. darcy resolution of following [her]175-georgiana from [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire in quest of [[her]175-georgiana sister]348-her sister , had been formed before [he]100-mr. darcy quitted [the inn]1736-the inn , and that [his]100-mr. darcy gravity and thoughtfulness there , had arisen from no other struggles than what such a purpose must comprehend .

[She]2893-her expressed [her]2893-her gratitude again , but it was too painful a subject to each , to be dwelt on farther .

After walking several miles in a leisurely manner , and too busy to know any thing about it , [they]2896-their found at last , on examining [their]2896-their watches , that it was time to be at [home]3223-home .

" What could become of [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley and [Jane]94-jane ! "[307-his friend] was a wonder which introduced the discussion of _ [their]2896-their _ affairs . [Darcy]175-georgiana was delighted with [their]2896-their engagement ; [[his]100-mr. darcy friend]307-his friend had given [him]100-mr. darcy the earliest information of it .

" [I]93-elizabeth must ask whether [you]100-mr. darcy were surprised ? "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth .

" Not at all . When [I]307-his friend went away , [I]307-his friend felt that it would soon happen . "[307-his friend]

" That is to say , [you]100-mr. darcy had given [your]100-mr. darcy permission . [I]100-mr. darcy guessed as much . "[100-mr. darcy] And though [he]100-mr. darcy exclaimed at the term , [she]93-elizabeth found that it had been pretty much the case .

" On the evening before [my]100-mr. darcy going to [London]5-london , "[100-mr. darcy] said [he]100-mr. darcy " [I]100-mr. darcy made a confession to [him]100-mr. darcy , which [I]100-mr. darcy believe [I]100-mr. darcy ought to have made long ago . [I]100-mr. darcy told [him]100-mr. darcy of all that had occurred to make [my]100-mr. darcy former interference in [his]100-mr. darcy affairs , absurd and impertinent . [His]100-mr. darcy surprise was great . [He]100-mr. darcy had never had the slightest suspicion . [I]100-mr. darcy told [him]100-mr. darcy , moreover , that [I]100-mr. darcy believed [myself]100-mr. darcy mistaken in supposing , as [I]100-mr. darcy had done , that [[your]2899-your sister]3152-your sister was indifferent to [him]100-mr. darcy ; and as [I]100-mr. darcy could easily perceive that [his]100-mr. darcy attachment to [her]3152-your sister was unabated , [I]100-mr. darcy felt no doubt of [their]5272-their happiness together . "[100-mr. darcy]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth could not help smiling at [his]2899-your easy manner of directing [[his]2899-your friend]307-his friend .

" Did [you]2899-your speak from [your]2899-your own observation , "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth , " when [you]2899-your told [him]100-mr. darcy that [[my]93-elizabeth sister]3284-my sister loved [him]100-mr. darcy , or merely from [my]93-elizabeth information last spring ? "[93-elizabeth]

" From [the former]347-the former . [I]307-his friend had narrowly observed [her]3152-your sister during the two visits which [I]307-his friend had lately made [her]3152-your sister [here]3019-here ; and [I]307-his friend was convinced of [her]3152-your sister affection . "[307-his friend]

" And [your]2899-your assurance of it , [I]93-elizabeth suppose , carried immediate conviction to [him]100-mr. darcy . "[93-elizabeth]

" It did . [Bingley]90-mr. bingley is most unaffectedly modest . [His]90-mr. bingley diffidence had prevented [his]90-mr. bingley depending on [his]90-mr. bingley own judgment in so anxious a case , but [his]90-mr. bingley reliance on [mine]93-elizabeth , made every thing easy . [I]307-his friend was obliged to confess one thing , which for a time , and not unjustly , offended [him]90-mr. bingley . [He]90-mr. bingley was angry . But [his]90-mr. bingley anger , [I]307-his friend am persuaded , lasted no longer than [he]90-mr. bingley remained in any doubt of [[your]2899-your sister]3152-your sister 's sentiments . [He]90-mr. bingley has heartily forgiven [me]307-his friend now . "[307-his friend]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth longed to observe that [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley had been [a most delightful friend]2901-a most delightful friend ; so easily guided that [his]90-mr. bingley worth was invaluable ; but [she]93-elizabeth checked [herself]93-elizabeth . [She]93-elizabeth remembered that [he]90-mr. bingley had yet to learn to be laught at , and it was rather too early to begin . In anticipating the happiness of [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , which of course was to be inferior only to [his]90-mr. bingley own , [he]90-mr. bingley continued the conversation till [they]2902-they reached [the house]3026-the house . In [the hall]708-the hall [they]2902-they parted .

CHAPTER XVII .

" [[My]90-mr. bingley dear]3018-my dear [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , where can [you]93-elizabeth have been walking to ? "[90-mr. bingley] was a question which [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth received from [Jane]94-jane as soon as [she]93-elizabeth entered [the room]271-the room , and from [all the others]1179-all the others when [they]2902-they sat down to table . [She]93-elizabeth had only to say in reply , that [they]2902-they had wandered about , till [she]93-elizabeth was beyond [her]93-elizabeth own knowledge . [She]93-elizabeth coloured as [she]93-elizabeth spoke ; but neither that , nor any thing else , awakened a suspicion of the truth .

The evening passed quietly , unmarked by any thing extraordinary . [The acknowledged lovers]2907-the acknowledged lovers talked and laughed , [the unacknowledged]2908-the unacknowledged were silent . [Darcy]175-georgiana was not of a disposition in which happiness overflows in mirth ; and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , agitated and confused , rather _ knew _ that [she]93-elizabeth was happy , than _ felt _ [herself]93-elizabeth to be so ; for , besides the immediate embarrassment , there were other evils before [her]93-elizabeth . [She]93-elizabeth anticipated what would be felt in [the family]432-the family when [her]93-elizabeth situation became known ; [she]93-elizabeth was aware that [no one]3275-no one liked [him]2911-him but [Jane]94-jane ; and even feared that with [the others]517-the others it was a _ dislike _ which not all [his]2911-him fortune and consequence might do away .

At night [she]93-elizabeth opened [her]93-elizabeth heart to [Jane]94-jane . Though suspicion was very far from [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth 's general habits , [she]93-elizabeth was absolutely incredulous here .

" [You]94-jane are joking , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth . This can not be!--engaged to [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy ! No , no , [you]94-jane shall not deceive [me]93-elizabeth . [I]93-elizabeth know it to be impossible . "[93-elizabeth]

" This is a wretched beginning indeed ! [My]93-elizabeth sole dependence was on [you]94-jane ; and [I]93-elizabeth am sure [nobody else]1513-nobody else will believe [me]93-elizabeth , if [you]94-jane do not . Yet , indeed , [I]93-elizabeth am in earnest . [I]93-elizabeth speak nothing but the truth . [He]100-mr. darcy still loves [me]93-elizabeth , and [we]5281-we are engaged . "[93-elizabeth]

[Jane]94-jane looked at [her]94-jane doubtingly . " Oh , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth ! it can not be . [I]94-jane know how much [you]94-jane dislike [him]100-mr. darcy . "[94-jane]

" [You]94-jane know nothing of the matter . _ That _ is all to be forgot . Perhaps [I]93-elizabeth did not always love [him]100-mr. darcy so well as [I]93-elizabeth do now . But in such cases as these , a good memory is unpardonable . This is the last time [I]93-elizabeth shall ever remember it [myself]93-elizabeth . "[93-elizabeth]

[Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth still looked all amazement . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth again , and more seriously assured [her]93-elizabeth of its truth .

" Good Heaven ! can it be really so ! Yet now [I]94-jane must believe [you]94-jane , "[94-jane] cried [Jane]94-jane . " [[My]94-jane dear]3018-my dear , dear [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , [I]94-jane would -- [I]94-jane do congratulate [you]93-elizabeth -- but are [you]93-elizabeth certain ? forgive the question -- are [you]93-elizabeth quite certain that [you]93-elizabeth can be happy with [him]100-mr. darcy ? "[94-jane]

" There can be no doubt of that . It is settled between [us]5283-we already , that [we]5283-we are to be [the happiest couple in [the world]323-the world]5284-the happiest couple in the world . But are [you]93-elizabeth pleased , [Jane]94-jane ? Shall [you]93-elizabeth like to have such [a brother]452-a brother ? "[93-elizabeth]

" Very , very much . Nothing could give either [Bingley]90-mr. bingley or [myself]94-jane more delight . But [we]5283-we considered it , [we]5283-we talked of it as impossible . And do [you]93-elizabeth really love [him]100-mr. darcy quite well enough ? Oh , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth ! do any thing rather than marry without affection . Are [you]93-elizabeth quite sure that [you]93-elizabeth feel what [you]93-elizabeth ought to do ? "[94-jane]

" Oh , yes ! [You]93-elizabeth will only think [I]93-elizabeth feel _ more _ than [I]93-elizabeth ought to do , when [I]93-elizabeth tell [you]93-elizabeth all . "[93-elizabeth]

" What do [you]93-elizabeth mean ? "[94-jane]

" Why , [I]93-elizabeth must confess , that [I]93-elizabeth love [him]100-mr. darcy better than [I]93-elizabeth do [Bingley]90-mr. bingley . [I]93-elizabeth am afraid [you]93-elizabeth will be angry . "[93-elizabeth]

" [[My]94-jane dearest sister]4530-my dearest sister , now _ be _ be serious . [I]94-jane want to talk very seriously . Let [me]94-jane know every thing that [I]94-jane am to know , without delay . " It has been coming on so gradually , that [I]93-elizabeth hardly know when it began . "[93-elizabeth]

Another intreaty that [she]2913-i would be serious , however , produced the desired effect ; and [she]2913-i soon satisfied [Jane]94-jane by [her]2913-i solemn assurances of attachment . When convinced on that article , [Miss Bennet]93-elizabeth had nothing farther to wish .

" Now [I]2913-i am quite happy , "[2913-i] said [she]2913-i , " for [you]93-elizabeth will be as happy as [myself]2913-i . [I]2913-i always had a value for [him]100-mr. darcy . Were it for nothing but [his]100-mr. darcy love of [you]93-elizabeth , [I]2913-i must always have esteemed [him]100-mr. darcy ; but now , as [[Bingley]90-mr. bingley 's friend]5289-bingley 's friend and [[your]93-elizabeth husband]5290-your husband , there can be only [Bingley]90-mr. bingley and [yourself]93-elizabeth more dear to [me]2913-i . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth told [her]93-elizabeth the motives of [her]93-elizabeth secrecy . [She]93-elizabeth had been unwilling to mention [Bingley]90-mr. bingley ; and the unsettled state of [her]93-elizabeth own feelings had made [her]93-elizabeth equally avoid the name of [[his]90-mr. bingley friend]307-his friend . But now [she]93-elizabeth would no longer conceal from [her]93-elizabeth , [his]90-mr. bingley share in [Lydia]95-lydia 's marriage . All was acknowledged , and half the night spent in conversation .

* * * * *

" Good gracious ! "[96-mrs. bennet] cried [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , as [she]96-mrs. bennet stood at a window the next morning , " if that disagreeable [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy is not coming here again with [[our]5292-our dear]5293-our dear [Bingley]90-mr. bingley ! [I]96-mrs. bennet had no notion but [he]100-mr. darcy would go a shooting , or something or other , and not disturb [us]5292-our with [his]100-mr. darcy company . What shall [we]5292-our do with [him]100-mr. darcy ? [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth could hardly help laughing at so convenient a proposal ; yet was really vexed that [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother should be always giving [him]2916-him such an epithet .

As soon as [they]2917-they entered , [Bingley]90-mr. bingley looked at [her]261-her mother so expressively , and shook hands with such warmth , as left no doubt of [his]90-mr. bingley good information ; and [he]90-mr. bingley soon afterwards said aloud , " [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet , have [you]86-mr. bennet no more lanes hereabouts in which [Lizzy]93-elizabeth may lose [her]93-elizabeth way again to - day ? "[90-mr. bingley]

" [I]96-mrs. bennet advise [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy , and [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , and [Kitty]97-lady catherine , "[96-mrs. bennet] said [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet , " to walk to [Oakham Mount]82-oakham mount this morning . It is a nice long walk , and [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy has never seen the view . "[96-mrs. bennet]

" It may do very well for the others , "[90-mr. bingley] replied [Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley ; " but [I]90-mr. bingley am sure it will be too much for [Kitty]97-lady catherine . Wo nt it , [Kitty]97-lady catherine ? "[90-mr. bingley]

[Kitty]97-lady catherine owned that [she]97-lady catherine had rather stay at [home]3223-home . [Darcy]100-mr. darcy professed a great curiosity to see the view from [the Mount]2919-the mount , and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth silently consented . As [she]93-elizabeth went up [stairs]529-stairs to get ready , [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet followed [her]93-elizabeth , saying ,

" [I]96-mrs. bennet am quite sorry , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , that [you]93-elizabeth should be forced to have [that disagreeable man]5295-that disagreeable man all to [yourself]93-elizabeth . But [I]96-mrs. bennet hope [you]93-elizabeth will not mind it : it is all for [Jane]94-jane 's sake , [you]93-elizabeth know ; and there is no occasion for talking to [him]5295-that disagreeable man , except just now and then . So , do not put [yourself]93-elizabeth to inconvenience . "[96-mrs. bennet]

During [their]2921-their walk , it was resolved that [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet 's consent should be asked in the course of the evening . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth reserved to [herself]93-elizabeth the application for [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother 's . [She]93-elizabeth could not determine how [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother would take it ; sometimes doubting whether all [his]86-mr. bennet wealth and grandeur would be enough to overcome [her]261-her mother abhorrence of [the man]3112-the man . But whether [she]93-elizabeth were violently set against the match , or violently delighted with it , it was certain that [her]93-elizabeth manner would be equally ill adapted to do credit to [her]93-elizabeth sense ; and [she]93-elizabeth could no more bear that [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy should hear the first raptures of [her]93-elizabeth joy , than the first vehemence of [her]93-elizabeth disapprobation .

* * * * *

In the evening , soon after [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet withdrew to [the library]1030-the library , [she]93-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy rise also and follow [him]100-mr. darcy , and [her]93-elizabeth agitation on seeing it was extreme . [She]93-elizabeth did not fear [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father 's opposition , but [he]264-her father was going to be made unhappy , and that it should be through [her]93-elizabeth means , that _ [she]93-elizabeth _ , [[his]264-her father favourite child]2927-his favourite child , should be distressing [him]264-her father by [her]93-elizabeth choice , should be filling [him]264-her father with fears and regrets in disposing of [her]93-elizabeth , was a wretched reflection , and [she]93-elizabeth sat in misery till [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy appeared again , when , looking at [him]100-mr. darcy , [she]93-elizabeth was a little relieved by [his]100-mr. darcy smile . In a few minutes [he]100-mr. darcy approached the table where [she]93-elizabeth was sitting with [Kitty]97-lady catherine ; and , while pretending to admire [her]93-elizabeth work , said in a whisper , " Go to [[your]93-elizabeth father]3227-your father , [he]264-her father wants [you]93-elizabeth in [the library]1030-the library . "[93-elizabeth] [She]93-elizabeth was gone directly .

[[Her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father was walking about [the room]271-the room , looking grave and anxious . " [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , "[264-her father] said [he]264-her father , " what are [you]93-elizabeth doing ? Are [you]93-elizabeth out of [your]93-elizabeth senses , to be accepting [this man]3124-this man ? Have not [you]93-elizabeth always hated [him]3124-this man ? "[264-her father]

How earnestly did [she]93-elizabeth then wish that [her]93-elizabeth former opinions had been more reasonable , [her]93-elizabeth expressions more moderate ! It would have spared [her]93-elizabeth from explanations and professions which it was exceedingly awkward to give ; but they were now necessary , and [she]93-elizabeth assured [him]264-her father with some confusion , of [her]93-elizabeth attachment to [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy .

" Or in other words , [you]264-her father are determined to have [him]3124-this man . [He]3124-this man is rich , to be sure , and [you]264-her father may have more fine clothes and fine carriages than [Jane]94-jane . But will [they]5299-they make [you]264-her father happy ? "[93-elizabeth]

" Have [you]264-her father any other objection , "[93-elizabeth] said [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , " than [your]264-her father belief of [my]93-elizabeth indifference ? "[93-elizabeth]

" None at all . [We]5300-we all know [him]3124-this man to be [a proud , unpleasant sort of man]5301-a proud , unpleasant sort of man ; but this would be nothing if [you]264-her father really liked [him]3124-this man . "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth do , [I]93-elizabeth do like [him]3124-this man , "[93-elizabeth] [she]93-elizabeth replied , with tears in [her]93-elizabeth eyes , " [I]93-elizabeth love [him]3124-this man . Indeed [he]3124-this man has no improper pride . [He]3124-this man is perfectly amiable . [You]264-her father do not know what [he]3124-this man really is ; then pray do not pain [me]93-elizabeth by speaking of [him]3124-this man in such terms . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Lizzy]93-elizabeth , "[264-her father] said [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father , " [I]264-her father have given [him]3124-this man [my]264-her father consent . [He]3124-this man is [the kind of man]5302-the kind of man , indeed , to whom [I]264-her father should never dare refuse any thing , which [he]3124-this man condescended to ask . [I]264-her father now give it to _ [you]93-elizabeth _ , if [you]93-elizabeth are resolved on having [him]3124-this man . But let [me]264-her father advise [you]93-elizabeth to think better of it . [I]264-her father know [your]93-elizabeth disposition , [Lizzy]93-elizabeth . [I]264-her father know that [you]93-elizabeth could be neither happy nor respectable , unless [you]93-elizabeth truly esteemed [[your]93-elizabeth husband]5290-your husband ; unless [you]93-elizabeth looked up to [him]3124-this man as [a superior]5304-a superior . [Your]93-elizabeth lively talents would place [you]93-elizabeth in the greatest danger in an unequal marriage . [You]93-elizabeth could scarcely escape discredit and misery . [[My]264-her father child]5305-my child , let [me]264-her father not have the grief of seeing _ [you]93-elizabeth _ unable to respect [[your]93-elizabeth partner]3092-your partner in life . [You]93-elizabeth know not what [you]93-elizabeth are about . "[264-her father]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , still more affected , was earnest and solemn in [her]93-elizabeth reply ; and at length , by repeated assurances that [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy was really the object of [her]93-elizabeth choice , by explaining the gradual change which [her]93-elizabeth estimation of [him]100-mr. darcy had undergone , relating [her]93-elizabeth absolute certainty that [his]100-mr. darcy affection was not the work of a day , but had stood the test of many months suspense , and enumerating with energy all [his]100-mr. darcy good qualities , [she]93-elizabeth did conquer [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father 's incredulity , and reconcile [him]100-mr. darcy to the match .

" Well , [[my]100-mr. darcy dear]3018-my dear , "[100-mr. darcy] said [he]100-mr. darcy , when [she]93-elizabeth ceased speaking , " [I]100-mr. darcy have no more to say . If this be the case , [he]100-mr. darcy deserves [you]3018-my dear . [I]100-mr. darcy could not have parted with [you]3018-my dear , [[my]100-mr. darcy Lizzy]5308-my lizzy , to [any one less worthy]5309-any one less worthy . "[100-mr. darcy]

To complete the favourable impression , [she]93-elizabeth then told [him]100-mr. darcy what [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy had voluntarily done for [Lydia]95-lydia . [He]100-mr. darcy heard [her]93-elizabeth with astonishment .

" This is an evening of wonders , indeed ! And so , [Darcy]100-mr. darcy did every thing ; made up the match , gave the money , paid [the fellow]5310-the fellow 's debts , and got [him]100-mr. darcy [his]100-mr. darcy commission ! So much the better . It will save [me]93-elizabeth a world of trouble and economy . Had it been [[your]3018-my dear uncle]3373-your uncle 's doing , [I]93-elizabeth must and _ would _ have paid [him]100-mr. darcy ; but [these violent young lovers]5312-these violent young lovers carry every thing [their]5312-these violent young lovers own way . [I]93-elizabeth shall offer to pay [him]100-mr. darcy to - morrow ; [he]100-mr. darcy will rant and storm about [his]100-mr. darcy love for [you]3018-my dear , and there will be an end of the matter . "[93-elizabeth]

[He]100-mr. darcy then recollected [her]93-elizabeth embarrassment a few days before , on [his]100-mr. darcy reading [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins 's letter ; and after laughing at [her]93-elizabeth some time , allowed [her]93-elizabeth at last to go -- saying , as [she]93-elizabeth quitted [the room]271-the room , " If [any young men]5313-any young men come for [Mary]98-mary or [Kitty]97-lady catherine , send [them]5313-any young men in , for [I]93-elizabeth am quite at leisure . "[93-elizabeth]

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's mind was now relieved from a very heavy weight ; and , after half an hour 's quiet reflection in [[her]93-elizabeth own room]1580-her own room , [she]93-elizabeth was able to join [the others]517-the others with tolerable composure . Every thing was too recent for gaiety , but the evening passed tranquilly away ; there was no longer any thing material to be dreaded , and the comfort of ease and familiarity would come in time .

When [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother went up to [[her]261-her mother dressing - room]4629-her dressing - room at night , [she]261-her mother followed [her]261-her mother , and made the important communication . Its effect was most extraordinary ; for on first hearing it , [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet sat quite still , and unable to utter a syllable . Nor was it under many , many minutes , that [she]96-mrs. bennet could comprehend what [she]96-mrs. bennet heard ; though not in general backward to credit what was for the advantage of [[her]96-mrs. bennet family]905-her family , or that came in the shape of [a lover]2766-a lover to any of [them]905-her family . [She]96-mrs. bennet began at length to recover , to fidget about in [her]96-mrs. bennet chair , get up , sit down again , wonder , and bless [herself]96-mrs. bennet .

" Good gracious ! [Lord]5314-lord bless [me]96-mrs. bennet ! only think ! dear [me]96-mrs. bennet ! [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy ! Who would have thought it ! And is it really true ? Oh ! [my]96-mrs. bennet sweetest [Lizzy]93-elizabeth ! how rich and how great [you]93-elizabeth will be ! What pin - money , what jewels , what carriages [you]93-elizabeth will have ! [Jane]94-jane 's is nothing to it -- nothing at all . [I]96-mrs. bennet am so pleased -- so happy . Such [a charming man!--so handsome]5315-a charming man!--so handsome ! so tall!--Oh , [[my]96-mrs. bennet dear [Lizzy]93-elizabeth]5316-my dear lizzy ! pray apologise for [my]96-mrs. bennet having disliked [him]100-mr. darcy so much before . [I]96-mrs. bennet hope [he]100-mr. darcy will overlook it . Dear , [dear Lizzy]93-elizabeth . [A house in [town]285-town]3176-a house in town ! Every thing that is charming ! [Three daughters]562-three daughters married ! Ten thousand a year ! Oh , [Lord]4341-lord ! What will become of [me]96-mrs. bennet . [I]96-mrs. bennet shall go distracted . "[96-mrs. bennet]

This was enough to prove that [her]2939-her approbation need not be doubted : and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , rejoicing that such an effusion was heard only by [herself]93-elizabeth , soon went away . But before [she]93-elizabeth had been three minutes in [[her]93-elizabeth own room]1580-her own room , [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother followed [her]93-elizabeth .

" [[My]261-her mother dearest child]5321-my dearest child , "[261-her mother] [she]261-her mother cried , " [I]261-her mother can think of nothing else ! Ten thousand a year , and very likely more ! ' Tis as good as [a Lord]5322-a lord ! And a special licence . [You]5321-my dearest child must and shall be married by a special licence . But [[my]261-her mother dearest love]5323-my dearest love , tell [me]261-her mother what dish [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy is particularly fond of , that [I]261-her mother may have it to - morrow . "[261-her mother]

This was a sad omen of what [[her]93-elizabeth mother]261-her mother 's behaviour to [the gentleman]306-the gentleman [himself]306-the gentleman might be ; and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth found , that though in the certain possession of [his]306-the gentleman warmest affection , and secure of [[her]93-elizabeth relations]588-her relations ' consent , there was still something to be wished for . But the morrow passed off much better than [she]93-elizabeth expected ; for [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet luckily stood in such awe of [[her]96-mrs. bennet intended son - in - law]2945-her intended son - in - law , that [she]96-mrs. bennet ventured not to speak to [him]306-the gentleman , unless it was in [her]96-mrs. bennet power to offer [him]306-the gentleman any attention , or mark [her]96-mrs. bennet deference for [his]306-the gentleman opinion .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had the satisfaction of seeing [[her]93-elizabeth father]264-her father taking pains to get acquainted with [him]306-the gentleman ; and [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet soon assured [her]93-elizabeth that [he]306-the gentleman was rising every hour in [his]306-the gentleman esteem .

" [I]86-mr. bennet admire all [[my]86-mr. bennet three sons - in - law]5324-my three sons - in - law highly , "[86-mr. bennet] said [he]86-mr. bennet . " [Wickham]156-wickham , perhaps , is [my]86-mr. bennet favourite ; but [I]86-mr. bennet think [I]86-mr. bennet shall like _ [[your]93-elizabeth _ husband]5325-your _ husband quite as well as [Jane]94-jane 's . "[86-mr. bennet]

CHAPTER XVIII .

[Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's spirits soon rising to playfulness again , [she]93-elizabeth wanted [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy to account for [his]100-mr. darcy having ever fallen in love with [her]93-elizabeth . " How could [you]93-elizabeth begin ? "[93-elizabeth] said [she]93-elizabeth . " [I]93-elizabeth can comprehend [your]93-elizabeth going on charmingly , when [you]93-elizabeth had once made a beginning ; but what could set [you]93-elizabeth off in the first place ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth can not fix on the hour , or the spot , or the look , or the words , which laid the foundation . It is too long ago . [I]93-elizabeth was in the middle before [I]93-elizabeth knew that [I]93-elizabeth _ had _ begun . "[93-elizabeth]

" [My]93-elizabeth beauty [you]93-elizabeth had early withstood , and as for [my]93-elizabeth manners -- [my]93-elizabeth behaviour to _ [you]93-elizabeth _ was at least always bordering on the uncivil , and [I]93-elizabeth never spoke to [you]93-elizabeth without rather wishing to give [you]93-elizabeth pain than not . Now be sincere ; did [you]93-elizabeth admire [me]93-elizabeth for [my]93-elizabeth impertinence ? "[93-elizabeth]

" For the liveliness of [your]93-elizabeth mind , [I]93-elizabeth did . "[93-elizabeth]

" [You]93-elizabeth may as well call it impertinence at once . It was very little less . The fact is , that [you]93-elizabeth were sick of civility , of deference , of officious attention . [You]93-elizabeth were disgusted with [the women who were always speaking and looking , and thinking for _ [your]93-elizabeth _ approbation alone]5326-the women who were always speaking and looking , and thinking for _ your _ approbation alone . [I]93-elizabeth roused , and interested [you]93-elizabeth , because [I]93-elizabeth was so unlike _ [them]5326-the women who were always speaking and looking , and thinking for _ your _ approbation alone _ . Had [you]93-elizabeth not been really amiable [you]93-elizabeth would have hated [me]93-elizabeth for it ; but in spite of the pains [you]93-elizabeth took to disguise [yourself]93-elizabeth , [your]93-elizabeth feelings were always noble and just ; and in [your]93-elizabeth heart , [you]93-elizabeth thoroughly despised [the persons who so assiduously courted [you]93-elizabeth]5327-the persons who so assiduously courted you . There -- [I]93-elizabeth have saved [you]93-elizabeth the trouble of accounting for it ; and really , all things considered , [I]93-elizabeth begin to think it perfectly reasonable . To be sure , [you]93-elizabeth knew no actual good of [me]93-elizabeth -- but [nobody]3098-nobody thinks of _ that _ when [they]3098-nobody fall in love . "[93-elizabeth]

" Was there no good in [your]93-elizabeth affectionate behaviour to [Jane]94-jane , while [she]94-jane was ill at [Netherfield]2-netherfield ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [Dearest Jane]240-jane ! who could have done less for [her]94-jane ? But make a virtue of it by all means . [My]93-elizabeth good qualities are under [your]93-elizabeth protection , and [you]93-elizabeth are to exaggerate them as much as possible ; and , in return , it belongs to [me]93-elizabeth to find occasions for teazing and quarrelling with [you]93-elizabeth as often as may be ; and [I]93-elizabeth shall begin directly by asking [you]93-elizabeth what made [you]93-elizabeth so unwilling to come to the point at last . What made [you]93-elizabeth so shy of [me]93-elizabeth , when [you]93-elizabeth first called , and afterwards dined [here]3019-here ? Why , especially , when [you]93-elizabeth called , did [you]93-elizabeth look as if [you]93-elizabeth did not care about [me]93-elizabeth ? "[93-elizabeth]

" Because [you]93-elizabeth were grave and silent , and gave [me]93-elizabeth no encouragement . "[93-elizabeth]

" But [I]93-elizabeth was embarrassed . "[93-elizabeth]

" And so was [I.]93-elizabeth "[93-elizabeth]

" [You]93-elizabeth might have talked to [me]93-elizabeth more when [you]93-elizabeth came to dinner . "[93-elizabeth]

" [A man who had felt less]5330-a man who had felt less , might . "[93-elizabeth]

" How unlucky that [you]93-elizabeth should have a reasonable answer to give , and that [I]93-elizabeth should be so reasonable as to admit it ! But [I]93-elizabeth wonder how long [you]93-elizabeth _ would _ have gone on , if [you]93-elizabeth had been left to [yourself]93-elizabeth . [I]93-elizabeth wonder when [you]93-elizabeth _ would _ have spoken , if [I]93-elizabeth had not asked [you]93-elizabeth ! [My]93-elizabeth resolution of thanking [you]93-elizabeth for [your]93-elizabeth kindness to [Lydia]95-lydia had certainly great effect . _ Too much _ , [I]93-elizabeth am afraid ; for what becomes of the moral , if [our]5331-our comfort springs from a breach of promise , for [I]93-elizabeth ought not to have mentioned the subject ? This will never do . "[93-elizabeth]

" [You]93-elizabeth need not distress [yourself]93-elizabeth . The moral will be perfectly fair . [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine 's unjustifiable endeavours to separate [us]5331-our , were the means of removing all [my]93-elizabeth doubts . [I]93-elizabeth am not indebted for [my]93-elizabeth present happiness to [your]93-elizabeth eager desire of expressing [your]93-elizabeth gratitude . [I]93-elizabeth was not in a humour to wait for any opening of [your]93-elizabeth 's . [[My]93-elizabeth aunt]3208-my aunt 's intelligence had given [me]93-elizabeth hope , and [I]93-elizabeth was determined at once to know every thing . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine has been of infinite use , which ought to make [her]97-lady catherine happy , for [she]97-lady catherine loves to be of use . But tell [me]93-elizabeth , what did [you]93-elizabeth come down to [Netherfield]2-netherfield for ? Was it merely to ride to [Longbourn]7-longbourn and be embarrassed ? or had [you]93-elizabeth intended any more serious consequence ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [My]93-elizabeth real purpose was to see _ [you]93-elizabeth _ , and to judge , if [I]93-elizabeth could , whether [I]93-elizabeth might ever hope to make [you]93-elizabeth love [me]93-elizabeth . [My]93-elizabeth avowed one , or what [I]93-elizabeth avowed to [myself]93-elizabeth , was to see whether [[your]93-elizabeth sister]3152-your sister were still partial to [Bingley]90-mr. bingley , and if [she]3152-your sister were , to make the confession to [him]90-mr. bingley which [I]93-elizabeth have since made . "[93-elizabeth]

" Shall [you]93-elizabeth ever have courage to announce to [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine , what is to befall [her]97-lady catherine ? "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth am more likely to want time than courage , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth . But it ought to be done , and if [you]93-elizabeth will give [me]93-elizabeth a sheet of paper , it shall be done directly . "[93-elizabeth]

" And if [I]93-elizabeth had not a letter to write [myself]93-elizabeth , [I]93-elizabeth might sit by [you]93-elizabeth , and admire the evenness of [your]93-elizabeth writing , as [another young lady]5334-another young lady once did . But [I]93-elizabeth have [an aunt]5335-an aunt , too , who must not be longer neglected . "[93-elizabeth]

From an unwillingness to confess how much [her]2947-her intimacy with [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy had been over - rated , [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had never yet answered [Mrs. Gardiner]141-mrs. gardiner 's long letter , but now , having _ that _ to communicate which [she]93-elizabeth knew would be most welcome , [she]93-elizabeth was almost ashamed to find , that [[her]93-elizabeth uncle]583-her uncle and [aunt]3947-aunt had already lost three days of happiness , and immediately wrote as follows :

" [I]93-elizabeth would have thanked [you]93-elizabeth before , [[my]93-elizabeth dear aunt]3907-my dear aunt , as [I]93-elizabeth ought to have done , for [your]93-elizabeth long , kind , satisfactory , detail of particulars ; but to say the truth , [I]93-elizabeth was too cross to write . [You]93-elizabeth supposed more than really existed . But _ now _ suppose as much as [you]93-elizabeth chuse ; give a loose to [your]93-elizabeth fancy , indulge [your]93-elizabeth imagination in every possible flight which the subject will afford , and unless [you]93-elizabeth believe [me]93-elizabeth actually married , [you]93-elizabeth can not greatly err . [You]93-elizabeth must write again very soon , and praise [him]583-her uncle a great deal more than [you]93-elizabeth did in [your]93-elizabeth last . [I]93-elizabeth thank [you]93-elizabeth , again and again , for not going to [the Lakes]34-the lakes . How could [I]93-elizabeth be so silly as to wish it ! [Your]93-elizabeth idea of the ponies is delightful . [We]5337-we will go round [the Park]1342-the park every day . [I]93-elizabeth am [the happiest creature in [the world]323-the world]2757-the happiest creature in the world . Perhaps [other people]3860-other people have said so before , but [not one with such justice]5342-not one with such justice . [I]93-elizabeth am happier even than [Jane]240-jane ; [she]240-jane only smiles , [I]93-elizabeth laugh . [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy sends [you]93-elizabeth all the love in [the world]323-the world , that [he]100-mr. darcy can spare from [me]93-elizabeth . [You]93-elizabeth are all to come to [Pemberley]12-pemberley at Christmas .[93-elizabeth]

[Your]2950-your 's , & c. "[93-elizabeth]

[Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy 's letter to [Lady Catherine]97-lady catherine , was in a different style ; and still different from either , was what [Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet sent to [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins , in reply to [his]149-mr. collins last .

" [DEAR SIR]672-dear sir , "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]86-mr. bennet must trouble [you]672-dear sir once more for congratulations . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth will soon be [the wife of [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy]5152-the wife of mr. darcy . [Console Lady Catherine]241-lady catherine as well as [you]672-dear sir can . But , if [I]86-mr. bennet were [you]672-dear sir , [I]86-mr. bennet would stand by [the nephew]2862-the nephew . [He]2862-the nephew has more to give . "[86-mr. bennet]

" [Your]672-dear sir 's sincerely , & c. "[102-miss bingley]

[Miss Bingley]102-miss bingley 's congratulations to [[her]102-miss bingley brother]3126-her brother , on [his]3126-her brother approaching marriage , were all that was affectionate and insincere . [She]102-miss bingley wrote even to [Jane]240-jane on the occasion , to express [her]102-miss bingley delight , and repeat all [her]102-miss bingley former professions of regard . [Jane]240-jane was not deceived , but [she]240-jane was affected ; and though feeling no reliance on [her]240-jane , could not help writing [her]240-jane a much kinder answer than [she]240-jane knew was deserved .

The joy which [Miss Darcy]139-miss darcy expressed on receiving similar information , was as sincere as [[her]139-miss darcy brother]3126-her brother 's in sending it . Four sides of paper were insufficient to contain all [her]139-miss darcy delight , and all [her]139-miss darcy earnest desire of being loved by [[her]139-miss darcy sister]348-her sister .

Before any answer could arrive from [Mr. Collins]149-mr. collins , or any congratulations to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , from [[his]149-mr. collins wife]251-his wife , [the Longbourn family]748-the longbourn family heard that [the Collinses]4386-the collinses were come [themselves]748-the longbourn family to [Lucas lodge]10-lucas lodge . The reason of this sudden removal was soon evident . [Lady Catherine]241-lady catherine had been rendered so exceedingly angry by the contents of [[her]241-lady catherine nephew]3571-her nephew 's letter , that [Charlotte]114-charlotte , really rejoicing in the match , was anxious to get away till the storm was blown over . At such a moment , the arrival of [[her]241-lady catherine friend]418-her friend was a sincere pleasure to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , though in the course of [their]2959-their meetings [she]93-elizabeth must sometimes think the pleasure dearly bought , when [she]93-elizabeth saw [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy exposed to all the parading and obsequious civility of [[her]241-lady catherine husband]276-her husband . [He]100-mr. darcy bore it however with admirable calmness . [He]100-mr. darcy could even listen to [Sir William Lucas]91-sir william , when [he]91-sir william complimented [him]91-sir william on carrying away the brightest jewel of [the country]460-the country , and expressed [his]91-sir william hopes of [their]2959-their all meeting frequently at [St. James 's]11-st. james , with very decent composure . If [he]100-mr. darcy did shrug [his]100-mr. darcy shoulders , it was not till [Sir William]91-sir william was out of sight .

[Mrs. Philips]127-mrs. philips 's vulgarity was another , and perhaps a greater tax on [his]100-mr. darcy forbearance ; and though [Mrs. Philips]127-mrs. philips , as well as [[her]127-mrs. philips sister]348-her sister , stood in too much awe of [him]100-mr. darcy to speak with the familiarity which [Bingley]102-miss bingley 's good humour encouraged , yet , whenever [she]127-mrs. philips _ did _ speak , [she]127-mrs. philips must be vulgar . Nor was [her]127-mrs. philips respect for [him]100-mr. darcy , though it made [her]127-mrs. philips more quiet , at all likely to make [her]127-mrs. philips more elegant . [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth did all [she]93-elizabeth could , to shield [him]100-mr. darcy from the frequent notice of either , and was ever anxious to keep [him]100-mr. darcy to [herself]93-elizabeth , and to [those of [[her]93-elizabeth family]905-her family with whom [he]100-mr. darcy might converse without mortification]2963-those of her family with whom he might converse without mortification ; and though the uncomfortable feelings arising from all this took from the season of courtship much of its pleasure , it added to the hope of the future ; and [she]93-elizabeth looked forward with delight to the time when [they]2965-they should be removed from society so little pleasing to either , to all the comfort and elegance of [[their]2965-they family]2499-their family party at [Pemberley]12-pemberley .

CHAPTER XIX .

Happy for all [her]127-mrs. philips maternal feelings was the day on which [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet got rid of [[her]127-mrs. philips two most deserving daughters]2967-her two most deserving daughters . With what delighted pride [she]127-mrs. philips afterwards visited [Mrs. Bingley]242-mrs. bingley and talked of [Mrs. Darcy]139-miss darcy may be guessed . [I]7-longbourn wish [I]7-longbourn could say , for the sake of [[her]127-mrs. philips family]905-her family , that the accomplishment of [her]127-mrs. philips earnest desire in the establishment of so many of [[her]127-mrs. philips children]1010-her children , produced so happy an effect as to make [her]127-mrs. philips [a sensible , amiable , well - informed woman]2970-a sensible , amiable , well - informed woman for the rest of [her]127-mrs. philips life ; though perhaps it was lucky for [[her]127-mrs. philips husband]276-her husband , who might not have relished domestic felicity in so unusual a form , that [she]127-mrs. philips still was occasionally nervous and invariably silly .

[Mr. Bennet]86-mr. bennet missed [[his]86-mr. bennet second daughter]260-his second daughter exceedingly ; [his]86-mr. bennet affection for [her]260-his second daughter drew [him]86-mr. bennet oftener from [home]3223-home than any thing else could do . [He]86-mr. bennet delighted in going to [Pemberley]12-pemberley , especially when [he]86-mr. bennet was least expected .

[Mr. Bingley]90-mr. bingley and [Jane]240-jane remained at [Netherfield]2-netherfield only a twelvemonth . So near a vicinity to [[her]260-his second daughter mother]261-her mother and [Meryton]9-meryton relations was not desirable even to _ [his]86-mr. bennet _ easy temper , or _ [her]127-mrs. philips _ affectionate heart . The darling wish of [[his]86-mr. bennet sisters]303-his sisters was then gratified ; [he]86-mr. bennet bought [an estate in [a neighbouring county]2977-a neighbouring county to [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]2976-an estate in a neighbouring county to derbyshire , and [Jane]240-jane and [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , in addition to every other source of happiness , were within thirty miles of [each other]3157-each other .

[Kitty]241-lady catherine , to [her]241-lady catherine very material advantage , spent the chief of [her]241-lady catherine time with [[her]241-lady catherine two elder sisters]2578-her two elder sisters . In society so superior to what [she]241-lady catherine had generally known , [her]241-lady catherine improvement was great . [She]241-lady catherine was not of so ungovernable a temper as [Lydia]95-lydia , and , removed from the influence of [Lydia]95-lydia 's example , [she]241-lady catherine became , by proper attention and management , less irritable , less ignorant , and less insipid . From the farther disadvantage of [Lydia]95-lydia 's society [she]241-lady catherine was of course carefully kept , and though [Mrs. Wickham]229-mrs. wickham frequently invited [her]241-lady catherine to come and stay with [her]241-lady catherine , with the promise of balls and [young men]2980-young men , [[her]241-lady catherine father]264-her father would never consent to [her]241-lady catherine going .

[Mary]98-mary was [the only daughter who remained at [home]3223-home]2982-the only daughter who remained at home ; and [she]98-mary was necessarily drawn from the pursuit of accomplishments by [Mrs. Bennet]96-mrs. bennet 's being quite unable to sit alone . [Mary]98-mary was obliged to mix more with [the world]323-the world , but [she]98-mary could still moralize over every morning visit ; and as [she]98-mary was no longer mortified by comparisons between [[her]98-mary sisters]3048-her sisters ' beauty and [her]98-mary own , it was suspected by [[her]98-mary father]264-her father that [she]98-mary submitted to the change without much reluctance .

As for [Wickham]229-mrs. wickham and [Lydia]95-lydia , [[their]2987-their characters]2988-their characters suffered no revolution from the marriage of [[her]98-mary sisters]3048-her sisters . [He]264-her father bore with philosophy the conviction that [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth must now become acquainted with whatever of [his]264-her father ingratitude and falsehood had before been unknown to [her]93-elizabeth ; and in spite of every thing , was not wholly without hope that [Darcy]139-miss darcy might yet be prevailed on to make [his]264-her father fortune . The congratulatory letter which [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth received from [Lydia]95-lydia on [her]95-lydia marriage , explained to [her]93-elizabeth that , by [[his]264-her father wife]251-his wife at least , if not by [himself]264-her father , such a hope was cherished . The letter was to this effect :

" [[MY]93-elizabeth DEAR [LIZZY]93-elizabeth]5316-my dear lizzy , "[93-elizabeth]

" [I]93-elizabeth wish [you]93-elizabeth joy . If [you]93-elizabeth love [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy half as well as [I]93-elizabeth do [[my]93-elizabeth dear]3018-my dear [Wickham]229-mrs. wickham , [you]93-elizabeth must be very happy . It is a great comfort to have [you]93-elizabeth so rich , and when [you]93-elizabeth have nothing else to do , [I]93-elizabeth hope [you]93-elizabeth will think of [us]5349-us . [I]93-elizabeth am sure [Wickham]229-mrs. wickham would like a place at [court]5350-court very much , and [I]93-elizabeth do not think [we]5349-us shall have quite money enough to live upon without some help . [Any place]5351-any place would do , of about three or four hundred a year ; but , however , do not speak to [Mr. Darcy]100-mr. darcy about it , if [you]93-elizabeth had rather not . "[93-elizabeth]

" [Yours]93-elizabeth , & c. "[93-elizabeth]

As it happened that [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth had _ much _ rather not , [she]93-elizabeth endeavoured in [her]93-elizabeth answer to put an end to every intreaty and expectation of the kind . Such relief , however , as it was in [her]93-elizabeth power to afford , by the practice of what might be called economy in [her]93-elizabeth own private expences , [she]93-elizabeth frequently sent [them]2991-them . It had always been evident to [her]93-elizabeth that such an income as theirs , under the direction of two persons so extravagant in [their]2992-their wants , and heedless of the future , must be very insufficient to [their]2992-their support ; and whenever [they]2992-their changed [[their]2992-their quarters]2993-their quarters , either [Jane]240-jane or [herself]240-jane were sure of being applied to , for some little assistance towards discharging [their]2992-their bills . [Their]2992-their manner of living , even when the restoration of peace dismissed [them]2992-their to [a home]2994-a home , was unsettled in the extreme . [They]2992-their were always moving from place to place in quest of a cheap situation , and always spending more than [they]2992-their ought . [His]2995-his affection for [her]93-elizabeth soon sunk into indifference ; [her]93-elizabeth 's lasted a little longer ; and in spite of [her]93-elizabeth youth and [her]93-elizabeth manners , [she]93-elizabeth retained all the claims to reputation which [her]93-elizabeth marriage had given [her]93-elizabeth .

Though [Darcy]100-mr. darcy could never receive _ [him]2995-his _ at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , yet , for [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's sake , [he]2995-his assisted [him]2995-his farther in [his]2995-his profession . [Lydia]95-lydia was occasionally [a visitor]1535-a visitor [there]325-there , when [[her]93-elizabeth husband]276-her husband was gone to enjoy [himself]276-her husband in [London]5-london or [Bath]85-bath ; and with [the Bingleys]181-the bingleys [they]2999-they both of [them]2999-they frequently staid so long , that even [Bingley]90-mr. bingley 's good humour was overcome , and [he]90-mr. bingley proceeded so far as to _ talk _ of giving [them]2999-they a hint to be gone .

[Miss Bingley]102-miss bingley was very deeply mortified by [Darcy]100-mr. darcy 's marriage ; but as [she]102-miss bingley thought it advisable to retain the right of visiting at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , [she]102-miss bingley dropt all [her]102-miss bingley resentment ; was fonder than ever of [Georgiana]175-georgiana , almost as attentive to [Darcy]175-georgiana as heretofore , and paid off every arrear of civility to [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth .

[Pemberley]12-pemberley was now [[Georgiana]175-georgiana 's [home]3223-home]3000-georgiana 's home ; and the attachment of [the sisters]504-the sisters was exactly what [Darcy]175-georgiana had hoped to see . [They]2999-they were able to love [each other]3157-each other , even as well as [they]2999-they intended . [Georgiana]175-georgiana had the highest opinion in the world of [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth ; though at first [she]175-georgiana often listened with an astonishment bordering on alarm , at [her]175-georgiana lively , sportive , manner of talking to [[her]175-georgiana brother]3126-her brother . [He]3126-her brother , who had always inspired in [herself]175-georgiana a respect which almost overcame [her]175-georgiana affection , [she]175-georgiana now saw the object of open pleasantry . [Her]175-georgiana mind received knowledge which had never before fallen in [her]175-georgiana way . By [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's instructions [she]175-georgiana began to comprehend that [a woman]3036-a woman may take liberties with [[her]3036-a woman husband]276-her husband , which [a brother]452-a brother will not always allow in [a sister]449-a sister more than ten years younger than [himself]452-a brother .

[Lady Catherine]241-lady catherine was extremely indignant on the marriage of [[her]241-lady catherine nephew]3571-her nephew ; and as [she]241-lady catherine gave way to all the genuine frankness of [her]241-lady catherine character , in [her]241-lady catherine reply to the letter which announced its arrangement , [she]241-lady catherine sent [him]3571-her nephew language so very abusive , especially of [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , that for some time all intercourse was at an end . But at length , by [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth 's persuasion , [he]3571-her nephew was prevailed on to overlook the offence , and seek a reconciliation ; and , after a little farther resistance on the part of [[his]3571-her nephew aunt]945-his aunt , [her]93-elizabeth resentment gave way , either to [her]93-elizabeth affection for [him]3571-her nephew , or [her]93-elizabeth curiosity to see how [[his]3571-her nephew wife]251-his wife conducted [herself]251-his wife ; and [she]93-elizabeth condescended to wait on [them]3012-them at [Pemberley]12-pemberley , in spite of that pollution which [[its]12-pemberley woods]3013-its woods had received , not merely from the presence of [such a mistress]3014-such a mistress , but the visits of [[her]93-elizabeth uncle]583-her uncle and aunt from [the city]3016-the city .

With [the Gardiners]182-the gardiners , [they]3012-them were always on the most intimate terms . [Darcy]175-georgiana , as well as [Elizabeth]93-elizabeth , really loved [them]3012-them ; and [they]3012-them were both ever sensible of the warmest gratitude towards [the persons who , by bringing [her]93-elizabeth into [Derbyshire]6-derbyshire]3017-the persons who , by bringing her into derbyshire , had been the means of uniting [them]3012-them .
